title: Experienced Java Developer
description:
**Overview**


We are expanding our Tech team and are looking for an experienced Java developer to join us. If you want to work with smart and ambitious people, international customers, large datasets and solve valuable problems in a small and efficient team; Burt is for you.

**You**


You are an experienced developer who enjoys solving real problems, understanding complex systems and getting things done. You’re comfortable exploring unfamiliar code and figuring things out independently, but also enjoy collaborating with others to move projects forward.


We believe programming is a craftsmanship that can be applied across languages and platforms. You share that mindset and can pick up new technologies as needed. In this role, you will primarily work with Java in a data intensive environment, building and evolving large scale database systems. We are looking for someone with experience in database architecture and query performance, particularly in high cardinality datasets. Experience working with time series data is a plus. Beyond that, we work with technologies such as Git, Ruby, Python, AWS, SQL, and TypeScript.


You have a few years of experience building and maintaining software products, especially data intensive systems, and take pride in writing clean, reliable code. You’re pragmatic, curious, and motivated by making an impact rather than following strict processes.


We’re looking for someone based close to Gothenburg. The position is semi-remote, with regular collaboration both online and in person.

**The team**


We are a small and efficient team, which means we can avoid bureaucracy and get things done. Everyone in the team matters and has a direct impact on our customers. We constantly strive to get better and value everyone's ideas. We are a result oriented team, promoting a culture where freedom and responsibility go hand in hand.

**The role**


You will work cross functionally with product, success, and sales solving our current customer needs and building out our solutions.


A large part of your work will focus on Java services and our data platform. Customer data is spread out over hundreds of different systems, in various formats, accessed in a variety of ways. Data is downloaded, aggregated, normalised and combined into a single source of truth. You will help design, build and optimize the systems and databases that power this pipeline.


You will also participate in building the many products we provide on top of the data. Reporting, anomaly detection and forecasting are a few examples of areas you might be involved in.

**About Burt**


Burt is a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company headquartered in New York, USA with our Tech team based in Gothenburg, Sweden. We have some of the world's largest media companies on our list of customers, including Paramount, Nexstar, Yahoo, Ziff Davis, Hearst, Tripadvisor, and Vox Media.


Our core product empowers media ad sales and operations to make quick, confident decisions by giving our customers a single point of access to explore, analyze and share insights from their advertising business.

title: Backend Developer
description:
**Description**
---------------


Backend developer ***Icomera is a leading global innovator in connectivity solutions within the transportation sector. We are at the forefront of transforming public transport, making it smarter, safer, greener, and more connected than ever before. At Icomera you work with products used by many users around the world, including passengers on some of the world's largest train and bus operators.******Are you looking for a new challenge as a backend developer? Our ISS team is expanding!***  

Job type Workplace conditions Location
Full-time Hybrid/ Onsite Gothenburg, Sweden **About the Role:**
As a Backend Developer at Icomera you will be a part of a team that develops software for modern and advanced backend systems and web platforms, processing large amounts of data. The Integrated Software Solutions team focuses on developing the market leading platform for tracking and visualization of user data, giving valuable insight to customers all around the world. The product that you would be mainly working on is an innovative system for big data, and key to long-term company success. **The Team:**
The ISS team is a diverse and international group of professionals, all working together to create a best-in-class experience for our customers. With humility, a team-first mindset, and a supportive culture where everyone’s ideas are valued, we believe great results come from collaboration and trust. As we continue to grow and evolve, you’ll have the chance to take ownership, develop your skills, and make a real impact. Hop on the train and join us on the journey! **Who You Are:**
To thrive in this role, you love working with people and you enjoy working in a constantly evolving international company. Collaborating with others comes naturally to you, and you enjoy working with different stakeholders in cross functional projects. Your code is going to be used by several of the worlds largest train operator companies – having a customer centric approach to your work is on the top of your agenda. We strive towards putting together a well-oiled team that do great things together - being a team player is more important than what you know. **Key responsibilities:*** Write high-quality code with focus on performance and maintainability for modern web applications.
* Communicate with and support team members and other stakeholders within the business.
* Follow established development processes and related standards.
* Contribute to a positive working environment and help optimise performance of the team.

 **Requirements:*** Bsc / M.sc degree, in computer science, engineering physics or equivalent.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in backend development using for example Python.
* Experience in building API’s and working with SQL databases
* Fluent in writing and speaking English
* Familiarity with Kubernetes, DevOps practices and cloud services is considered meritorious but not critical
* Being able to speak Swedish is considered meritorious

 **Our Offer:*** The opportunity to work with cutting edge technology in a market leader where we design and build everything in-house—from hardware to software
* Health is important – we offer a comprehensive health benefit to our employees
* Flexible work arrangements – work from our office just around the corner from Gothenburg Central Station or work from home for up to two days a week
* Electrical bike lease agreement via net salary deduction
* ITP Pension and collective bargaining agreement
* A social work environment – board game nights, after works, seasonal parties… The list goes on!

 ***Ready to be part of something exciting and make a real difference in the connected future of transport? We’d love to hear from you!***

 **The process:**


We will be reviewing applicants ongoing. Icomera welcomes candidates from all backgrounds, and we value a diverse and inclusive work environment.


For some position we might perform a more extensive background check. We do a reference check for all positions.


Icomera is an employer with a collective agreement with TechSverige. If you have questions to our local union representatives, you may contact them at unionen@icomera.com or saco@icomera.com.

 ***About Icomera:***


Icomera is the world’s leading provider of integrated connectivity solutions for trains, trams, buses, and coaches, serving millions of passengers and tens of thousands of vehicles on a daily basis. The IcoCrew now consist of 300+ employees globally. Icomera is headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden, with main offices in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Germany, France, Ireland, and Italy.  

Icomera’s vision for green mobility within the public transport industry perfectly complements the wider mission of our parent company, Equans. As the global leader in multi-technical services with 74,000 employees working across 17 country hubs, Equans delivers customised solutions which connect, protect and energise territories, cities, buildings, industries and transport infrastructures, empowering their energy, industrial and digital transitions. Visit www.icomera.com for further information.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 High salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Front-end Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6-24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is frontend using JavaScript and TypeScript, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust frontend applications, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a teams of different sizes.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Frontend Engineer with at least 5+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* At least 5+ years of experience using JavaScript and TypeScript
* Solid skills in modern libraries and frameworks such as Next.js, React, Vue.js, Svelte, Node, NestJS, Angular, Express.js, Solid, React Native.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, temporary or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Backend developer
description:
We are looking for senior backend engineers to join us and expand our team of talented backend developers. You share a passion for building systems that delivers high business value without sacrificing maintainability, availability, scalability and quality. You will work on the backend systems that power our casino platform and help us deliver the best customer experience.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and help operate our systems
* Drive technical improvements throughout the stack
* Together with product teams deliver the best games and business solutions
* Help scale our solution to customer requirements and business opportunities


 Who you are
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience working in a mixed Java, SQL, Javascript environment
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
* You are passionate about working in an environment of continuous learning
* You are curious, driven and not afraid to take charge and improve the system and add automation where needed
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in
* You have experience from working on large Java systems and have a solid understanding of performance, scalability and availability challenges of distributed systems
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* You know your way around a modern Unix/Linux system
* Experience with modern deployment, monitoring and logging solutions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

description:

 Challenge accepted?

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Are you a ready to use your skills for something that truly matters? Maybe you’ve built countless apps, optimized endless user flows, or maintained systems that never quite made a difference in people’s lives. Now, imagine putting your skills to work for something bigger - something that actually changes how healthcare, social services, and elderly care work together in Sweden.
   

  

 We’re building a next-generation platform that will transform collaboration across these vital sectors. We are now looking for experienced Fullstack Developers, who are ready to use their craft to make a real impact.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* Meaningful mission: Directly influence the future of Swedish healthcare and social services.
* Technical Leadership: Take ownership of architecture, drive technical decisions, and mentor colleagues.
* Modern tech & AI: Work with React, TypeScript, Java, Spring Boot, Docker, Kubernetes and AI-driven development.
* Growth & collaboration: Learn from talented colleagues and have access to mentorship and growth opportunities.
* Flexible culture: Enjoy flexible working conditions and a friendly culture built on trust and care.


**The position**
 You’ll be part of an agile and innovative team, contributing throughout the entire development lifecycle — from requirements to production-ready services. Depending on your experience, you’ll either grow into the role or take a lead in driving development and mentoring others.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Develop and maintain a modern, API-first platform using test-driven and AI-assisted methods.
* Mentor and support other developers, fostering a culture of technical excellence.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (designers, product owners, domain experts) to deliver secure, scalable, and user-friendly solutions.
* Contribute to architectural decisions for scalability, performance, and security
* Stay at the forefront of technology and share your expertise with the team.


**About You**
 You are curious, eager to learn, and enjoy working with others. You thrive in an environment where you can grow your skills step by step, contribute with your ideas, and collaborate to solve problems together.
   

  

 At Cambio, we value initiative and personal growth. Our culture is built on Trust, Care, and Together values we believe are important to both our work and our people. It’s important to us that you recognize and identify with these values.
   

  

**Requirements**
* A passionate engineer with 5+ years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* Curiosity about AI and enthusiasm for exploring new technologies.
* Communicates fluently in Swedish and English


**It's a bonus**
* Experience working in our tech stack


**Additional Information**
**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping, Motala or Stockholm
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
   

  

**Form of employment** 
 : Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.
