title: Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Java Developer – E-commerce Platform** 




  





 A well-established Swedish product company within large-scale B2B e-commerce is looking to strengthen its backend team with an experienced
 **Senior Java Developer** 
 . The company operates a
 **high-traffic, business-critical e-commerce platform** 
 used daily by thousands of customers across Sweden.
 



  





 You’ll join a mature, cross-functional product team working close to the business, where quality, scalability and long-term technical decisions really matter.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 



* Designing, building and maintaining backend services for a large-scale e-commerce platform
* Developing robust Java-based solutions in a complex, transaction-heavy environment
* Working closely with product owners, architects, frontend developers and DevOps engineers
* Integrating external systems, APIs and third-party services
* Contributing to architectural discussions and technical improvements
* Taking ownership in a
 **“you build it, you run it”** 
 environment



  





**Tech environment** 



* Java (Spring / Spring Boot)
* Modern e-commerce platform (Intershop or similar)
* Microservices & REST APIs
* Cloud-based infrastructure (Azure)
* CI/CD, Git, automated testing
* Agile ways of working (Scrum/Kanban)



  





**What they’re looking for** 



* Several years of experience as a Java backend developer
* Experience from e-commerce, retail, logistics, or other transaction-intensive systems
* Strong understanding of backend architecture, integrations and APIs
* Comfortable working in cloud-based environments
* A collaborative mindset and interest in working close to the business domain



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience with Intershop
* Exposure to containers (Docker/Kubernetes)
* Monitoring and observability tools
* DevOps mindset and interest in operational responsibility



  





**What’s on offer** 



* Permanent role in a
 **stable, long-term product organisation**
* Modern tech stack and meaningful, business-critical systems
* Hybrid working model (Stockholm-based)
* Competitive salary and strong benefits package
* A collaborative culture with high technical standards and low ego

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has an always-on mindset with a strong background in designing, configuring, and managing solutions for devices, tools, and applications in a factory/corporate setting.
   

  

 If you are a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Understand and reflect on the customer needs to bring value to the organization.
* Take part in the development cycle using innovative technologies and frameworks.
* Secure qualitative, efficient and performance deliveries.
* Provide input for the design and construction of test cases and scenarios and help validate executed test results.
* Contribute to boosting the team to continually increase knowledge, competence, performance, and innovation
* Collaborate with suppliers, architects, engineers, developers, and internal stakeholders on upcoming and innovative technologies and standardization.
* Collaborate with the local IT site teams for problem/opportunity analysis.


**Qualifications**
* Hold a bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science or equivalent experience in a relevant field.
* Knowledge and experience in agile development practices, ITIL (incident, problem & change process), collaboration tools (such as Azure DevOps or similar)
* Java development & support, relational databases (Oracle, SQL server, My SQL).
* Eager to learn and grow (yourself and the company) using a modern approach to Software Engineering.
* Ability to work under rapidly changing conditions and have the capability to identify, mitigate and decide on solutions when facing obstacles.
* You are fluent in English, both verbally and written.
* You should have a general understanding of production processes and understand how all these things work together to make end user applications work well.
* Knowledge of the automotive industry is meritorious.


**Experience**
* Knowledge about databases (MS SQL (Azure))
* Development platforms (Java, OpenShift, ...)
* Azure Cloud (App services, AKS Azure Kubernetes Cluster)
* SQL server for database
* Azure Storage, Azure Container Services
* Frameworks (Spring, Springboot, WebFlux, ...)
* Messaging (MQ, Kafka, REST API, ...)
* Front-end (Angular)
* Test Driven Development (Unit testing in Spring Boot and Angular, in memory database testing using Mockito)
* Agile processes (Safe / Scrum / ADO) but also about backlog management, strategic planning, business relationship management, problem analysis and business modelling.
* Bonus points for having relevant experience using docker containers and orchestration with Kubernetes.


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
* Expleo Academy - enables you to acquire and develop the right skills by delivering a suite of accredited training courses
* Always working as one team, our people are not afraid to think big and challenge the status quo
* Collective agreement with the union
* Access to a collection of benefits and discounted prices on services and shops.
* Health benefits
* Expleo team activities


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Fullstack Developer - Python
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Strong skills in PythonSolid backend development experience in production systems
* Experience building and maintaining APIs, integrations, and database logic
* Good understanding of secure coding and development practices
* Working according to established security routines and policies
* Experience with Git and modern development workflows (CI/CD)
* Comfortable working in console-based and Unix environments


**Meritorious**
* Experience with PHP
* JavaScript and frontend libraries (e.g., Nodejs, Vue)


**Application deadline:** 
 27-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Design Engineer (Web & Brand)
description:
TL;DR - We’re seeking an exceptional Design Engineer to help us communicate the future of AI. You’ll work closely with design and marketing to build world-class web content helping empower the next generation of creators and builders.
   

  

 Why Lovable?
   

  

 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. Solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We’re at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, solve complex problems, and bring their dreams to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.
   

  

 What we’re looking for
   

  

* 5+ years of years experience, shipping web experiences users genuinely love
* Portfolio demonstrating landing pages and advanced web interactions (if you don’t have a portfolio of landing pages - check out our other roles)
* Ability to make smart trade-offs between speed and polish, knowing when to ship and when to refine
* Expertise in frontend, either as a front-end developer or a designer who ships
* Experience translating scrappy explorations into production-ready experiences
* Strong design sense with an eye for detail, accessibility, and usability
* Ideally - you push the boundaries of the web with technologies like WebGL


 What you’ll do
   

  

 In one sentence: Own and elevate landing pages and web experiences that help share Lovable with the world.
   

  

* Build landing pages that delight, also designing interactions or pairing closely with designers
* Implement web interactions in React/TypeScript with obsessive attention to performance, responsiveness, and cross-browser consistency
* Drive front-end execution - pioneering new interaction patterns, micro-animations, and delightful details that elevate the entire experience
* Collaborate with marketing, helping share Lovable with the world
* Explore and iterate on visual designs with designers, translating explorations into scalable, web-native implementations
* Build and maintain reusable components that enhance consistency while enabling creativity across both product and marketing


 Our tech stack
   

  

 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React, Tailwind
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, , infra-as-code (Terraform)


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

 How we hire
   

  

* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with recruiter.
* Show us some of your work you’re really proud of.
* Show us how you approach problems during several technical interviews.
* In some cases, we may opt to do paid, trial work.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal
* For this role, we're prioritising candidates based in Stockholm and London, however we'd consider remote for truly exceptional applicants

title: AI Engineer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is ideal for engineers with demonstrable skills in AI as well as for software engineers who have recently transitioned to AI and ML expertise, and offers an opportunity to develop your craft whilst working closely with clients on delivering AI solutions to real-world challenges.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are seeking an AI Engineer with a strong intuition for AI and a genuine enthusiasm in building robust, scalable solutions to power innovative digital experiences. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with a deep enthusiasm for advancing AI capabilities.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work closely with global brands on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and truly push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As an AI Engineer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Assisting our clients in clarifying their questions and determining if using AI is a suitable solution for them
* You understand the limitations of a model and how to address them within the product’s UX
* Implementing AI-as-a-Service (e.g., OpenAI, Claude LLMs) in projects; you assess when these services are a good option and understand any potential limitations
* Being familiar with pre-trained models and available datasets and the ability to apply them if existing AI services fall short for the use case at hand
* Validating, deploying, monitoring, and maintaining built models, ensuring they can be used at scale
* Developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines and machine learning workflows, optimizing for performance and reliability
* Working with diverse, cross-functional teams on projects that deliver groundbreaking AI solutions for global brands


 It’s a plus (not a requirement) if you have additional experience in:
   

  

* PyTorch, Tensorflow
* Transfer learning, few-shot learning, PEFT and LoRa
* Multi-modal transformer models, RLHF


 Who You Are
   

  

**We Value Candidates Who Demonstrate**
* Great delivery skills: Proven capability to deliver AI solutions
* Strong AI intuition: A deep understanding of AI concepts
* Curiosity: Enthusiasm for emerging technologies, creativity in problem-solving, and an eagerness to learn in a rapidly evolving AI landscape
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


**Why Umain?**
**Career Framework** 
 : We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

**Work-Life Balance** 
 : At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

**Innovations and Learning** 
 : Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

**Skills Over Degrees** 
 : We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

***Background check***
*Umain conducts a background check for final candidates in accordance with our* 
 internal policies
 *. The check is carried out only with your consent and is ordered by our CISO through our approved screening partner. The scope of the check depends on the role level. This step is performed late in the recruitment process and is used solely to support a secure and fact‑based hiring decision.*
 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Fullstack Developer - Python
description:
We are urgently looking for
 **Fullstack Developer- Python** 
 for a global telecom company in
 **Stockholm.** 




  





**Start is in ASAP, 1 years limited contract to begin with, Possibility of extension after that.** 




  





**Background:** 




 We are transitioning from a long-term consultant and need to strengthen our in-house Python expertise. As a small team managing a large number of applications, we require someone who can take ownership, drive initiatives forward, and quickly build an understanding of our systems. The consultant must be able to proactively identify and resolve future bugs or issues, ensuring stability and continuity in our delivery.
 



  





**Technical Information:** 



* Python
* MySQL
* Postgres



  





**Responsibilities & deliverables:** 




 We are looking for a senior or strong mid-level backend developer with solid Python expertise and proven experience working in production environments. The consultant should quickly understand and contribute to a large existing codebase, take responsibility for stability, automation, integrations and work independently.
 



  





**Key responsibilities include:** 



* Owning and maintaining parts of the system
* Troubleshooting, supporting operations, and monitoring automated flows
* Driving continuous improvements and ensuring system stability
* Following internal security practices and upholding high coding standards



  





**Required skills:** 



* Strong skills in Python
* Solid backend development experience in production systems
* Experience building and maintaining APIs, integrations, and database logic
* Good understanding of secure coding and development practices
* Working according to established security routines and policies
* Experience with Git and modern development workflows (CI/CD)
* Comfortable working in console-based and Unix environments
* Fluency in English is required



  





**Preferred skills:** 



* Experience with PHP
* JavaScript and frontend libraries (e.g., Nodejs, Vue)
* Swedish language knowledge



  





**Soft skills/Personality traits:** 



* **Self-driven:** 
 takes responsibility from idea through to production
* **Solution-oriented:** 
 structured problem solver who finds practical paths forward
* **Humble/Collaborative:** 
 shares knowledge and supports the team without prestige
* **Confident in their craft:** 
 capable of making informed technical decisions
* **Responsible:** 
 especially regarding security, stability, and code quality
* **Bringing an innovative mindset:** 
 identifying opportunities to improve workflows or solutions through A.I



  





 This is a full-time consultant position in
 **Stockholm** 
 through Incluso. Start is
 **ASAP** 
 ,
 **1 years** 
 limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that. This role is 100% onsite in
 **Stockholm.** 




  





 Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.
 



  





 For more information about this role, please contact
 **Kanika Singhal** 
 recruiter at Incluso.

title: Software Engineer - Jira / Confluence
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments technology, facilitating transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories, dedicated to uplifting everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 At Visa, you'll have the opportunity to create impact at scale — tackling meaningful challenges, growing your skills and seeing your contributions impact lives around the world. Join Visa and do work that matters — to you, to your community, and to the world.
   

  





 Progress starts with you.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 This is a specialized hybrid engineering role designed to evolve over time.
   

  

 In the short term, you will focus on:
   

  




* Administering and improving our internal engineering tools:
* Jira, Confluence, Slack, Google Workspace
* Managing user onboarding/offboarding and permissions
* Supporting engineering teams in troubleshooting issues with Jira & Confluence
* Improving documentation, workflows, and processes
* Implementing automation to simplify repetitive admin requests
* Ensuring the health and reliability of our shared engineering knowledge systems
* In the long term, you will grow toward:
* Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines and developer tooling
* Contributing to our internal platform used across Tink
* Working with technologies such as AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, Datadog, Buildkite, GitHub, Go, Java
* Enhancing platform reliability, observability, and developer experience
* Supporting teams in shipping scalable, secure, high‑quality services



 This role is perfect for someone strong in tooling administration today, who wants to grow into a Developer Productivity / SRE / Platform Engineering path.
   

  





 What You Will Do:
   

  




* Tooling Administration & Support (Primary focus initially)
* Own user management workflows across Jira, Confluence, Slack, Google Workspaces
* Troubleshoot issues across these systems and resolve user requests
* Maintain accurate documentation, access structures, and automation scripts
* Manage incoming tickets (Jira ServiceDesk)
* Developer Productivity & Platform Engineering (Growth path)
* Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines, internal tools, and automation
* Improve observability and operational excellence (Datadog, metrics, alerting)
* Contribute to platform capabilities used by all engineering teams
* Build infrastructure as code and work within Kubernetes‑based environments
* Help evolve our internal developer platform toward reliability, scale, and efficiency



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications:
   

  




* Relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree, Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or a PhD, OR relevant work experience.



 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  




* Experience in workstation/tooling support or backend engineering
* Strong experience with Jira, Confluence, Slack, and Google Workspaces
* Experience with onboarding/offboarding workflows
* Automation skills (scripting, APIs, workflow automation)
* Good troubleshooting and communication skills
* Ability to work cross‑functionally and independently
* (You don’t need all of these today — but you should want to grow into them.)
* Backend engineering experience in Java or Go
* Cloud experience (preferably AWS)
* Experience with CI/CD, GitHub, Buildkite, or similar tools
* Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, or Infrastructure‑as‑Code
* Observability tools (Datadog, logging, metrics)
* Experience with SRE or platform engineering practices
* Familiarity with distributed systems


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Utvecklare Dynamics 365 F&O
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Om oss**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande konsult- och managementbolag inom digital transformation med tusentals medarbetare i Norden och Europa. Vi har flera år i rad utsetts till en av “Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser” av Great Place to Work och rankas av Gartner som ett av de fem främsta företagen inom digital transformation.
   

  

 Bland annat hjälper vi företag att effektivisera och automatisera sina affärsprocesser, från ekonomi och försäljning till produktion, drift och analys. Vi är stolta över att ha byggt ett starkt erbjudande inom ERP och Business Platforms, där vi erbjuder allt från rådgivning och implementation till långsiktig förvaltning.
   

  

 Vi är på tillväxtresa! Som en del i vår tillväxt vill vi stärka vårt team inom Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP. Här får du vara med och leverera affärssystemslösningar som verkligen gör skillnad — från rådgivning och systemutveckling till implementering och långsiktig förvaltning. Nu söker vi en
 **Utvecklare Dynamics 365 F&O** 
 som vill vara med och skapa affärsvärde på riktigt.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som utvecklare i Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations kommer du att ansvara för att utveckla och integrera affärslösningar för kunder inom olika branscher. Du arbetar nära verksamhet och arkitekter för att förverkliga kundernas visioner och för att koppla samman Dynamics 365 F&O med andra system för att säkra effektiva och sömlösa affärsflöden, från första idé till färdig lösning.
   

  

**Mer konkret…**
 …kommer du att vara involverad i flera spännande projekt där du bland annat arbetar med:
   

  

* Utveckling och anpassning av funktionalitet i Dynamics 365 F&O med X++ och C#.
* Skapande och hantering av integrationer, t.ex. Azure Integration Services, för att koppla Dynamics med externa system.
* Design och hantering av integrationer (t.ex. Azure Integration Services och REST-API:er) för koppling mellan Dynamics och externa system.
* Delta i förstudier och workshops med kunder för att fånga krav och bidra till lösningsdesign.
* Testning och validering av utvecklade lösningar för att säkerställa att de möter både tekniska och verksamhetsmässiga krav.


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet som utvecklare med Dynamics 365 F&O.
* Väl insatt och bekväm med X++, C# och Azure Integration Services.
* Har erfarenhet av integrationer mellan Dynamics 365 F&O och andra system — gärna via REST API.
* Har ett starkt intresse för teknisk utveckling och för att skapa lösningar som effektiviserar affärsprocesser.


**Varför Sopra Steria?**
 Hos oss får du arbeta i en inkluderande och utvecklande miljö med några av branschens främsta experter. Vi erbjuder spännande kunduppdrag, kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och goda karriärmöjligheter – i ett bolag där människan alltid står i centrum.
   

  

 Hos Sopra Steria får du mer än ett jobb, du får en karriärresa.
   

  

* Bli en del av ett toppteam: Arbeta sida vid sida med några av marknadens mest erfarna experter inom affärssystem och integration.
* Utvecklas på riktigt: Vi satsar stort på kompetensutveckling, certifieringar och personlig utveckling.
* Jobba med projekt som utmanar: Våra kunder spänner över många branscher och våra uppdrag varierar från komplexa transformationer till nyskapande lösningar på marknadens modernaste plattformar.
* Kultur som folk faktiskt trivs i: Vi är stolta över en arbetsmiljö där kollegor stöttar varandra, idéer välkomnas och där det är roligt att gå till jobbet.


**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Apputvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som apputvecklare inom Flutter**
 Vi söker dig som vill vara med och bygga en av våra viktigaste kundkanaler – vår mobilapp för bank och försäkring. Teamen kännetecknas av samarbete, kvalitet och driv. Vi jobbar agilt, tvärfunktionellt och är en del av Skandias SAFe-tåg.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i något av våra två mobilteam som består av utvecklare, testare, mjukvaruarkitekt, produktägare, UX-designer, systemansvarig och team coach. Alla arbetar vi mot samma mål: att skapa största möjliga kundnytta. Vi ansvarar för hela kedjan från backend till frontend där vi har ett nära samarbete med verksamheten för att utveckla lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad för våra kunder. Rollen innebär också att du får bidra till andra utvecklares kompetensutveckling då vi gärna ser att du agerar som mentor vid behov.
   

  

 Alla i teamen utgår idag från vårt huvudkontor på Lindhagensgatan 86 i Stockholm. Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT Individkund AG.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Som person är du målmedveten, engagerad och värdesätter kvalitet i varje utvecklingssteg. Du har en tillitsfull och ansvarstagande inställning och sätter alltid kunden i första rum. Du trivs med att jobba i team, tar naturligt ledarskap i tekniska diskussioner och ser värdet i att dela din kunskap med andra.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har några års erfarenhet av apputveckling med Flutter. Du är van att arbeta i agila team och trivs i en miljö där du får ta ansvar och vara med och fatta tekniska beslut. Det är en fördel om du har goda ledaregenskaper och tidigare erfarenhet av att stötta andra, till exempel i en mentorroll.
   

  

 Meriterande för rollen är om du har koll på:
   

  

* Azure DevOps
* Octopus Deploy
* Couchbase
* Swift och/eller Kotlin


 Vi har dessutom påbörjat vår resa med GitHub Copilot och ser det som en självklarhet att du vill ligga i framkant inom AI-stödd systemutveckling.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet.
   

  

 Läs mer om hela vår rekryteringsprocess här.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Gunnar Bedman på gunnar.bedman@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer Talent Acquisition Partner IT på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Software Engineer – Test Automation in Payments
description:
Do you want to shape the next generation of Swedbank’s payment test automation and help secure the quality of one of the bank’s most critical domains?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Design and automate end to end payment flows, ensuring high-quality, robust test coverage across the payment lifecycle.
* Take part in the largest transformation of Swedbank’s payment infrastructure in decades.
* Develop automated test suites to secure a modern, scalable payment platform.
* Build and maintain test automation frameworks and contribute to continuous integration and delivery pipelines for payments.
* Drive quality strategy within the team — influencing ways of working, tooling choices, and automation maturity.
* Create dashboards, monitoring scripts, and quality metrics to visualize system health for management and stakeholders.
* Be part of a cross-functional agile team in our Payments Agile Release Train that run the SAFe agile framework.
* Work closely and learn from domain experts in payments, architecture and mainframe systems.
* Develop yourself, contribute to the development of your team and the entire release train.
* Be part of a dynamic environment with cross-functional teams that share challenges and build knowledge together


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Strong understanding of test design techniques, automation methods, and QA tooling.
* Practical experience in coding or scripting (e.g., Java, Python, or similar) for automation development.
* Work experience from the payment domain is an advantage.
* Experience from ongoing initiatives such as ISO20022, Bank/plusgiro transformation, SEPA or similar is helpful.
* A team player with good collaboration and communication skills.
* Experience from agile ways of working, e.g. SAFe, scrum etc.
* Ability to communicate with IT and business stakeholders to reach a common understanding of the work that needs to be done.
* A driven, proactive, self-organized and an analytical approach with a strife to continuously improve.
* Proficient in English, spoken and written.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 be part of the largest transformation of the payments area in decades. Learn a critical area for the bank and help building our new future infrastructure for payments. Work in an open atmosphere based on collaboration, curiosity and building knowledge.”
 **Mozhdeh Kamel, your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 28.02.2026.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sundbyberg
   

  

**Recruiting manager:** 
 Mozhdeh Kamel
   

  

 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
**Swedbank does not discriminate to anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.**

title: Embedded Software Developer
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

**Would you like to develop global software solutions used across all TRATON brands, working close to both customers and advanced technology? Join us and shape the future of propulsion control systems.**
**Role Summary**
 In this role, you will solve complex physical and hardware-related challenges by developing advanced software that delivers a powerful, smooth, and robust powertrain, while also ensuring long hardware lifetime and reliability.
   

  

 Our work involves extensive vehicle testing, and your ideas will be developed through short, iterative development cycles. We foster a culture that encourages innovation, creativity, and thinking beyond conventional solutions.
   

  

 Safety is a key part of our responsibility. We work extensively with functional safety concepts for different driving scenarios — both with and without a driver — in accordance with ISO 26262. You will also contribute by formulating clear, testable requirements that meet both regulatory demands and customer expectations.
   

  

**About The Team**
 We develop embedded software for TRATON-developed gearboxes and actuators within the propulsion domain. We are now looking for a new team member to strengthen our work with gear change control.
   

  

 We are a team that collaborates closely to deliver high quality, reliable products together. We take pride in challenging what seems impossible and turning complex problems into clear, solvable tasks.
   

  

 You will join a supportive environment where coaching, team development, and personal growth are part of our everyday work. We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to develop their skills, contribute with their strengths, and influence the solutions we build.
   

  

**Your Profile**
 Must have
   

  

  

* A degree in engineering, with a background in software, mechatronics, or electrical systems development
* Several years of experience in embedded systems, preferably within the automotive industry
* Strong knowledge of MATLAB/Simulink and C and/or Python
* A valid European category B driver’s license, as vehicle testing is a continuous part of the role


 Nice to have
   

  

  

* Experience working with ISO 26262 or similar certification processes
* Experience in requirements specification for embedded systems
* Knowledge of or experience with TRATON powertrain development


**What We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-03-10. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Karin Avatare , Recruiting Manager Karin.avatare@scania.com , TGRAMFT – Unit Transmission Control Functions
   

  

 Motion Control
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Junior Build Engineer
description:
Are you a systems engineer in the early years of your game development career? Do you enjoy working to improve efficiency, workflows and developer experience? Would you like to work in a small and creative team where you can be a force multiplier to everyone’s efforts? Keep reading!
 



  





**About us:** 




 OFFEE STAIN NORTH is a small game developer based in Stockholm that belongs to the Coffee Stain Group. Since the company was founded in 2013, we have grown to 35 employees and are now open to adding a couple of new friends!
 



  





*Goat Simulator 3 is a third-person sandbox adventure developed by Coffee Stain North in which the player can live out their wildest dreams... as a goat. Released in 2022, this open-world sandbox game takes the chaotic spirit of the original to new heights and offers expanded multiplayer support, a larger and more detailed environment, and even more absurd physics-driven gameplay. Players can explore the island of San Angora solo or with friends, wreaking havoc as a goat (or one of many unlockable characters) through a wide range of quests, mini-games, and bizarre encounters.* 




  





*Understanding games like Goat Simulator 3 means appreciating the fine line between "broken" and "brilliant." If that sounds like your kind of energy, come and get to know our herd!* 




  





**The role:** 




 As a build engineer at Coffee Stain North, you will be working with the systems that build and release Goat Simulator 3 to the world, and to the development team. You will manage the build pipelines and agents, optimise build times, and support the team with improving automated workflows. We believe you are in the first years of your game development career, interested in user and developer experience, and proficient in programming and scripting. We hope you enjoy looking at systems with an improvement mindset and making things better.
 



  





**You will:** 



* Manage and develop a TeamCity instance that builds games for almost a dozen platforms
* Take responsibility for continuous integration workflows
* Support the team with internal deployments, playtests and live releases
* Collaborate with other members of Coffee Stain Group
* Develop and iterate on Kotlin and Python build scripts



  





**Your background** 




 To succeed in this role we see that you have at least 1 year’s experience of professional game development and have worked with Unreal Engine (4 or 5). Furthermore, we see that you have experience from working with Perforce VCS and with automated continuous integration systems, such as TeamCity, Jenkins or Horde.
 



  





 If you also have experience from working with the following, it is meritorious:
 


* Proficiency in C++ or C#
* Proficiency in Python, Powershell, or bash
* Experience working with or releasing for game console systems
* Experience of at least one full release cycle



  





 At CSN we have employees from different parts of the world, and it’s therefore mandatory to be fluent in English, both verbally and in writing.
 



  





**Perks of working at Coffee Stain** 




 We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits that go beyond the usual payments to your pension fund and insurances.
 


* We believe that a healthy body leads to a healthy mind, so on top of the wellness grant you get some paid time off to work out. Did we mention there are several gyms right beside our office?
* Every fourth week it’s creative Friday which lets your inner passion blossom.
* To have fun together and get inspired, we play games on the clock every fourth Friday.
* We also have great parental benefits, including extra pay on top of what you get from the social insurance agency during your parental leave.
* And, of course, you will be part of a wonderful team of colleagues working on an exciting high-profile project.



  





**Practical info** 




 The position is permanent, full-time, 40 hours per week. We have a hybrid setup and offer the possibility of working from home two days per week. Our office is newly renovated, and located in Kungsholmen, Fridhemsplan. We have, among other things, a ping-pong table, a big lounge area where we hang out, watch movies, or play games together, and last but not least – a giant goat statue (what more do you need?).
 



  





 Apart from us, the Coffee Stain Group consists of a myriad of successful studios, among them COFFEE STAIN STUDIOS (Sanctum and Satisfactory), Ghost Ship Games (Deep Rock Galactic), Tuxedo Labs (Teardown) and COFFEE STAIN PUBLISHING who work with close partners like Iron Gate (Valheim), to name a few.
 



  





**Your application** 




 If you are interested, please apply! Due to GDPR, we can’t accept applications through email. If you have any questions regarding the role, please reach out to Maria Sjöman, HR, maria.sjoman@coffeestain.com.

title: Fullstack Developer - Python
description:
**Background:**
 We are transitioning from a long-term consultant and need to strengthen our in-house Python expertise. As a small team managing a large number of applications, we require someone who can take ownership, drive initiatives forward, and quickly build an understanding of our systems. The consultant must be able to proactively identify and resolve future bugs or issues, ensuring stability and continuity in our delivery.
   

  

**Technical Information:**
* Python
* MySQL
* Postgres


**Responsibilities & deliverables:**
 We are looking for a senior or strong mid-level backend developer with solid Python expertise and proven experience working in production environments. The consultant should quickly understand and contribute to a large existing codebase, take responsibility for stability, automation, integrations and work independently.
   

  

**Key responsibilities include:**
* Owning and maintaining parts of the system
* Troubleshooting, supporting operations, and monitoring automated flows
* Driving continuous improvements and ensuring system stability
* Following internal security practices and upholding high coding standards


**Required skills:**
* Strong skills in Python
* Solid backend development experience in production systems
* Experience building and maintaining APIs, integrations, and database logic
* Good understanding of secure coding and development practices
* Working according to established security routines and policies
* Experience with Git and modern development workflows (CI/CD)
* Comfortable working in console-based and Unix environments


**Preferred skills:**
* Experience with PHP
* JavaScript and frontend libraries (e.g., Nodejs, Vue)


**Soft skills/Personality traits:**
* Self-driven: takes responsibility from idea through to production
* Solution-oriented: structured problem solver who finds practical paths forward
* Humble/Collaborative: shares knowledge and supports the team without prestige
* Confident in their craft: capable of making informed technical decisions
* Responsible: especially regarding security, stability, and code quality
* Bringing an innovative mindset: identifying opportunities to improve workflows or solutions through A.I

title: Solution Architect
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.*
*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow.*
*At Stegra, we’re not just building a plant, we’re proving that sustainable industry is possible. And to do that, we need people like you.*
*Join a team where safety comes first. Where we support each other, learn as we go, and make space for everyone to grow and contribute. This is your chance to be part of something big - while being closer to nature and leading a balanced, purposeful life.*
**What You’ll Do**
 Right now, we are looking for a Solution Architect to join our Digital HR and Finance team. In this role, you will report to our Digital Domain Manager and be part of the Digital Enterprise function. You will join a supportive, collaborative environment where we create modern and reliable digital capabilities for our HR and Finance functions.
   

  

 This role is a great fit for you who have several years of experience as a software developer, especially within backend development, and feel ready to grow into a Solution Architect role. At Stegra, you will have the valuable opportunity to develop into the role together with guidance and close collaboration from our Digital Enterprise Architect. We believe that thoughtful architecture grows from people who understand how digital solutions are built, and your development background will be a strong starting point as you take on a broader, more strategic perspective.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate closely with colleagues across both business and technical teams. Together, you will explore needs from HR and Finance and turn them into well-designed, future ready technical solutions. Your work will help create architectures that support simplicity, scalability and long-term maintainability.
   

  

 While you will not focus on writing production code every day, you will be involved in defining backend patterns, supporting development teams and helping align our digital solutions with Stegra’s guiding principles.
   

  

**Your day-to-day work will include, but not be limited to:**
* Exploring needs together with HR and Finance teams and shaping them into clear, well-structured technical concepts
* Supporting the creation of backend patterns and solution designs that are scalable, intuitive and aligned with Stegra’s digital principles
* Breaking down broader problem areas into understandable technical building blocks, roadmaps and development tasks
* Collaborating closely with developers to ensure shared understanding of architectural choices and helping teams move forward with confidence
* Contributing to integration approaches, data flow designs and API structures that enable smooth communication between systems
* Ensuring that security, data protection and access control are naturally embedded in the design of every solution
* Working across domains to make sure our technical solutions reflect real business needs and contribute to smooth, intuitive workflows
* Engaging regularly with stakeholders to create shared understanding of needs, decisions and expected outcomes
* Working closely with our Digital Enterprise Architect and learning how architectural decisions connect to the larger enterprise landscape


**What You’ll Bring**
 You are analytical, curious and motivated by creating solutions that work in real life. You enjoy turning complexity into something understandable, and you help others navigate technical decisions with clarity and confidence. You bring a collaborative communication style, and you appreciate environments where people support one another and learn together. You are excited about stepping into a role where you can grow your architectural skills while keeping your technical thinking sharp.
   

  

**Specific to this role, we would like to see that you can tick off a fair amount of the boxes below:**
* A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or equivalent experience
* Several years of experience as a backend developer, with curiosity to grow into a broader architectural role
* Experience contributing to the design or improvement of backend solutions, including APIs or microservice-based systems
* Comfort breaking down complex needs into structured, understandable documentation or technical steps
* Experience in a lead, coaching, Scrum Master or similar supporting role within a development team
* A general understanding of frontend, backend and infrastructure perspectives even if your core strength is backend
* Strong communication skills, able to engage across technical and business teams
* Prior experience from stakeholder collaboration, planning or providing technical direction to others
* Knowledge of HR or Finance processes is helpful, but absolutely not required
* Familiarity with architectural frameworks and tools such as ArchiMate or similar is helpful, but absolutely not required


**Benefits At Stegra**
 At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.
   

  

**Read More About Benefits At Stegra here.**
**Here’s what makes this role unique:**
 Breadth, not silos: You’ll work across multiple technical areas—backend, architecture, infrastructure, DevOps and Data—gaining deep understanding of our digital ecosystem.
   

  

 Ownership from day one: You’ll support a specific domain and act as a bridge between operations and tech, and drive solutions all the way from need to implementation and iteration.
   

  

 Close to the action: You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders, understand their workflows, and ensure your digital solutions create real value in their day-to-day operations.
   

  

**This is Stegra**
 Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.
   

  

 By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.
   

  

**Our Stockholm Office**
 Our modern Stockholm office is located on Norra Stationsgatan, close to Karolinska University Hospital in central Stockholm. Here, you’ll find a bright, collaborative workspace where cross-functional teams connect, share ideas, and drive progress. Whether you're visiting regularly or working hybrid, you'll be part of a vibrant office culture with easy access to the city’s energy and amenities.
   

  

*Founded in 2020, Stegra (formerly H2 Green Steel) was created with the purpose to decarbonize hard-to-abate industry. Construction of our first project – an integrated plant producing green hydrogen, green iron and green steel – is well underway in Boden, Sweden. Slashing emissions using green hydrogen and renewable electricity, we’re starting a clean industrial revolution. Steel is just the beginning.
   

  

 We are building a diverse and rapidly growing team spread across our site and offices in Boden and Stockholm, targeting close to 1500 employees by the end of 2025. Together, we focus on delivering green impact – for our people, customers, investors, society and planet.*

title: D365 F&O Technical Lead
description:
**Job Description:** 




 As the D365 F&O Technical Lead, you will be the primary authority on the technical health and architectural integrity of our ERP ecosystem. You will bridge the gap between functional requirements and technical execution, leading a global development team to deliver scalable, high-performance solutions. You aren't just overseeing code; you are defining the technical roadmap for a business-critical platform.
 



**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Architectural Leadership: Design end-to-end technical architectures for D365 F&O, ensuring alignment with best practices, scalability, and "Update Safe" development standards.**
* **Team Orchestration: Lead and mentor onshore and offshore development teams. You will be responsible for workload distribution, sprint planning, and technical troubleshooting & development.**
* Quality Governance: Conduct rigorous code reviews and enforce strict development standards. Ensure that all extensions and customizations minimize technical debt and maintain upgrade compatibility.
* Integration Strategy: Design and oversee complex integrations between D365 and external systems (PLM, CRM, Banking, etc.) using Azure Integration Services, OData, and Custom Services.
* Environment & ALM Management: Own the Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) process, including build automation, Azure DevOps (CI/CD) pipelines, and environment promotion strategies.
* Strategic Advisory: Act as the technical point of escalation for stakeholders, providing clarity on complex design decisions, performance tuning, and the impact of Microsoft’s "One Version" updates.



**Key Skills & Qualifications** 



* Core Technical: Expert-level X++ development, C#, and deep understanding of the D365 F&O Metadata model and AOS.
* Integration: Proven experience with Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Service Bus, and Power Platform (Dataverse/Dual-write).
* Data & Reporting: Proficiency in Electronic Reporting (ER), BYOD, Azure Data Lake, and Power BI integration.
* DevOps: Mastery of Azure DevOps for version control, build definitions, and automated deployments.
* Soft Skills: Strong consultative mindset with the ability to translate "technical speak" into business value for C-suite stakeholders.



**Preferred Experience** 



* Experience: 5+ years in Dynamics AX/D365 F&O development, with at least 2 years in a Lead capacity.
* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Certification: Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365: Finance and Operations Apps Solution Architect Expert (MB-700) or Developer (MB-300/500).

title: BC Developer
description:
**About The Role**
 As a BC Developer, you will play a key role in enhancing and maintaining our ExFlow products within a large, sophisticated codebase managed in Azure DevOps. You will build, refine, and improve features based on design specifications—while also contributing with your own technical insights and solution designs.
   

  

 While AL development is core to the role, our technology landscape extends further. Depending on your skills and interests, you may also work with Power Platform, PowerShell, Java, SQL, C#/.NET, or other technologies used across our product ecosystem.
   

  

 A deep grasp of ISV solution development is essential, as is the ability to analyze and align both standard D365 Business Central functionality and existing ExFlow products features with given design requirements. We provide comprehensive ExFlow-specific training to help you succeed.
   

  

 In addition to development, you will serve as a trusted expert in advanced technical troubleshooting, acting as 2nd and 3rd line support for complex cases.
   

  

 We also value modern engineering practices, including the ability and willingness to use AI tools in your daily work, or at minimum a strong curiosity and desire to work with AI-assisted development workflows.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop, enhance, and maintain ExFlow functionality and supporting components
* Create, review, and refine technical designs based on functional specifications
* Provide constructive feedback on solution designs
* Analyze standard D365 BC functionality and align with product requirements
* Act as 2nd- and 3rd-level technical support for complex issues
* Participate in architectural discussions or the “Architect Board” when requested
* Troubleshoot, debug, and drive continuous improvement across the codebase
* Utilize AI tools to support coding, analysis, documentation, and troubleshooting (or show strong willingness to learn)


**Required Skills & Experience**
 You are a product-minded developer who takes ownership and thrives in complex ERP environments like Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. You write clean, maintainable AL code, think critically about designs, and align standard functionality with product requirements.
   

  

**About**
 You are analytical, proactive, and confident handling complex technical challenges. At the same time, you collaborate well, communicate clearly, and are curious about modern practices, including AI-assisted development. This also includes:
   

  

* 5+ years of development experience with D365 Business Central (BC) and NAV (AL/CAL) Please do not apply without this background.
* Extensive experience with AL and C/AL
* Experience with large-scale codebases and Azure DevOps (source control & pipelines)
* Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio
* Strong understanding of ERP systems, especially Microsoft D365 Business Central
* Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
* Strong technical problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and presentation abilities
* Ability to quickly understand new processes and applications
* Team-oriented mindset with strong attention to detail
* Interest in or experience with AI-assisted development, such as code generation, testing, or analysis


**Bonus / Nice-to-Have**
* Experience building ISV solutions for D365 BC/NAV
* Previous NAV development experience
* Power Platform, PowerShell, Java, SQL, C#/.NET, or Azure experience
* Integration development experience
* Experience working with Nearshore/Offshore teams
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft 365


**What We Offer**
* Opportunity to join a global, successful, and rapidly growing company
* A supportive, collaborative team
* Skilled colleagues with deep Business Central and ISV experience
* Continuous learning and professional development
* Generous health and vision benefits
* Opportunities for international travel to our global offices


**Additional Information**
* Start date: As soon as possible
* Location: Solna, Stockholm (Since our core Product Team is based in Sweden, in our Solna office. It is needed to be based in Sweden.)


**About Truvio**
 Truvio brings together established Microsoft Dynamics ISVs in one unified company, delivering a single, intelligent product portfolio built exclusively for Dynamics 365.
   

  

 We help customers and partners close the ERP Value Gap by unifying finance, operations, and commerce within a Microsoft-native suite. By embedding deep domain expertise and AI-driven automation directly into Dynamics 365, Truvio aligns ERP capabilities with real-world complexity, automating repeatable work, guiding exceptions, and keeping processes compliant and in flow.
   

  

 We are over 450 employees with employees all over the world.
   

  

 We help organizations get more from their ERP investments - with solutions that simplify complexity, create clarity, and deliver outcomes that scale
 **.** 
 Our Mission is a world where every organization grows with confidence - powered by trusted expertise and continuous innovation.

title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
description:
**As a Senior Embedded System Engineer, the candidate will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing embedded systems and firmware for Perten instruments.** 
 The ideal candidate should possess a strong technical background in embedded systems. Proficiency in C and C++ is essential, while knowledge of Python and C# is a plus. Experience in Linux application development and low-level hardware interaction is highly desirable. As part of our team, you will contribute to challenging projects that leverage the latest technologies in the field. You will collaborate with electronic, mechanical, and design engineers to develop new products from concept to completion. The role demands independence, responsibility, and active participation in achieving shared team goals.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and debug firmware for embedded devices and systems.
* Write efficient and optimized low-level code in C, C++.
* Develop and maintain hardware drivers for peripherals like GPIO, UART, SPI, I2C, and ADC/DAC.
* Develop and maintain firmware for microcontrollers, SoCs, and other embedded platforms.
* Collaborate with hardware teams to define system architecture and hardware requirements.
* Expert-level knowledge of embedded Linux systems, application development on Linux.
* Software development: Write and debug low-level code for hardware drivers and system control.
* Implement and debug communication protocols (e.g., SPI, I2C, UART, CAN, Ethernet).
* Testing and validation: Perform system-level testing, debugging, and validation to ensure reliability and performance. Conduct root cause analysis of firmware-related issues and implement fixes.
* Create and execute test plans for firmware and hardware validation.
* Use tools like oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and JTAG debuggers for troubleshooting.
* Document system designs, specifications, and processes for internal and external stakeholders.
* Support manufacturing and field teams in resolving technical issues.
* Strong problem-solving, debugging & Analytical skills.


**Basic Qualifications**
* Master’s degree in electrical engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in embedded systems development
* Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++, and Python
* Strong understanding of microcontrollers, microprocessors, and SoCs, including ARM Cortex, Altera, and PIC architectures; FPGA and VHDL experience is a plus.
* Knowledge of communication protocols (SPI, I2C, UART, CAN, USB)
* Experience with Embedded Linux application development.
* Knowledge of power management, memory optimization, and real-time constraints.
* Experience in low-level driver development and board bring-up.
* Understanding of bootloaders, and memory management


**Preferred Characteristics**
* Experience with embedded application development on STM and ARM microcontrollers.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Familiarity with the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.
* Knowledge of secure firmware development, including cryptographic protocols and secure boot.
* Hands-on experience with Raspberry Pi Compute Module development.
* A creative mindset with a top-down approach to solution design.
* Strong problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills.

title: Technical Lead
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Frostbite is EA's proprietary game engine. Its versatile tools and cutting-edge technology power creation on some of the world's most iconic and visually stunning games, including titles from EA SPORTS and Battlefield. Frostbite provides a unified platform that empowers developers to create hyper-realistic worlds, intricate gameplay, and lifelike animations with unmatched speed and quality. By joining Frostbite, you'll be at the forefront of game engine innovation, collaborating with top-tier developers to push the boundaries of interactive realism and immersive gameplay. Shape the future of gaming technology and leave your mark on the next generation of games.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Technical Lead to join our Frostbite Core Services ACE team, focused on developer efficiency & quality. Reporting directly to the Leader of Engine Development, you'll play a key role in defining the future of scalable development technologies used within Frostbite.
   

  

 Your primary mission is to harness AI & Agentic tooling to supercharge developer efficiency and ensure top-tier quality engine for our game teams. This is a collaborative role where you'll engage other leaders across Frostbite aligning technology outcomes, identify risks, and help guide development & quality technology requirements with core stakeholders. If you're passionate about blending AI innovation with practical engineering impact in the gaming world, this is your chance to help drive our transformation.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Technical leadership: Technical leadership for a cell-team building AI-driven, agentic workflows that accelerate developer productivity across all other Frostbite teams. 75% coding time is expected.
* Architect Scalable AI Systems: Design and implement robust frameworks for AI agent orchestration, context management, and task automation—leveraging large language models (LLMs) and data-driven decision processes to streamline complex workflows.
* Foster Cross-Team Collaboration: Collaborate with the Technical Director to partner with engineering, design, and product leaders to maintain architectural consistency, establish shared standards, and integrate AI solutions seamlessly into the broader ecosystem.
* Explore and Evaluate Agentic Technologies: Prototype and rigorously assess emerging AI and agentic frameworks (e.g., LangChain, AutoGPT-inspired tools) to optimize development and integrations of Frostbite's highly complex tech-stack.
* Mentor and Cultivate Excellence: Guide junior and senior engineers alike, promoting a culture of technical mastery, ethical AI practices, and an "automation-first" mindset that empowers teams to innovate faster.
* Drive Tangible Outcomes: Measure and optimize for developer velocity, workflow reliability, and team satisfaction—delivering quantifiable wins that elevate the entire engineering organization.


**What We're Looking For**
* Strong background in at least two of the following domains:
+ Completed at least 2 large software projects: and at least one in a lead engineering position. AAA game development experience is a bonus.
+ AI/ML: Direct hands-on experience or a demonstrated passion and aptitude for artificial intelligence and machine learning.
+ Software Quality Leadership: Proven success in elevating quality practices within large-scale development teams.

* 3+ years of experience in designing software systems optimized for high-quality delivery.
* Expertise working with large C++ and/or C# code bases.
* Strong background in Agile development and continuous delivery practices.
* A minimum of 5 years in software development, with some experience leading multiple technical leads and projects concurrently within a distributed team.


**Why Join Us?**
 This is your chance to join a dynamic team, working at the cutting edge of game technology in a supportive and creative atmosphere. If you're excited to make a difference and grow your career, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

 This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Lead Cloud Developer
description:
**Do you like building backend solutions that don’t just work, but keep working - secure, scalable, and easy to live with? At Framna we’re looking for a Cloud Developer who’s curious about the full picture, from code to infrastructure, and who enjoys turning complexity into systems that just… run. You’ll be part of a team that builds things for the long term, where quality and stability matter just as much as speed, and where learning new skills is part of the everyday.** 




  





  





**Become part of the team** 




 Framna partners with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, like Swish, SJ, Essity, and SEB, to create digital products that define markets and deliver real-world impact. We are now more than 600 people across ten studios, building apps used by millions every day
 



 .Step into a team where no one builds alone. As our next Lead Cloud Developer, you will join forces with designers, QA engineers, analysts, and product leads to take ideas from first sketch to live product. You will also plug into a cloud community across Framna - a group that loves to test new things, share what works, and keep exploring better ways to build.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




 This role is about more than just keeping services running. You will be trusted with the whole journey - from setting up infrastructure to making sure it is secure, resilient, and performs at scale.
 



  





 More specifically, you will:
 


* Develop and maintain backend and cloud systems at different scales.
* Build and operate infrastructure and applications, ensuring reliability and performance.
* Work with security, databases, and networking to make systems stable and robust. Some of the languages we use today are Kotlin, Java, Typescript, or C# (.NET).
* Collaborate closely with product teams, developers, and partners to design solutions that meet both technical and business needs.
* Contribute to shaping the team’s Site Reliability Engineering practices.
* Share knowledge with colleagues and potentially mentor other developers.



  





**Who you are** 




 We are not looking for someone who only wants to go deep on a single tech stack. We think you will feel at home here if you like breadth, enjoy learning, and get energy from solving real problems. You might recognise yourself if you:
 


* Are curious about the bigger picture, from code to infrastructure to operations.Take pride in quality and don’t take shortcuts that create problems later.
* Feel motivated by variety, and enjoy picking up new tools or skills when needed.
* Like collaborating with teammates and partners to build things that last.
* Are interested in developing your leadership qualities, whether through mentoring or taking the lead in projects.



  





**About Framna** 




 Framna means ‘to bring forward’ in Old Norse. And that is exactly what we do. We partner with industry leaders (and those about to be) to create excellent digital products that define markets, reshape industries, and deliver meaningful impact.
 



  





 Born from the union of digital agencies Bontouch, Move, and Shape, Framna emerged from a strong, product-led culture. Today, over 600 of us collaborate across ten studios in Denmark, the Netherlands, Poland, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.
 



  





 Every day, millions of users around the world rely on the products we help shape. From seamless payments to daily commutes, from better health management to smarter shopping. Our work supports more than €150 million in daily transactions and consistently earns an average App Store rating of 4.5.
 



  





 Together with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, including Essity, SJ, Swish, and SEB, we craft products that lead markets and push boundaries. Because when products win, businesses win. We call it Win by product.
 



  





**What you get** 



* **The office is our default base** 
**of work.** 
 This is about building culture, optimizing for stronger collaboration, better products, greater value for our partners and challenging ourselves while having fun doing it. Our Stockholm office is right in the middle of the city - a super cozy space where there’s always something happening, whether it is a demo, a fika, or someone testing out a new idea. We mix that with the freedom to work from home when it makes sense, and hours that flex around real life.
* **A culture of curiosity.** 
 On Fridays we have weekly demos, Wednesdays mean lunch-and-learns, and sometimes we throw ourselves into conceptathons just to see what happens. We gather for company conferences just to share ideas, and we take time to learn something new when needed.
* **The freedom to follow your “what if.”** 
 We believe the best roles are shaped by the people in them. If you are curious about something, you will have the trust and space to chase it, and probably a few teammates who want to jump in with you.
* **Teammates who bring their whole selves.**
