* Facilitate coordination between security integrators and other trades (electrical, civil, networking, etc.) to resolve conflicts and maintain logical work sequencing.
* Participate in—and when needed, organize—regular onsite project meetings to track progress, address blockers, and report status to construction teams.


 Quality Assurance & Compliance
   

  

* Provide thorough reporting to the site construction manager to ensure all installations meet quality standards.
* Validate mockups and subsequent field installations against drawings and design standards.
* Conduct comprehensive site validation using the SORT Checklist to determine turnover readiness.


 Issue Management & Communication
   

  

* Identify and document onsite issues proactively; collaborate with design teams and SMEs to develop improvement plans.
* Act as the central point for escalation of onsite security issues and RFIs, ensuring timely resolution.


 Commissioning & Project Closeout
   

  

* Drive Levels 2–4 of the security commissioning process, coordinating with SIs, thirdparty commissioning agents, and internal teams.
* Own and manage the security punch list to ensure all deficiencies are corrected prior to system acceptance.
* Oversee the SORT closeout process to ensure complete and accurate documentation and smooth handover to SecOps.


**Role Structure & Geographic Requirements**
* Engineers will be deployed based on metrolevel project demand.
* Each assignment may require travel within a defined metropolitan region (typically within 60 minutes of project sites).
* Roles support multiple global regions, including APAC, EMEA, LATAM, and the U.S. (Central, East, and West).


**Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities**
* 7+ years of experience in physical security systems, construction engineering, or a related field.
* Strong understanding of access control, video surveillance, intrusion detection, and related infrastructure.
* Prior experience in QA/QC work in the physical security space strongly preferred.
* Prior experience in data centers and/or other highly regulated environments strongly preferred.
* Experience coordinating crossfunctional construction teams.
* Ability to interpret A/E drawings and technical design standards.
* Excellent communication, problemsolving, and issuemanagement capabilities.
* Willingness to travel within assigned metro areas.


 RedCloud requires employees have the legal ability to work in the country hired during their employment period. During onboarding, proof of eligibility to work in the applicable country will be requested. RedCloud does not provide visa sponsorship.
   

  

**About Us**
 RedCloud?is a boutique, business and technology consulting firm providing local companies with expert-level support for over two decades. Whether it’s to solve a specific business challenge or to provide additional support for an ambitious project, we can help bring even the most visionary endeavors to fruition.?
   

  

 Anchored by a foundation of "integrity-based consulting", the?RedCloud?team of subject matter experts collaborate closely with clients to develop and implement high-level solutions, bringing stability, growth, and innovation together for long-term success. We provide a broad array of business and technology consulting services through?RedCloud’s?core practices: Data & AI, Delivery Excellence, Digital Solutions, Marketing & Sales, Privacy, Security, and Strategy & Transformation.
   

  

 Visit http://www.redcloudconsulting.com/ for more info.

title: Solution Architect
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.*
*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow.*
*At Stegra, we’re not just building a plant, we’re proving that sustainable industry is possible. And to do that, we need people like you.*
*Join a team where safety comes first. Where we support each other, learn as we go, and make space for everyone to grow and contribute. This is your chance to be part of something big - while being closer to nature and leading a balanced, purposeful life.*
**What You’ll Do**
 Right now, we are looking for a Solution Architect to join our Digital HR and Finance team. In this role, you will report to our Digital Domain Manager and be part of the Digital Enterprise function. You will join a supportive, collaborative environment where we create modern and reliable digital capabilities for our HR and Finance functions.
   

  

 This role is a great fit for you who have several years of experience as a software developer, especially within backend development, and feel ready to grow into a Solution Architect role. At Stegra, you will have the valuable opportunity to develop into the role together with guidance and close collaboration from our Digital Enterprise Architect. We believe that thoughtful architecture grows from people who understand how digital solutions are built, and your development background will be a strong starting point as you take on a broader, more strategic perspective.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate closely with colleagues across both business and technical teams. Together, you will explore needs from HR and Finance and turn them into well-designed, future ready technical solutions. Your work will help create architectures that support simplicity, scalability and long-term maintainability.
   

  

 While you will not focus on writing production code every day, you will be involved in defining backend patterns, supporting development teams and helping align our digital solutions with Stegra’s guiding principles.
   

  

**Your day-to-day work will include, but not be limited to:**
* Exploring needs together with HR and Finance teams and shaping them into clear, well-structured technical concepts
* Supporting the creation of backend patterns and solution designs that are scalable, intuitive and aligned with Stegra’s digital principles
* Breaking down broader problem areas into understandable technical building blocks, roadmaps and development tasks
* Collaborating closely with developers to ensure shared understanding of architectural choices and helping teams move forward with confidence
* Contributing to integration approaches, data flow designs and API structures that enable smooth communication between systems
* Ensuring that security, data protection and access control are naturally embedded in the design of every solution
* Working across domains to make sure our technical solutions reflect real business needs and contribute to smooth, intuitive workflows
* Engaging regularly with stakeholders to create shared understanding of needs, decisions and expected outcomes
* Working closely with our Digital Enterprise Architect and learning how architectural decisions connect to the larger enterprise landscape


**What You’ll Bring**
 You are analytical, curious and motivated by creating solutions that work in real life. You enjoy turning complexity into something understandable, and you help others navigate technical decisions with clarity and confidence. You bring a collaborative communication style, and you appreciate environments where people support one another and learn together. You are excited about stepping into a role where you can grow your architectural skills while keeping your technical thinking sharp.
   

  

**Specific to this role, we would like to see that you can tick off a fair amount of the boxes below:**
* A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or equivalent experience
* Several years of experience as a backend developer, with curiosity to grow into a broader architectural role
* Experience contributing to the design or improvement of backend solutions, including APIs or microservice-based systems
* Comfort breaking down complex needs into structured, understandable documentation or technical steps
* Experience in a lead, coaching, Scrum Master or similar supporting role within a development team
* A general understanding of frontend, backend and infrastructure perspectives even if your core strength is backend
* Strong communication skills, able to engage across technical and business teams
* Prior experience from stakeholder collaboration, planning or providing technical direction to others
* Knowledge of HR or Finance processes is helpful, but absolutely not required
* Familiarity with architectural frameworks and tools such as ArchiMate or similar is helpful, but absolutely not required


**Benefits At Stegra**
 At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.
   

  

**Read More About Benefits At Stegra here.**
**Here’s what makes this role unique:**
 Breadth, not silos: You’ll work across multiple technical areas—backend, architecture, infrastructure, DevOps and Data—gaining deep understanding of our digital ecosystem.
   

  

 Ownership from day one: You’ll support a specific domain and act as a bridge between operations and tech, and drive solutions all the way from need to implementation and iteration.
   

  

 Close to the action: You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders, understand their workflows, and ensure your digital solutions create real value in their day-to-day operations.
   

  

**This is Stegra**
 Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.
   

  

 By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.
   

  

**Our Stockholm Office**
 Our modern Stockholm office is located on Norra Stationsgatan, close to Karolinska University Hospital in central Stockholm. Here, you’ll find a bright, collaborative workspace where cross-functional teams connect, share ideas, and drive progress. Whether you're visiting regularly or working hybrid, you'll be part of a vibrant office culture with easy access to the city’s energy and amenities.
   

  

*Founded in 2020, Stegra (formerly H2 Green Steel) was created with the purpose to decarbonize hard-to-abate industry. Construction of our first project – an integrated plant producing green hydrogen, green iron and green steel – is well underway in Boden, Sweden. Slashing emissions using green hydrogen and renewable electricity, we’re starting a clean industrial revolution. Steel is just the beginning.
   

  

 We are building a diverse and rapidly growing team spread across our site and offices in Boden and Stockholm, targeting close to 1500 employees by the end of 2025. Together, we focus on delivering green impact – for our people, customers, investors, society and planet.*

title: Vice President, Digital Customer Offering, Fortum Consumer Solutions
description:
**About The Role**
 As the Vice President, Digital Customer Offerings (DCO), you will lead and accelerate our large-scale digitalization and AI based product & service development, for the benefit of our international consumer and enterprise customers’ success, driving measurable business value for all key stakeholders.
   

  

 This is a high-impact Fortum Consumer Solutions Leadership Team role, with full accountability for developing and growing our digital customer offering across Fortum Consumer Solutions, the most popular energy solutions provider for consumers and SMEs in the Nordics, and the leading challenger in Poland. You will create a long-term strategic plan, while ensuring short-term execution excellence. The scope combines business transformation, commercial service and product development leadership, and technology excellence.
   

  

*Your key responsibilities include:*
* Acting as a key member of the Fortum Consumer Solutions Leadership Team, contributing to overall strategic direction
* Leading the development and growth of our digital customer offerings, with clear key stakeholders targets (like customer recommendation, net revenues and profitability to mention a few)
* Driving our strategic digitalization roadmap aligned with our business goals
* Owning budget, performance tracking and financial outcomes
* Ensuring secure and compliant digital solutions in close collaboration with IT and security stakeholders
* Translating strategic vision into operational plans and tangible results


 You will lead our team of leaders and specialists, working closely with our Business Areas, Group IT, and other internal stakeholders across the organization. The role also involves active collaboration with external partners and networks.
   

  

 This position offers the opportunity to operate at the intersection of business strategy, commercial product and service development, and technology – with significant influence on the future digital customer experience. You will be part of an international environment where leadership, innovation and continuous improvement are key.
   

  

 In this role you will report to the Executive Vice President, Fortum Consumer Solutions, Digitalization and Innovation. This position will be free to hybrid locate at any of our modern campuses in Espoo, Solna, Oslo or Gdansk.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for a strategic and commercially driven senior leader with a strong commercial product & service development, modern technology based, mindset and ability to translate complexity into clear direction.
   

  

*You likely bring:*
* Extensive experience from leading digital transformation, product & service development, or large-scale digital customer offerings
* Strong financial understanding and proven business experience managing significant budgets and performance targets
* Experience from senior leadership roles with responsibility for both business strategy and execution
* Solid understanding of digital security, compliance and governance in complex organizations
* Higher academic degree within Business, Engineering, Technology or equivalent
* Excellent communication skills in English (Nordic languages are an advantage)


*As a leader, you are:*
* Strategic and forward-looking, while being hands-on when needed
* Analytical with strong problem-solving capability
* Skilled in stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration
* Comfortable making decisions in ambiguity and driving change
* A motivating and inspiring people leader who builds high-performing teams


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, you will join a purpose-driven company committed to driving the energy transition and creating a more sustainable future. We believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

*We offer:*
* A senior leadership role with real business impact
* The opportunity to shape and scale digital offerings in a large, international business and organization
* A collaborative and supportive leadership environment
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Flexible working arrangements
* Continuous learning and development opportunities
* A culture built on trust, accountability and innovation


 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of this page.
   

  

 For permanent employment with Fortum Sverige AB, you may be assigned a wartime posting within the organization. For further information regarding wartime posting, please refer to the Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application by March 13 at the latest.
   

  

 More information about Fortum Consumer Solutions you will find e.g. from our recent Investor Day material here investor-day-2025-mikael-ronnblad-consumer-solutions-value-creation-through-excellence-growth-and-synergies
   

  

 If you would like to hear more about the recruitment process, please contact Fabian Åhlin, Senior Manager, Global Talent Acquisition, at Fabian.ahlin@fortum.com

title: Customer Director
description:
Are you motivated by shaping strong partnerships with leading industrial customers and supporting their transition toward a cleaner future?
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced, driven and relationship-oriented Customer Director to join our team in Solna, Sweden. You will be a part of the Corporate Customers and Markets (CCM) business unit, which serves as the customer interface for large industrial customers, electricity retailers and other power trading companies across the Nordic market.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Customer Director, you’ll play a key role in building strong, strategic partnerships with established industrial companies and support innovative new industrial startups on their decarbonization journey.
   

  

 You will connect with key players in the industry while actively managing and expanding our existing customer base. In addition, you will collaborate with other business areas within Fortum Group to unlock new opportunities and strengthen partnerships across the board. You will travel and engage directly with clients, keeping you at the heart of building impactful relationships across industries.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Identify and engage new clients, uncover opportunities for business growth, and establish a thriving client base.
* Deliver engaging presentations, compelling product/service demonstrations, and high-impact pitches to potential clients.
* Lead complex negotiations, address customer concerns professionally, and close sales deals that elevate our impact.
* Cultivate and nurture relationships with key clients, ensuring their satisfaction while identifying areas for partnership growth.
* Maintain records of sales activities in CRM systems and keep customer databases at the forefront of strategic decisions.


 The scope of this role covers Fortum's full product portfolio, which includes Commodity Market Access, PPAs, physical supply, portfolio management, Guarantees of Origin, flexibility services, and strategic partnerships in exciting areas such as hydrogen, new nuclear, and new renewable projects (wind, solar, batteries).
   

  

**About You**
 You’re a proactive professional who values collaboration, embraces challenges, and brings fresh perspectives with energy and care. You work in a structured way and thrive both independently and in a dynamic team environment.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Extensive experience in sales with a proven track record.
* A solid background in managing large industrial clients.
* Experience and understanding of the energy industry and its complexities.
* Familiarity with large-scale energy contracts is a strong advantage.
* Exceptional negotiation skills, particularly in handling intricate contracts with industrial customers.
* Experience in managing multiple internal and external stakeholders.
* Strong interpersonal and influencing skills that foster collaboration and drive results.
* Educational credentials such as a university degree, MBA, or other relevant qualifications.
* Fluent and confident English and Swedish language skills.


 Your commercial awareness and commitment to customer excellence sets you apart. You thrive on building meaningful relationships and driving success, all while maintaining a results-oriented approach.
   

  

**We offer you**
 The position provides great development opportunities and the chance to be involved in and influence the company’s strategic priorities in close collaboration with other key people in the Nordics.
   

  

 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application (CV) in English via our recruitment tool as soon as possible, but no later than the 22.02.2026.
   

  

 If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact Vice President Sales, Toni Kekkinen at Toni.Kekkinen@fortum.com or +46703445671.
   

  

 Our recruitment process
   

  

 We may begin inviting candidates to interviews already during the application period and will close the position once the right individual is found. After thorough screening, the recruitment process will include two rounds of interviews with different participants, a short digital assessment and lastly a reference check for the finalists.
   

  

 If you have questions about the recruitment process please contact Keren Shoch at keren.shoch@fortum.com.
   

  

 If you need any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process due to a disability or other circumstances, please let us know when applying. We will do our best to accommodate your needs.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant may go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing. Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of this page.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Kyrkogårdsvaktmästare 100%
description:
**Beskrivning**




 Kyrkogårdsvaktmästare 100 % till norra området i Roslagens östra pastorat.
   

  





 Pastoratet består av 10 församlingar och har ca 90 medarbetare. Vi söker till Väddö församling en engagerad och driven kyrkogårdsvaktmästare.
   

  





 Du som söker har god förmåga att möta kollegor och församlingsbor. Är ordningsam, flexibel, positiv och ansvarsfull. Du delar kyrkans värderingar.
   

  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**




 Traditionellt kyrkogårdsarbete såsom skötsel av gravar och grönytor, städning och underhåll av församlingens lokaler. Tjänsten innefattar även inre tjänstgöring med arbete vid gudstjänster och kyrkliga handlingar m.m. Du kommer att arbeta efter rullande schema, vardagar och helger.
   

  

  

  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Arbetserfarenhet inom drift och underhåll av fastighet
* Du har vana av att framföra och underhålla maskiner
* Flexibel att kunna arbeta självständigt och/eller i grupp där du tillsammans med andra prioriterar och driver det dagliga arbetet framåt
* Förmåga att kunna arbeta lösningsorienterat
* Förmåga att möta människor i livets alla skeden och med känsla för service



  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  





**Villkor**




 Körkort och tillgång till egen bil är en förutsättning för tjänsten, eftersom hela norra området av pastoratet är ett arbetsområde.
   

  





 Vana att hantera IT verktyg är en förutsättning för tjänsten, då vi arbetar digitalt i kommunikation, planering och med uppföljning.
   

  





 Medlem i Svenska kyrkan.
   

  





  
   

  





**Övrigt:** 



* Tjänsten är tillsvidare på heltid, vi tillämpar provanställning, 6 månader
* Tillträde enligt överenskommelse
* Huvudsaklig arbetsplats är Väddö samt Singö och Björkö kyrkogård
* Intervjuer sker löpande



 För mer information och eventuella frågor kontakta Martin Johansson, kyrkogårds- och fastighetschef, tel. 0176-799 13, martin.johansson@svenskakyrkan.se
   

  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Linux System Administrator
description:
*OM INFINITY IT CONSULTING: Infinity IT Consulting är ett konsultföretag inom IT och Management med en stark företagskultur och teamkänsla. Ditt välmående är vår framgång och vi menar att de bästa konsultaffärerna blir av och genomförs med stolthet när du som medarbetare mår som bäst, så gör även företaget och våra kunder det. Vi jobbar med IT-kunder och partners i hela Skandinavien inom både telekom, verkstadsindustrin, retail, sport & mode och många andra. Vi bygger teamet utifrån våra värderingar som genomsyrar hela företaget. Pannben – Viljan och förmågan att lösa uppgiften, ta ansvar och känna ägarskap, men alltid våga ta hjälp. Enkelhet – Vi krånglar inte till det, varken för oss själva eller för andra! Sunt förnuft och kundnöjdhet i fokus. Laganda – Vi ställer upp för varandra, gör varandra bättre och skrattar varje dag! Långsiktighet – Vi är besatta av att göra bra saker och saker bra, vi låter kortsiktiga vinningar stå tillbaka för långvariga affärsrelationer. Stolthet – Vi är rakryggade, på riktigt och vågar gå vår egen väg! Din IT-karriär kan starta hos just oss och vi ger förutsättningarna för det, eller så är du senior med många års erfarenhet och då ger vi utrymme för allt leda, kompetensutveckla och ge stöd åt våra mer juniora konsulter, och på det viset har vi en härlig mix i konsultteamet av olika utbyten i erfarenhet, intressen och kompetens.*
**Om uppdraget**
 Infinity IT Consulting AB söker en
 **Linux System Administrator** 
 för ett
 **konsultuppdrag hos kund i Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta med
 **GPU-accelererad Remote Desktop (VDI)** 
 för HPC-arbetslaster inom simulering, visualisering och rendering. Rollen innebär design, driftsättning och underhåll av plattformen, med fokus på
 **automation och arkitektur** 
 .
   

  

**Teknikstack:** 
 Rocky Linux / RHEL
   

  

* X11
* Xfce4/GNOME
* NICE DCV
* EnginFrame
* SLURM
* Ansible
* Git


**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Bygga, driftsätta och underhålla Linux-baserad VDI-infrastruktur
* Automatisera processer med Ansible och Infrastructure as Code
* Säkerställa prestanda, skalbarhet och säkerhet
* Samarbeta med HPC- och infrastrukturteam


**Din profil**
* Linux-kunskaper (Rocky Linux / RHEL)
* Grundläggande scripting och automation (Bash, Git)
* Förståelse för X11, skrivbordsmiljöer och fjärrrendering
* HPC-erfarenhet, SLURM, NICE DCV eller EnginFrame är meriterande
* Självständig, lösningsorienterad och teamvänlig


**Omfattning**
* Heltid, onsite hos kund i Stockholm
* Start: enligt överenskommelse


**Om Infinity IT Consulting AB**
 Vi är ett konsultbolag inom IT och Management som värdesätter enkelhet, laganda och långsiktighet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en kultur som sätter
 **människan i centrum** 
 och där ditt välmående och din framgång är viktiga delar av helheten.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Skicka in ditt CV redan idag – urval sker löpande!

title: Senior Operations Specialist
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**Senior Operations Specialist - Growth & Expansion**
****About Wolt****
 Wolt is a technology company that transforms how people discover and access local services. From restaurants to grocery stores, we create seamless experiences for customers, boost sales for merchants, and provide flexible earning opportunities for couriers. Our local commerce platform is powered by a diverse and inclusive team, dedicated to making cities better places to live and work.
   

  

 At Wolt, we take ownership, develop ourselves, and build solutions that just work. If you thrive in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and want to shape the future of local commerce, this is the place for you.
   

  

****About The Role****
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Operations Specialist - Growth & Expansion** 
 to support city expansion and courier acquisition across nine markets in the region.
   

  

 This is a high-autonomy individual contributor role that blends operational execution with analytical depth and cross-functional coordination. You will partner with Courier Marketing, Courier Acquisition, General Managers, and Regional Operations to ensure that new cities launch smoothly and that applicant pipelines are healthy, efficient, and predictable.
   

  

 You will support the operational side of expansion-building processes, strengthening forecasting, and improving how we acquire and convert courier applicants. A background in marketing operations, growth marketing, revenue operations, or generalist operations roles is highly valuable.
   

  

 This role requires a combination of structured problem-solving, strong analytical skills, and the ability to work across teams to bring clarity and alignment.
   

  

****What You’ll Be Doing****
**Expansion & Launch Execution**
* Support end-to-end execution of city launches across nine markets, ensuring operational readiness.
* Help develop and refine a scalable expansion framework, aligning closely with commercial and regional strategies.
* Define operational success criteria for launches and ensure they are met from day one.
* Work cross-functionally with Courier Marketing and local teams to align launch timing with applicant needs.


**Courier Acquisition & Forecasting**
* Contribute to bottom-up forecasting models, improving accuracy and helping regional teams plan effectively.
* Analyze funnel performance, conversion trends, and applicant quality to anticipate supply requirements.
* Act as a trusted partner to regional stakeholders, bringing data-driven insight to acquisition strategy discussions.
* Align closely with Courier Marketing on campaign timing, budget efficiency, and applicant pipeline health.
* Support acquisition costs optimization through analysis and continuous improvement of acquisition levers.


**Data-Driven Strategy & Process Optimization**
* Build and maintain analytical dashboards and modeling tools (Looker or similar) to monitor pipelines, conversion, and other operational KPIs.
* Establish a structured, data-driven approach to expansion and acquisition decision-making.
* Collaborate with General Managers, Global Operations, and regional teams to improve forecasting and launch planning methodologies.
* Drive regional alignment by standardizing expansion processes and using retrospective insights to improve future launches.


****What We’re Looking For****
* 3–5 years of experience in Marketing Operations, Growth Marketing, Revenue Operations, or Generalist Operations.
* Strong analytical capability, including comfort with creating bottom-up forecasts, evaluating funnel performance, and translating data into actionable recommendations.
* Hands-on experience with BI tools (Looker, Tableau, or similar), including dashboard creation and KPI definition.
* Ability to work autonomously in a fast-moving environment and bring structure to unclear tasks or evolving requirements.
* Strong stakeholder management skills, able to collaborate with Courier Marketing, Courier Acquisition, GMs, and regional teams across multiple countries.
* Experience optimizing acquisition funnels or working with campaign-driven applicant pipelines.
* Excellent communication skills in English; additional languages are a plus.
* Familiarity with modern productivity tools and practical use of AI/GPT assistants to improve efficiency is a plus.


**Why You Should Join Wolt**
* Make an Impact - Your work will directly shape how Wolt expands and grows courier supply across nine markets.
* Own Your Work - High autonomy to improve processes, strengthen forecasting, and drive smarter expansion.
* Develop & Grow - Join a rapidly scaling team where you can deepen your analytical, operational, and cross-functional capabilities.
* Collaborate with the Best - Work with talented teammates across Operations, Marketing, and Commercial to solve complex, meaningful problems.


 If you’re a data-driven, operationally strong, and expansion-savvy professional with a passion for building scalable, predictable growth systems, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Software Developer
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 The DeLaval Edge Platform team builds the IoT backbone that connects devices, sensors and edge compute across farms worldwide. We work where IoT, edge computing and cloud meet — enabling secure onboarding, real‑time communication and high‑availability automation in challenging environments.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 As a Software Developer IoT & Edge, you will develop software that runs across cloud services, edge nodes and on‑farm devices. You help evolve a secure, scalable and reliable IoT platform by working closely with hardware, firmware, cloud and operations teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop IoT platform and edge services for device management, OTA updates and distributed workloads.
* Design microservices for secure communication and fleet monitoring.
* Implement secure onboarding and provisioning flows for new devices.
* Build connectivity and telemetry solutions that work in low‑bandwidth and offline‑first environments.
* Improve reliability, monitoring and automated testing for large device fleets.
* Apply strong IoT security practices and support migration to modern architectures.


**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role we believe that you have:
   

  

* Strong backend skills in Python, Go, Rust or TypeScript
* Good understanding of Linux systems, preferably Yocto‑based.
* Experience with IoT protocols (MQTT, CoAP, gRPC, REST).
* Familiarity with cloud IoT platforms and container runtimes.
* Basic networking knowledge (TLS, certificates, VPNs, routing).
* Experience with distributed or offline‑capable systems.


**We Would Also Like To See**
* Experience with industrial IoT or large‑scale device fleets.
* Hands‑on work with factory provisioning, device imaging or hardware integration.
* Understanding of real‑time systems, telemetry pipelines or anomaly detection.
* Experience with edge AI or applying ML at the edge.
* Frontend experience in Vue.js or React (optional).


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness allowance of SEK 4 000/year.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Yvo Bogers, yvo.bogers@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Service Manager
description:
**Be visionary**
 Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
   

  

 We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Your contribution
   

  

 As Service Manager at FLIR Sweden AB (Täby), you will lead a skilled team of thermography service technicians and Customer Service Representatives (CSRs). Together, you will deliver repair, calibration, and restoration services that ensure exceptional customer experiences and uphold Teledyne FLIR’s reputation for reliability.
   

  

 This role is critical to our Service business: you will establish business goals, optimize resources, and contribute to policy and procedure development initiatives that drive growth. Your leadership will directly impact customer satisfaction, operational efficiency, and revenue performance, while fostering collaboration across regional teams and adjacent departments.
   

  

**Your job in plain text**
* Build and lead teams while developing processes to deliver outstanding customer service
* Establish and manage daily work priorities, delegating assignments and adjusting resources to meet business needs
* Oversee employee time and attendance, support conflict resolution, and foster adherence to company values
* Develop team members through coaching, one‑to‑one check‑ins, and annual performance appraisals
* Promote cross‑training and skill development to enhance capacity with existing resources
* Manage administration of all service activities using SAP and related enterprise applications
* Apply business acumen to identify and promote service offerings that drive growth while maintaining cost controls
* Track and report monthly Key Performance Indicators; analyze trends and recommend process improvements
* Manage operating expenditures with a focus on cost reduction; provide input for annual budget submissions
* Ensure compliance with ISO Quality standards and Global Trade Compliance policies
* Coordinate with adjacent departments to ensure timely delivery of products and services
* Foster collaboration within the regional Service group and identify opportunities for improvement


**To be ready to take on this role we would love if you have**
* Bachelor’s degree in electronics technology or a related discipline
* Significant experience in thermography service with expert knowledge of advanced thermal imaging systems
* Extensive leadership experience with direct report responsibility
* Experience working within an ISO 9001 environment
* Strong understanding of Global Trade Compliance policies and best practices
* Familiarity with Jurisdiction Classification processes
* Hands‑on experience with SAP PR1 Customer Service Module and ticketing platforms
* Proven ability to analyze requirements and develop processes/policies to support new product introductions
* Experience in developing and managing operating budgets with a focus on cost control
* In‑depth knowledge of metrology and calibration laboratory operations for thermal imaging products, compliant with NIST regulations


**What Teledyne FLIR Offers You**
* A leadership role where you shape and develop a high‑performing Service team
* The chance to work with advanced thermal imaging technology and contribute to world‑class repair and calibration services
* Direct impact on customer satisfaction and business growth through service excellence
* Collaboration with Product Management, Engineering, Manufacturing and other functions as well as regional Service teams to drive continuous improvement
* Opportunities to influence service strategy, processes, and policy development within a global organization
* A supportive culture that values teamwork, accountability, and professional development
* Competitive compensation and benefits, including wellness rewards and career advancement opportunities


**Interested?**
 If you liked what you just read, and believe you are the person that will make us better, do not hesitate to apply.
   

  

 The selection process is ongoing, so don't wait.
   

  

 When applying, make it easy for yourself. Add a resume and fill out the required fields, no need to add anything else at this point.
   

  

 We accept applications in English.
   

  

 (Non-US) This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e. regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.
   

  

 or or
   

  

 Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.

title: MANAGER CABIN CREW
description:
**Cabin Crew Manager - Arlanda Airport Crew Base**
 As Cabin Crew Manager, you will play a key role at SAS, shaping the future of aviation while leading and developing our Cabin Crew, the frontline team that represents SAS to our passengers every day. You will motivate, guide, and support your team to deliver exceptional customer experiences on board, ensuring the highest standards of safety in a competitive and fast-changing market.
   

  

**Challenges you will work on**
 As Cabin Crew Manager, you will play a central role in shaping and developing the Stockholm crew base, working closely with Head Office to create the right conditions for Cabin Crew to perform safely and deliver an exceptional customer experience. In this role, you will lead and support a team of around 150 Cabin Crew, having a real impact on employee engagement, operational excellence, and the overall development of the team. You will have opportunities to influence processes, drive change, and contribute to strategic initiatives across the organization.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Coordinating workforce planning, schedules, and operational priorities in collaboration with Crew Planning.
* Driving initiatives for continuous improvement, including training, competence development, and process enhancements.
* Monitoring performance, following up on incidents and KPIs, and maintaining high standards in Safety, Punctuality, and Care.
* Representing Cabin Crew Management in projects, meetings, and forums, contributing to cross-functional collaboration and decision-making.
* Supporting a positive work environment by promoting engagement, communication, and team spirit, and helping your team grow professionally.
* Be part of the Scandinavian Cabin Crew leadership group, working closely with colleagues across the organization and contributing to knowledge sharing, best practices, and continuous professional development.


**The Team**
 Your primary workplace will be Crew Base Arlanda, with occasional visits to Head Office in Stockholm. The Arlanda crew base currently consists of approximately 800 employees. Together with three other Cabin Managers, you will be part of a skilled and collaborative local Cabin Management team at Arlanda. The role reports to the Head of Cabin Crew, Copenhagen, who is organizationally based at Head Office in Stockholm and regularly visits the Cabin Crew bases.
   

  

**To be successful, we believe you have**
* Experience from aviation management, or a strong interest in working in an aviation environment.
* Proven ability to lead and engage large employee groups, preferably with experience of “long-distance” leadership.
* Relevant education or equivalent work experience.
* Strong communication skills in English and at least one Scandinavian language.
* Confidence in using IT systems and administrative tools in your daily work.
* Experience of working with LEAN principles is considered an advantage, but not a requirement.


 We believe you are a visible and engaging leader who creates trust, energy, and a strong team spirit. You enjoy working with people, communicate naturally, and bring a customer-focused and holistic perspective to your work. You thrive in a dynamic environment, stay structured and results-driven, and are motivated by driving change and improving ways of working.
   

  

**Why SAS?**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced environment, and we are dedicated to supporting the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us also comes with a variety of benefits, including travel perks, allowing you to enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS, and exclusive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
   

  

**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 20/02/2026. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: As soon as possible
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Stockholm Arlanda Airport-Crew Base
* A background check will be conducted at the final stage of this recruitment process, as this role is security classified. If you are aware of any specific matters that may come up during this background check, we kindly ask you to be transparent about them during the recruitment process. Before employment a drug- and alcohol test will also be carried out.

title: Supportmedarbetare
description:
Nu har du chansen att axla rollen som supportmedarbetare hos en viktig myndighet i Stockholm. Vi söker dig som brinner för att hjälpa andra, är en fena på teknik och vill bli en del av ett dynamiskt team där ingen dag är den andra lik.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär många kontaktytor där god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga är avgörande. Som person ser vi att du är drivande och van att arbeta självständigt. Tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad och en säkerhetsprövning tillkommer i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Som konsult hos Randstad är du anställd via oss men jobbar ute hos kund. Du har samma fördelar hos Randstad som hos andra arbetsgivare med kollektivavtal och förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, företagshälsovård, försäkringar och rabatt på träningskort. Utöver det erbjuds du även en mängd karriärmöjligheter, får möta olika företagskulturer och erfarenhet från olika branscher vilket gör att du utvecklar din kompetens och får ett välfyllt CV.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Godkänd gymnasieutbildning.
* Minst ett års erfarenhet från en supportverksamhet där du gett kundservice via telefon eller fysiska möten (t.ex. butik. restaurang eller annat servicearbete).
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig pedagogiskt och empatiskt på både svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift.
* Erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem, dokumentation och logistik kring ärenden.
* Goda kunskaper i Windows 11, Office-paketet och digitala mötesplattformar.
* Förmåga att felsöka och hitta lösningar, även när dokumentation saknas.


**Personliga Egenskaper**
* Stresstålig - du behåller kvaliteten även under tidspress.
* Samarbetsorienterad med förmåga att hantera många kontaktytor parallellt.
* Flexibel och snabb på att anpassa dig till ändrade förutsättningar.


**Meriterande**
* Relevanta utbildningar eller certifieringar inom IT-support.
* Erfarenhet av specifikt Helpdesk eller telefonsupport som främsta arbetsverktyg.
* Kunskap om ITIL eller liknande processmodeller för tjänstehantering.
* Fördjupad kompetens inom Word (mallar/designläge), SharePoint. mobila plattformar (iOS), Active Directory (AD) samt Microsoft SCCM.
* Ett genuint teknikintresse och driv att hålla dig uppdaterad om omvärldens digitala utveckling.


**Ansvarsområde**
 Som supportmedarbetare är du den första kontakten för myndighetens medarbetare när de behöver hjälp med sin IT-utrustning. Du kommer att arbeta i en service desk-miljö med ett högt tempo där du hanterar ärenden via olika kanaler. Ditt fokus ligger på att ge support med ett starkt användarperspektiv och att snabbt lösa problem så att medarbetarna kan fortsätta sitt viktiga arbete.

title: Director of Strategy & Business Development
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Director of Strategy & Business Development** 
 to lead strategic initiatives and business development at Mentimeter. In this role you will help shape the company’s future by leading our strategic processes & initiatives as well exploring new avenues for growth.
   

  

 You will report to the COO whilst working closely with our CEO and other members of the Management Team. You will lead a small but highly impactful Business Development team, while also collaborating with leaders across Product, Marketing, Sales, and Finance. This is a highly cross-functional role, with potential to influence Mentimeter’s strategic direction, corporate development, and operational model.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Facilitate and drive Mentimeter’s company-level strategy processes
* Drive the process of evolving Mentimeter’s offering, e.g. ideal customer profiles (ICP), value spaces, and strategic positioning.
* Lead business model development, including monetization strategy and pricing for both self-service and sales-assisted motions.
* Own the M&A process
* Develop and own the framework for evaluating strategic partnerships and alliances, including opportunity sizing and risk analysis.
* Conduct and oversee research on markets, customers, competitors, and macro trends to inform long-term decisions.
* Own the structure and synthesis of competitive landscape analysis.
* Track and interpret shifts in technology, customer behavior, and industry dynamics to shape future-facing strategy (e.g. AI, SaaS trends).
* Lead IPO-related planning and readiness activities in partnership with Finance and Executive stakeholders. Lead IPO process in the event of an IPO.
* Deliver strategic long term projects on request from the CEO
* Facilitate orchestration of company operations & operating model developments
* Act as the Line Manager and Team Lead for the Business Development team, with accountability for performance, engagement, and development.


**We Believe You Have**
* Around 10 years of relevant experience in strategy & business development, ideally in a B2B SaaS or technology-driven company
* Hands-on experience with M&A processes
* Previous experience of working directly towards CEO/COO/CFO
* Previous leadership experience, with a proven ability to lead and develop teams & individuals
* A track record of driving strategic initiatives that have created measurable business impact
* Strong understanding of monetization, pricing, and business model innovation in SaaS and PLG contexts
* Strong collaboration skills (as you will be working with many different functions and people)
* An analytical mindset and an ability to grasp the full picture
* Excellent presentation skills and an ability to explain complex concepts


 📍
 **Location:** 
 This is primarily an on-site role at Mentimeter HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

**💡Our Recruitment Process**
* Alva Labs logical test
* Screening interview
* Business Case (home assignment)
* Competence interview
* Culture interview
* References & Offer


**Not sure you tick every box?** 
 Apply anyway—great matches often come in surprising shapes.
   

  

 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**AI and Hiring at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we believe AI helps us work smarter - but it never replaces the human assessment, curiosity, and personal connection that define our culture and our hiring. We use AI as a sparring partner: to bounce ideas, bring new perspectives, support structure, and make our work more efficient. But the meaning, decisions, and interactions always come from people.
   

  

* AI does not screen or decide on candidates.
* There is no automated filtering, ranking, or decision-making in our recruitment process. Every application is reviewed by a person.
* Hiring teams may use AI to support their work - for example, to structure notes, prepare interview questions, or organize their thinking.


 AI strengthens our work, but it does not define it. At Mentimeter, we’re not building an AI-driven hiring process - we’re building a people-first culture, where technology helps us listen, learn, and grow together.
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Implementation Specialist
description:
**Who we are 🏃‍♂️** 


  



 Findity is the market leader in Embedded expense management. We are the AI-powered technology provider that enables Europe's most innovative software companies to deliver world-class expense solutions directly to their customers. With a focus on partnership, we currently power the expense products relied upon by over 35,000 companies and hundreds of thousands of employees. 
 





  



**What we do 🚀** 


  



 Expense management is a universal pain point. Our mission is to transform expense management from a fragmented burden into a seamless, automated experience. That's why we partner with market leaders, providing our platform, helping them to eliminate the expense stress for their customers.
 




  

  




**The role 🙋** 


  



 As an Implementation Specialist at Findity, you’ll lead partner implementations from start to finish in a hands-on and collaborative way. In this role,  you’ll keep things moving, communicate clearly, and help solve challenges along the way. You’ll work closely with partners ensuring that every integration is seamless, runs smoothly, stays on track, and supports their specific business goals. 
 





 Your main mission will be to guide new partners onto our platform and make sure they feel confident using it from day one. You’ll play an important role in shaping their first experience with Findity, making the process clear, collaborative, and set up for long-term success.
 




  

  




**What you will do 🙌** 




* Partner closely with the New Business Sales team in later-stage opportunities to shape technical solutions that fit the partner’s goals.

  

* Run technical pilots that showcase the strengths of our embedded platform and help make the sales process smoother.

  

* Provide estimates on implementation timelines and resource costs to ensure a smooth transition from contract to execution.

  

* Take the lead during implementation, guiding the project from kickoff to launch and keeping milestones on track.

  

* Stay hands-on throughout the setup, making sure the partner’s production environment is configured according to Findity best practices.

  

* Plan and deliver practical training sessions for support teams, product owners, and administrators so they feel confident working with the Findity platform.



  

  




**Qualifications 📝** 




* 3+ years in a tech-focused role like partner success, implementation, product or similar.
* Proven track record of managing projects that involve multiple stakeholders.
* Basic understanding of APIs.
* Understanding of accounting, ERP, and payroll systems.
* Fluency in English.




  



**Apply Now!** 


  



 Excited about embarking on your new career journey? Fantastic! Send us your application in English as soon as possible!

title: Projektledare som driver komplexa digitaliseringsprojekt
description:
*En utvecklande arbetsplats eller en trygg arbetsgivare med härliga kollegor? Hos oss behöver du inte välja.*
*Du kanske tror att en kommunal hyresvärd mest jobbar med att hyra ut lägenheter. Det är en viktig del av vad vi gör, men vi är också med och driver på utvecklingen mot ett hållbart Stockholm där alla Stockholmare har en plats.*




**Om tjänsten**




 Vi letar nu efter dig som vill möjliggöra nya digitala stöd för att effektivisera våra arbetsprocesser i hur vi utvecklar och tar hand om vårt fastighetsbestånd på ett mer automatiserat sätt, från att vi projektutvecklar tills att vi långsiktigt förvaltar det. Det vi kanske traditionellt kallat för ritningshantering men som handlar om att ta hand om fastighetsdata som ett tillgångsslag. Men också hur vi betraktar våra fastigheter som potential i att skapa värden utifrån våra visioner inom hållbarhetsområdet, t ex att genom uppkopplade sensorer mäta och följa fastigheternas status och skapa möjlighet för kliv inom energieffektivisering och trygghetsåtgärder. Allt kommer inte hända på en gång, utan resan är flerårig då vi är en Sveriges största fastighetsägare och vi söker dig som kan räkna på business case för att prioritera digitaliseringsinsatser och är uthållig på så sätt att du ser delmål vi uppnår på vägen till visionen.
   

  





 För detta krävs att du har ett intresse av samhällsbyggnad och fastighetsförvaltning samt att du har med dig en spännvid i kompetenser och intressen inom IT-infrastruktur, fastighetsautomation, framväxande teknologier och processtöd. Där teknik och data kombineras för att underlätta och effektivisera arbetssätt samt skapa förutsättningar för en automatiserad styrning. Givetvis följer IT- och OT-säkerhetsfrågor i spåren av det.
   

  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Du utvecklar strategier för digital transformation och hållbarhet i kombination, med stöd i bolagets affärsplan.
* Du löser sammansatta problem där beteendeförändring krävs av verksamhet och människor, för att uppnå bolagets höga ambitioner inom hållbarhet och digitalisering.
* Du projektleder initiativen, från idé till att det digitala stödet är en del av det nya etablerade arbetssättet.
* Du omvärldsbevakar nya teknologier och omsätter det till ett bostadsföretags värld.
* Du följer skärpta krav på IT- och cybersäkerhetsområdet.



**Vem är det vi söker?**




 Vi söker dig som har akademisk examen med tydlig digital kompetens eller annan utbildning/erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren anser vara likvärdig.
   

  





 Du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet från en utvecklingsorienterad organisation eller konsultroll där du lett utvecklings- och förändringsarbete, från idé till färdig implementering, där det digitala inslaget varit framträdande. Vidare har du en bred grundläggande teknisk förståelse.
   

  





 Det är meriterande om du har förvärvade kunskaper inom informations- och cybersäkerhet, DW och BI.
   

  





 För att lyckas i rollen krävs att du tar ägarskap och driver projekt framåt för att komma i mål, med ett professionellt tillvägagångssätt. Du stimuleras av en viss komplexitet och ser till att skaffa den information som behövs för att kunna ta nästa steg. Du tycker om att organisera och att växla mellan att leda och att själv göra. Du är en förtroendeingivande person och är uppskattad för din kommunikativa förmåga där du ser värdet av att lägga tid på relationsbyggande.
   

  





 Känner du igen dig i ovan beskrivning och vill vara med och bidra samt göra skillnad både för dig och för stockholmare? Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!
   

  





**En hälsning från din nya arbetsplats**




 Om du får jobbet så blir din nya chef Jannike Siljan. Hon har skickat med en liten hälsning till dig
   

  





*"Vi som blir dina närmsta kollegor har valt Svenska Bostäder som arbetsgivare för den samhällsnytta vi är med och bidrar till. Vi är alla mycket engagerade i våra respektive sakfält och driver utvecklingen framåt, och delar gärna med oss av det senaste över en fika eller i vår sociala kanal. Vi peppar varann och finns där för varann”.* 
  
   

  





 Din kollega Martina Björk som har samma befattning, men med annan inriktning, skickar också en hälsning till dig:
   

  





*”I den här befattningen har jag hittat den utvecklande kombinationen av att kunna lära mig något nytt varje dag med en hög tilltro och förväntan på att driva initiativ från idé till förvaltning. Du kommer bygga ett stort kontaktnät över bolaget och få hjälp av massor av kloka, roliga och engagerade kollegor. Det här jobbet passar dig som gillar omväxling och möjligheten att prata strategi ena dagen, andra dagen omsätta densamma till praktiska steg framåt.”*




**Övrigt** 



* Det här är en tillsvidaretjänst utan provanställning.
* Vi intervjuar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.



*Över 60 000 stockholmare har sina liv, hem och drömmar hos oss. Vi vill att våra hyresgäster ska trivas och vilja bo hos oss. Genom att ta hyresgästernas intressen på allvar arbetar vi tillsammans för att bygga, utveckla och förvalta hållbara boenden. Det är inte bara hyresgästen som är viktig utan för oss är det avgörande att även våra medarbetare trivs hos oss och därför erbjuder vi generösa förmåner med bland annat korta fredagar. Vi har även flexibla och digitala arbetssätt och har flera kontor i Stockholm. Fler av våra förmåner hittar du här.*

title: Senior Process Intelligence and Automation Consultant
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Intelligence technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing AI, data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need your help. Care to join us?
   

  

 The position of
 **Senior Process Intelligence and Automation Consultant** 
 (
 **Senior Value Engineer)** 
 is a trusted advisor helping customers achieve their strategic goals and realise significant value using the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform. A Value Engineer has full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers – landing, expanding, adopting and renewing. Responsibilities include translating customers’ objectives into value assessments or proof-of-value projects, building specific Celonis business cases and demos, running value workshops, and engaging with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver value driven results and secure long term partnership agreements.
   

  

**The Role:**
 As a
 **Senior Process Intelligence and Automation Consultant** 
 (
 **Senior Value Engineer)** 
 you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Team and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers' trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.
   

  

**The work you’ll do:**
**Identify & Frame Value**
* Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
* Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers
* Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executive


**Realize Value**
* Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
* Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
* Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives


**Scale Value**
* Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
* Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis Process Intelligence as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
* Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases


**The qualifications you need:**
**Live for Customer Value:** 
 Experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis, business process improvement and respective Software deployment. Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Business Software / SaaS Provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an Inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise.
   

  

**Data, Analytics, Applications & IT:** 
 Good knowledge of Business Software / SaaS applications (e.g. SAP), experience with implementing RPA and/or BI Tools and/or building Dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Knowledge of Python and/or SQL. Experience in collaborating with IT teams.
   

  

**Process Improvement & Value Realization:** 
 Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures, being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
   

  

**Project Management:** 
 Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible.
   

  

**Executive Stakeholder Management:** 
 Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in English and sovereign appearance.
   

  

**Business Domain Expertise:** 
 Understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
   

  

**Industry Expertise:** 
 Ideally expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities
   

  

**Degree:** 
 In Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program
   

  

**What Celonis Can Offer You:**
* Pioneer Innovation: Work with the leading, award-winning process mining technology, shaping the future of business.
* Accelerate Your Growth: Benefit from clear career paths, internal mobility, a dedicated learning program, and mentorship opportunities.
* Receive Exceptional Benefits: Including generous PTO, hybrid working options, company equity (RSUs), comprehensive benefits, extensive parental leave, dedicated volunteer days, and much more. Interns and working students explore your benefits here.
* Prioritize Your Well-being: Access to resources such as gym subsidies, counseling, and well-being programs.
* Connect and Belong: Find community and support through dedicated inclusion and belonging programs.
* Make Meaningful Impact: Be part of a company driven by strong values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future.
* Collaborate Globally: Join a dynamic, international team of talented individuals.
* Empowered Environment: Contribute your ideas in an open culture with autonomous teams.


**About Us:**
 Celonis makes processes work for people, companies and the planet. The Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses industry-leading process mining and AI technology and augments it with business context to give customers a living digital twin of their business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and provides everyone with a common language for understanding and improving businesses. Celonis enables its customers to continuously realize significant value across the top, bottom, and green line. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.
   

  

 Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.
   

  

**Celonis Inclusion Statement:**
 At Celonis, we believe our people make us who we are and that “The Best Team Wins”. We know that the best teams are made up of people who bring different perspectives to the table. And when everyone feels included, able to speak up and knows their voice is heard - that's when creativity and innovation happen.
   

  

**Your Privacy:**
 Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’ Accessibility and Candidate Notices
   

  

 By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.
   

  

 Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

title: Account Executive
description:
**Join Our Scaleup Journey & Fuel Your Curiosity!**
 At Lime Go, a thriving scaleup under Lime Technologies Sweden AB (publ), you’ll be part of a fast-moving, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a successful, publicly listed company. It's the best of both worlds – the agility of a startup and the stability of an industry leader with a proven track record of success.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
* A curiosity-driven, growth-oriented mindset ready to scale with us
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
* Sharp problem-solving abilities


**Your Role in Our Team**
* Own the entire sales process, from prospecting to closing and handover
* Target ideal customers across industries and regions
* Get creative with omnichannel outreach and inbound leads to build your pipeline
* Tailor our Data-driven Sales CRM to fit each customer’s needs – demo both online and in-person
* Negotiate to win larger deals faster, smashing your sales goals in the process


**The Product**
 Lime Go is a Data-Enriched Sales CRM built for SMBs in the Nordics. You’ll be selling to sales teams who understand the value of what we offer. With over 1,000 customers in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark, our aim is to become the top choice for ambitious companies across Europe.
   

  

 We’ve just completed a full product revamp, making Lime Go a fresh, modern, and powerful tool for your customers.
   

  

**The Lime Go Team**
 We’re a close-knit, ambitious team of 24 with bold growth goals for the coming years. We’re looking for a cornerstone player like you to help make it happen.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements** 
**Requirements**
* B2B sales experience, preferably 2+ years of selling complex products/services (bonus if SaaS!)
* Bachelor’s degree
* Driver's license
* Willing to work from our office in Stockholm
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* A proven track record of sales excellence


 You’ll report to Jonas (Sales Manager) and have weekly 1-on-1s, plus collaborate with our 11-member Revenue Operations team (Sales, CS, Product - all in Stockholm!).
   

  

**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive base salary with performance-based commissions (with kicker levels!)
* 6 weeks of vacation, company conferences and parties, wellness allowance, pension, and more
* A fun, collaborative environment with regular team activities and laughs


**The Application Process**
* Screening call with the team
* Interview
* Case assignment to pitch our product
* In-depth interview(s) with team members
* Reference check
* Agreement walkthrough
* Final interview with Lime Group’s CEO CEO and/or Business Unit Director.


 Don’t wait – apply now and start your journey with us. Europe is ready for Lime Go. Are you?
   

  

 Let’s Go! 🚀

title: Data Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla datalösningar som gör skillnad? Vi söker en Data Engineer till ICA Sverige med uppdrag mot ett av våra operativa bolag.
   

  

**Om jobbet som Data Engineer**
 I rollen ansvarar du för att samla in, strukturera och analysera omfattande datamängder för att möjliggöra välgrundande affärsbeslut och driva innovation. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med hela datalivscykeln. Du designar, utvecklar och implementerar skalbara dataflöden och bidrar med insikter för att optimera processer. Hos oss arbetar du enligt DevOps – du bygger och äger dina lösningar.
   

  

 Som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att verka både i ett team inom ICA Sverige och i ett team hos ett av våra andra operativa bolag. Teamet präglas av hög senioritet, där varje Data Engineer även är en integrerad del av ett team inom ditt verksamhetsområde. Du jobbar verksamhetsnära och håller i workshops och demos för både IT och verksamhet.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara med och etablera samt vidareutveckla ramverk, riktlinjer och rutiner för effektiva arbetssätt. Du blir en del av ett team som själva utformar och ständigt förbättrar sina processer. Här är det vi som är experterna på vårt eget arbetssätt.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Du har gedigen kompetens av datamodellering (Kimball) och arbete i moderna dataplattformar som GCP. Du har även goda kunskaper i DBT, GitHub, Python och SQL. Du trivs med att lösa komplexa frågor och utmana arbetssätt. Vi ser gärna att du har en konsultbakgrund där du utvecklat din expertis i flera olika komplexa projekt.
   

  

 Du trivs i en verksamhetsnära roll där du både kan reda ut komplexa frågeställningar och utmana befintliga arbetssätt. Som person är du kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och en självklar lagspelare.
