You treat tools like Claude, ChatGPT, and other AI copilots as force multipliers, allowing you to deliver at a level and speed others can’t match. For you, AI isn’t an add-on, it’s the default operating system for how you think, work, and lead. You’re relentlessly curious about new capabilities, and you push the limits of what’s possible, turning AI into a competitive advantage for yourself, Upsales, and our customers. This is a role for someone with real ambition: someone who wants to set a new standard for efficiency, precision, and impact in the age of AI.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Drive end-to-end new business. From prospecting to negotiation and close.
* Create and execute strategic outbound campaigns toward key verticals and segments.
* Engage with CEOs, CROs, and other revenue leaders to identify growth opportunities.
* Position Upsales AI as a must-have platform for data-driven sales and marketing teams.
* Collaborate with product, marketing, and solution engineers to craft winning proposals.
* Build a strong, predictable pipeline, and consistently exceed your targets.


**Who We're Looking For**
 This isn’t an entry-level role, we’re looking for someone who has already
 **proven they can win at the highest level** 
 .
   

  

* At least 5 years of proven experience in complex B2B sales
* A degree from a respected academic institution, preferably in the technical or economic field
* A strong track record of meeting and exceeding targets
* Experience building long-term relationships with fast-growing mid-sized companies
* A proactive, ambitious mindset with full ownership of the sales process
* Excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish
* Driven by growth, responsibility, and the ambition to build something meaningful


 Personality-wise? You’re
 **obsessed with winning** 
 , but never at the expense of the team. You take pride in delivering results, but you’re also the kind of person who jumps in to help a teammate close a deal or solve a tough problem. You raise the bar, and bring others with you.
   

  

 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: Financial System Specialist
description:
Rollen som Financial System Specialist är en möjlighet att utvecklas i gränslandet mellan finans, teknik och verksamhetsutveckling inom Afa Försäkrings kapitalförvaltning. I tjänsten kombineras arbete med finansiella system, utvecklingsprojekt och processförbättring.
   

  

 Fokus ligger på kapitalförvaltningssystemet SimCorp Dimension. Du kommer även bli involverad i konfigurering av gränssnitt till andra finansiella system som tex Bloomberg, Swift etc.
   

  

**Vad du kan förvänta dig**
 Som Financial System Specialist blir du en central del av Afa Försäkrings kapitalförvaltning med ansvar för att optimera, vidareutveckla och säkerställa en stabil drift av kapitalförvaltningens finanssystem.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Konfigurera och optimera systemet för att stödja verksamhetens behov och uppnå en stabil, effektiv drift.
* Delta aktivt utvecklingsprojekt med fokus på nya moduler, funktioner och integrationer mot externa system.
* Medverka i projekt och utredningar som syftar till att förbättra och effektivisera kapitalförvaltningens processer.
* Samarbeta nära verksamheten för att förstå behoven och bidra till att systemet används på bästa sätt.
* Säkerställa att IT-driftens leveranser motsvarar kapitalförvaltningens krav genom samarbete och koordinering.


 Det här är en roll för dig som trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och finans. Afa Försäkring är en organisation som satsar på kompetensutveckling och lärande och du har möjlighet att växa i rollen.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du har intresse av finansverksamhet och drivs av att utveckla processer och skapa effektiva lösningar.
   

  

 Du har en bakgrund inom Ekonomi/Finans eller teknik. Är du bekant med SimCorp Dimension är det meriterande.
   

  

 Rollen kräver god samarbetsförmåga, ansvarstagande och en prestigelös inställning. Du är lösningsorienterad, initiativtagande och har förmågan att driva arbetet i mål. Svenska och engelska behärskar du flytande, både muntligt och skriftligt, och du har en relevant akademisk utbildning.
   

  

**Vilka är vi**
 Kapitalförvaltningens uppdrag är att förvalta Afa Försäkrings kapital - idag cirka 230 miljarder kronor. Tillgångarna är fördelade på tillgångsslagen aktier, obligationer, fastigheter och andra onoterade tillgångar.
   

  

 Tjänsten tillhör gruppen Affärsutveckling & Redovisning, som består av sex personer inklusive chef, med ansvar för systemförvaltning av finanssystem, användarsupport, projektledning, redovisning och rapportering samt processutveckling..
   

  

**Våra förmåner**
 Vi vill att du som anställd ska uppleva att du utvecklas över tid, och att du får möjlighet att bredda och fördjupa din kompetens.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att skapa en hög trivsel och för att våra medarbetare ska ha rätt förutsättningar för sitt arbete. Som anställd hos oss får du ta del av flertalet förmåner
   

  

* Kollektivavtal med försäkringar och tjänstepension
* Tydlig balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Gratis träningspass och gym på kontoret
* Afa Fritid med allt från brädspel till fjällvandring
* Vi uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling


 Vårt kontor är beläget i centrala Stockholm, enkelt för dig som pendlar. Möjlighet till att jobba hemifrån några dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Mer information**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Afa Försäkring med Computer Sweden Recruitment. För frågor, kontakta gärna; Britta Liljegren, britta.liljegren@csrecruitment.se
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande - vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 En bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras på slutkandidaten.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter är Forena, Benny Nyberg, +46708939512 och Akademikerföreningen Maria Schütt, +46706964974
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Afa För­säkring gör vardagen tryggare i arbetslivet. Våra försäk­ringar är en del av kollektivavtalen och ger ekonomiskt stöd vid sjukdom, arbetsskada, arbetsbrist, dödsfall och föräldraledighet. Vi finansierar forskning och stödjer insatser som förebygger arbets­skador och sjukfrånvaro. På så vis bidrar vi till ett hållbart arbetsliv. Afa För­säkring ägs av Svenskt Näringsliv, LO och PTK.

title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
As a Strategic Account Manager at Upsales, you operate where technology, customer value, and long-term growth meet. Your mission is to help existing customers realize the full potential of Upsales by translating AI capabilities into measurable outcomes across their revenue operations.
   

  

 Upsales is not just a CRM. We are Europe’s leading AI platform for B2B revenue acceleration. Founded in Stockholm and built for high-performing revenue teams, we help ambitious companies work smarter, predict better, and scale with precision. Our culture is shaped by ownership, craftsmanship, and an AI-first mindset.
   

  

 In this role, you work cross-functionally with Solutions Engineers, Onboarding, and Customer Success to deeply understand each customer’s setup, goals, and challenges. You act as a trusted advisor, connecting product capabilities with real-world use cases. This is about long-term value creation, not transactional selling.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Take ownership of a strategic portfolio of existing customers with a focus on adoption, value realization, and sustainable expansion
* Develop a deep understanding of customer workflows, data maturity, and business objectives
* Identify opportunities where Upsales’ AI and platform capabilities can unlock new value
* Co-create solution designs and success plans together with Solutions Engineers and Customer Success
* Lead strategic account dialogues, roadmap discussions, and executive-level conversations
* Drive expansion through demonstrated impact, not pressure or volume
* Collaborate with Product, Customer Success, and Sales leadership to continuously improve how we deliver customer value
* Contribute to ARR growth by helping customers scale successfully with Upsales over time


**AI first mindset**
 We’re not looking for someone who simply uses AI. We want someone who weaponizes it. You treat tools like Claude, ChatGPT, and other AI copilots as force multipliers, allowing you to deliver at a level and speed others can’t match. For you, AI isn’t an add-on, it’s the default operating system for how you think, work, and lead. You’re relentlessly curious about new capabilities, and you push the limits of what’s possible, turning AI into a competitive advantage for yourself, Upsales, and our customers. This is a role for someone with real ambition: someone who wants to set a new standard for efficiency, precision, and impact in the age of AI.
   

  

 Who We’re Looking For
   

  

* At least 5 years of proven experience in complex B2B sales
* A strong track record of meeting and exceeding targets
* Experience building long-term relationships with fast-growing mid-sized companies
* A proactive, ambitious mindset with full ownership of the sales process
* Excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish
* Driven by growth, responsibility, and the ambition to build something meaningful


 You are not looking for just another role. You are looking for momentum.
   

  

 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: Asset administratör
description:
Gillar du när data stämmer, flöden fungerar och alla är i synk? På Atea inom Asset Management Services blir du en nyckelperson som säkerställer kvaliteten i våra kunders it miljöer. Här gör din precision och ditt engagemang skillnad – samtidigt som du får stora möjligheter att påverka datakvalitet, leveransflöden och kundupplevelse i ett erfaret och stöttande team.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Atea har en av Sveriges mest omfattande asset och lifecycletjänster. Vi hjälper våra kunder att få full kontroll över sin it miljö genom hela livscykeln. Som Asset administratör spelar du en central roll i att hålla assetdata korrekt, kvalitetssäkrad och tillgänglig – och du bidrar direkt till våra kunders upplevelse, effektivitet och hållbarhet. Du kommer att arbeta i nära samarbete med många olika roller, där vi tror på att samarbete och kommunikation är nyckeln för att vi tillsammans ska lyckas!
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Datakvalitet - Säkerställa korrekt och spårbar assetdata, identifiera avvikelser och hantera uppdateringar enligt kundernas förväntningar
* Koordinering & logistik - Koordinera installationer, transporter och återtag samt följa upp datum, förändringar och avvikelser
* Processer & rutiner - Arbeta enligt etablerade rutiner, bidra till förbättringar och dokumentera för spårbarhet
* Projektstöd - Stödja projektledare och kundteam i införande och förvaltning samt kravställa rutiner inom Asset Management


**Vem är du?**
 Du tar ett naturligt ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och driver arbetet framåt tillsammans med teamet. Du trivs med att hantera och koordinera stora datamängder i högt tempo och skapar struktur i komplexa projekt. Som kvalitetsdriven problemlösare arbetar du proaktivt, fångar avvikelser tidigt och driver ärenden hela vägen till korrekt leverans, även när hinder uppstår.
   

  

 Du behöver inte ha lång erfarenhet av en liknande roll – viktigast är att du har rätt driv, nyfikenhet och vilja att utvecklas inom Asset Management.
   

  

 Känner du igen dig i ovan ser vi även att du har:
   

  

* Grundläggande förståelse och vana att navigera i planer och uppföljningsstrukturer
* Erfarenhet av asset‑/konfigurationsdata, livscykelhantering eller liknande administrativa it‑processer
* Erfarenhet att arbeta efter etablerade rutiner och förbättra dem när behov uppstår
* Goda kunskaper i Excel och vana att hantera strukturerade underlag
* God kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att hantera stora datamängder
* Erfarenhet av koordinering inom olika leveransflöden
* Vana av att arbeta i kund- och leverantörsnära roller
* God kommunikativ förmåga i övriga nordiska språk


**Om Atea**
 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med it och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara it-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar it-värld.
   

  

 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Birgit Henriksson, manager asset management, via birgit.henriksson@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
   

  

 I den här rekryteringen används arbetspsykologiska tester som en del av urvalsprocessen. Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll för vissa av våra tjänster, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett flexibelt arbetssätt – Vi tror på att ge möjlighet till flexibilitet i vardagen men merparten av arbetstiden som vi inte spenderar hos en kund utgår vi från kontoret, som är vår primära arbetsplats.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

*Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag* 
 .
   

  

**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Systemutvecklare sökes till spännande SaaS-projekt inom EdTech
description:
**Vill du vara med och skapa Sveriges bästa lärplattform?** 
 EdTech är ett spännande och växande område inom systemutveckling. Inom detta område driver JENSEN education utvecklingen med vår egenutvecklade lärplattform
 **Campus.**
 Vi söker nu en engagerad utvecklare för att skapa Sveriges bästa lärplattform. Vi söker efter dig som är kreativ och vill vara med och bidra till ett meningsfullt syfte där tusentals elever ges bättre chans att lyckas med sina studier och lärares arbete underlättas.
   

  

 Nu vill vi utöka vår IT-utvecklingsavdelning med en ny utvecklare. JENSEN IT-utvecklingsteam ansvarar för JENSENs interna datasystem samt vår egna utbildnings mjukvara Campus. Våra datasystem förser hela verksamheten på 26 000 användare med de verktyg de behöver.
   

  

 Du kommer att utveckla ny kod i vår tech-stack som består av:
 **C#, .NET, Angular, NodeJS samt React-Native** 
 . Vi ska precis påbörja ett projekt där vi bygger en helt ny intern SaaS-tjänst från grunden, vilket du kommer vara mest delaktig i. Det kan även förekomma buggfixar i äldre legacy-system. Vi kör SCRUM med en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

**I den här rollen kommer du att:**
* Vara med och bygga en helt ny SaaS-tjänst från grunden.
* Utveckla backend-kod i C#/.NET enligt specifikationer.
* Arbeta med PostgreSQL-databaser.
* Jobba nära produktägare och UX/UI-designer i agila flöden.
* Genomföra code review av andra utvecklares kod.
* Vara en del av något större – din kod påverkar 26 000 dagliga användare.


**Om du har kunskaper i andra plattformar (språk), så kan det även bli:**
* Utveckla frontend i Angular/NodeJS efter Figma-mockups.
* Utveckla frontend och/eller backend för vår mobilapp i React-Native.
* Eventuellt, i liten skala, förbättra affärskritiska funktioner i legacy-system.


**Vi tror att du har:**
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom C#, .NET och PostgreSQL.
* Erfarenhet från produktutveckling i agila team.
* En nyfiken, ansvarstagande inställning och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap.


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Domänkunskap eller erfarenhet inom EdTech.
* Kunskaper inom Typescript, Angular, NodeJS eller React-Native.
* Akademisk examen i ett relevant ämne.


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Hos oss får du mer än bara ett jobb. Du blir en del av en kultur som präglas av engagemang, gemenskap och en stark vilja att göra skillnad – både för våra 26 000 användare och för vår verksamhet. Vi erbjuder dig:
   

  

* Professionell utveckling: Stora möjligheter att fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper och växa i din roll genom komplexa projekt och nyutveckling.
* Trygghet & Tillväxt: En trygg anställning i ett väletablerat och expansivt företag som vågar satsa på egen innovation och modern teknik.
* Unik arbetsmiljö: En trevlig arbetsplats mitt i Gamla Stan där vi sitter i historiska lokaler med närhet till både kollegor och stadsdelens inspirerande miljöer.
* Inflytande på riktigt: En prestigelös arbetsmiljö där vi värdesätter samarbete och eget ansvar, och där dina idéer och tekniska bidrag värderas högt i beslutsfattandet.


**Anställningsform**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på 100%, med start enligt överenskommelse. Vi tillämpar sex månader provanställning.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Vi sitter i ljusa, trevliga och moderna lokaler centralt i Gamla stan, Stockholm. På huvudkontoret arbetar ca 40 medarbetare och chefer varav 8 personer med verksamheternas IT-miljö.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Du ansöker genom att registrera din profil och bifoga ditt CV och andra relevanta dokument. Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via webben, ansökningar som kommer in på annat sätt behandlas inte. Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag, dock senast den 26.03.31. Tillsättning av tjänst kan komma att ske innan sista ansökningsdagen. Mer information om vår rekryteringsprocess hittar du på vår hemsida under lediga tjänster.
   

  

 Som en del av rekryteringsprocessen använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester för kandidater som går vidare till ett senare skede, och vi ber då även om ett utdrag ur belastningsregistret.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten och hur det är att jobba hos oss, vänligen kontakta IT-Chef Andreas Külekci på andreas.kulekci@jenseneducation.se .
   

  

 Samtal/mejl från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.
   

  

**Låter det intressant? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 JENSEN education är ett av Sveriges största privata utbildningsföretag med förtroendet att utbilda drygt 17 000 elever inom fem olika områden – förskola, grundskola, gymnasium, vuxenutbildning samt yrkeshögskola. JENSEN grundades 1996 av Håkan Jensen, företagets vd och ägare, och står för långsiktighet, kvalitet och ansvarstagande. Utbildningskonceptet ”Träning för verkligheten och bildning som mål” genomsyrar all verksamhet.

title: Developer in C++ Automotive
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise in IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.
   

  

 Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.
   

  

 Feel free to apply today, selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Professional Galaxy is looking for a
 **Developer in C++ Automotive** 
 on behalf of our client.
   

  

**Kravprofil**
 We are looking for a highly experienced consultant to support an assignment focused on ECU software development within the automotive domain. The ideal candidate has 10+ years of experience in automotive software development and has worked both at system/architecture level and hands-on with embedded software development.
   

  

 The assignment requires deep technical expertise combined with a strong understanding of automotive platforms and electronic architectures.
   

  

**Background:**
 Strong hands-on experience in C++
   

  

 Extensive experience working with automotive software platforms
   

  

 Deep understanding of automotive E/E architectures
   

  

 Proven background in ECU software development within the automotive industry
   

  

 Experience working at both architecture level and implementation level
   

  

 Solid knowledge of middleware, ARM-based architectures, and CAN/CAN FD protocols
   

  

 Familiarity with AUTOSAR (Classic and/or Adaptive) standards
   

  

 Experience in developing robust, safety-conscious embedded software in resource-constrained environments
   

  

**Other Information :**
**Assignment Duration :** 
 6 Months
   

  

**Work Model :** 
 On-site
   

  

**Application Deadline** 
 : 2026-02-26
   

  

 Please apply directly through our system with:
   

  

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


 In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

title: Product Manager - Messaging
description:
**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, PayPal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Our Super Network, APIs, and applications enable teams across Sinch to operate, support, and scale messaging services reliably and securely worldwide.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation.
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 We are looking for a structured, commercially driven Product Manager to join our global Messaging organization.
 



 This role spans two critical areas of our platform.
 



 First, you will focus on the core of our business: continuously optimizing our global Messaging routing engine to maximize cost efficiency and increase automation across internal processes. Your work will directly influence margin performance and operational scalability.
 



 Second, you will own product strategy for internal access management and tooling across Sinch's messaging platforms. This includes defining and governing access rights, permissions, and user tooling to ensure the right level of access to messaging systems-while upholding the highest standards of security, compliance, and auditability.
 



 As traffic across Sinch's platform continues to grow at significant scale, your contribution will be pivotal in ensuring we remain the most intelligent, cost-efficient, and high-performing A2P messaging platform in the market. You will drive product initiatives that directly impact Gross Profit (GP), delivery quality, and operational excellence.
 



 You will collaborate closely with Engineering, Data Science, Operations, and Commercial teams to deliver measurable improvements in efficiency, automation, and cost performance.
 



 This role reports to the SMS Product Director and is based in Stockholm with a hybrid working setup.
 



 What you'll do:
 


* Own and execute the product roadmap for internal access management, defining roles, permissions, and governance models across messaging systems and tooling to ensure secure, compliant, and scalable operations.
* Lead the product strategy for operational efficiency within Messaging, identifying and prioritizing initiatives that improve automation, scalability, cost control, and delivery performance.
* Partner with Engineering, Security, and IT to design and implement robust, auditable access-control frameworks that protect sensitive data and tools while enabling operational agility.
* Collaborate with Engineering and Operations to eliminate manual processes, driving automation that improves reliability, reduces operational overhead, and minimizes revenue leakage.
* Define, track, and own KPIs related to cost efficiency, operational performance, and Gross Profit optimization, ensuring data-driven prioritization and measurable business impact.
* Continuously enhance our messaging platform through experimentation and data-driven iteration, leveraging analytics and feedback loops to unlock performance improvements at scale.
* Communicate clearly and effectively with stakeholders across time zones, translating complex technical and data insights into tangible business outcomes.



**REQUIREMENTS** 



* An experienced Product Manager, Technical Product Owner, or Business Analyst with strong analytical and operational skills.
* Experience in telecoms, A2P/P2P messaging, or large-scale infrastructure optimization is highly desirable.
* Hands-on experience with internal access management, RBAC, permissions, or identity-related systems.
* Data-driven, with a solid grasp of SQL, data analysis, and BI tools (e.g., Qlik, Tableau). Hands-on comfort with data is essential.
* Highly collaborative-you can influence and build strong relationships with Engineering, Operations, and Commercial teams.
* Structured and outcome-oriented, with a proven ability to simplify complexity and prioritize for maximum business impact.
* A self-starter who thrives in a global, fast-paced environment and is passionate about using data to drive business results. Bachelor's Degree required; a background in a technical or business discipline is preferred.



 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English** 
 .
 



 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.
 



 Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.



**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Operational Product Manager Contact Center
description:
We’re looking for an Operational Product Manager – Contact Center to join us at Telia.
   

  

 I’m Stefan Bjurström, Head of Product Management UC & CS, and I’m searching for someone ready to grow with us at Telia B2B. This is a senior B2B role for someone who thrives in the intersection of customer journeys, operations, IT and product to create a real, visible difference.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 In this role, you are accountable for the operational customer experience Contact Center offerings across the full product lifecycle. You ensure that what we promise commercially is delivered seamlessly in customer engagement and collaboration processes — with high quality, efficiency and scalability.
   

  

 You will work close to Customer Operations, IT, Commercial, Sales and other Product teams, with a near- to mid-term focus (1–12 months). Your work directly impacts customer satisfaction, operational efficiency and business performance.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Own the end-to-end operational customer experience for UC and Contact Center products and offerings across their lifecycle
* Drive localization and implementation of products into customer journeys, operational processes and IT systems
* Secure quality, stability and performance across customer engagement and collaboration services (voice, digital, assisted, UC)
* Identify and drive continuous improvements balancing customer experience, efficiency and scalability
* Act as the key interface between business requirements, operations and IT, translating needs into executable solutions
* Follow up on operational KPIs, incidents, customer feedback and journey performance, and drive corrective actions
* Ensure clear documentation, handovers and ways of working across Product, Operations and IT


 You are the one who makes sure our Contact Center offerings work every day, for every customer.
   

  

**What will help you thrive in this role:**
 To be successful in this role, we believe you bring strong operational understanding combined with a customer-centric and structured mindset. You have experience from product development, product lifecycle management or operational product roles within Telecom or similar B2B environments.
   

  

 Key skills:
   

  

* Experience in product development, product lifecycle management or operational product roles within Telecom or similar B2B environments
* Solid understanding of UC and/or Contact Center solutions, customer operations and customer journeys
* Experience translating product and commercial requirements into operational processes and IT solutions
* A structured, proactive way of working and the ability to drive improvements in complex, cross-functional environments
* An academic degree
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken


**Join us to shape smarter living for people, businesses, and the planet**
 At Telia, we’re a team of 15 000 colleagues across the Nordics and Baltics, passionate about technology and connectivity. As a Leading Telecommunications Operator & Climate Leader, we drive change with large-scale, impactful projects while building a sustainable, inclusive world.
   

  

 Here, you can grow your skills, lead meaningful projects, and thrive in a supportive, diverse environment. Whether you’re taking your first step or your next, Telia is a place to grow, belong, and make a real impact.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 2026-03-11.Please note that we might close the position earlier if we find the right candidate, so don’t wait too long to apply!
   

  

 If you’re selected for the next stage, you’ll be contacted by our
 **Talent Acquisition Partner.** 
 Background and reference checks will be part of the process.
   

  

 Want to know more about this role? Please reach out to Stefan Bjurström, at stefan.bjurstrom@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Equal opportunities**
 At Telia, we recognize talent by professional skills and growth potential. We champion diversity, ensuring every individual’s needs are met, regardless of disability, gender, age, nationality, sexual orientation, or social status. Together, we’re dedicated to fostering an inclusive work environment where your uniqueness is our strength.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen - together!**

title: Energy Marshall
description:
**Location: Gavle, Sweden** 




  





 Collen is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, we firmly believe that a harmonious and inclusive environment cultivates innovation and drives success. We go above and beyond to ensure that safety is ingrained in everything we do. You can help create a culture where safety is a shared value and a top priority for all stakeholders involved in the project.
 



  





**If you are seeking an opportunity to be part of a storied history, join a team that leads the industry and contribute to a workplace where inclusivity and safety take centre stage.** 




  





 Reporting to the MEP Department Manager in Region, the
 **key requirements** 
 are:
 



  




* A third level qualification in a related field
* 5 years post Qualification experience in a similar role.



  





**Responsbilities:** 



* To align energy compliance activities so they are completed in a safe manner ensuring the Health and Safety of all stakeholders is kept to the forefront of any decisions made or works executed.
* To lead by example and ensure all stakeholders are made aware of MEP energy specific Health & Safety policies and procedures and ensure that Health & Safety forms a key part of any discussions.
* To be fully aware of and ensure that all stakeholders are aware of the existence of any hazardous energies and any site-specific management strategies (Lock Out Tag Out) around these sources of energy.
* To provide technical and practical advice and assistance and offer training on energy compliance where necessary.
* To collaborate with the project Health and Safety Team around best in class Energy Compliance.
* To review and promote sustainable energy resources across our projects.
* To undertake audits for compliance with energy isolations and lock out/tag out procedure.
* To liaise with contractors, procurement, & local authorities around energy compliance
* To keep up to date with industry legislation and energy compliance regulations.
* To have a full working knowledge of project systems and equipment and to track systems installation to ensure energy compliance and manage this at each stage of the project build.
* To complete site inspections to ensure installations conform to relevant requirements.
* To coordinate rooms and or areas to ensure they meet relevant energy compliance standards and requirements for advanced Beneficial Use in line with the master construction program.
* Take ownership of the company Lock Out Tag Out protocol from a site leadership standpoint and hold others to account around its content.
* To ensure that contractors and vendors are adequately resourced to complete works competently and safely.
* To review the site construction power system (Temporary Power) to ensure it is installed to meet ongoing construction and commissioning requirements.
* To chair and input into onsite and offsite meetings with all relevant project stakeholders as per project requirements.
* To keep accurate records of audits, audit findings and remedial works.

title: Research Associate (Data Scientist) - City Futures Research Centre
description:
This Job is based in Australia
   

  

* Employment Type: 12 month fixed-term contract
* Remuneration: $91,381 - $121,838 + 17% super + Leave Loading
* Location: UNSW Kensington Campus


**Why Your Role Matters**
 The Research Associate (Data Scientist) plays a key role in funded research projects, undertaking activities such as data collection, data wrangling, big data analytics, and the application of artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques. The role is focused on data and analytics related to development applications across Australia and is based within the City Futures Research Centre.
   

  

 The Research Associate reports to a Senior Lecturer and works as part of a collaborative, multidisciplinary team of data scientists, software engineers, and computer scientists and has no direct reports.
   

  

**Responsibilities Summary**
* Contribute independently and collaboratively to research activities that enhance the quality and impact of research outcomes in the discipline.
* Undertake discipline appropriate research tasks including literature reviews, surveys, data collection, recording and analysis using appropriate research methods.
* Collect, clean, manage and analyse research data from diverse sources, including open data repositories and government and industry partners, in support of the Australian Development Applications Intelligence project.
* Apply established and emerging analytical methods, including spatial analysis, natural language processing and machine learning, under the guidance of senior academic staff.
* Contribute to scholarly outputs and support the dissemination of research findings through publications, conferences and workshops.
* Assist with supervision of research students and contribute to the broader development of research activities within the project team.


 For more information regarding the responsibilities for this role, please refer to the Position Description at JOBS@UNSW.
   

  

**Skills And Experience Summary**
* A PhD in a related discipline and/or relevant professional experience in urban analytics, data science, modelling and simulation, computer science, or geographic information science.
* Demonstrated skills in data analytical techniques, including geoprocessing, spatial statistics, big data analytics, and spatial data mining.
* Experience applying artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques, including natural language processing and other data mining methods, to large datasets (ideally urban or city-scale data).
* Proficiency in computer programming for data analysis, with experience using languages such as Python and R to work with large and complex datasets.
* Proven commitment to proactively keeping up to date with discipline knowledge and developments.
* Demonstrated ability to undertake high quality academic research and conduct independent research with limited supervision.
* Demonstrated track record of publications and conference presentations relative to opportunity.
* Demonstrated ability to work in a team, collaborate across disciplines and build effective relationships.
* Evidence of highly developed interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated ability to communicate and interact with a diverse range of stakeholders and students.


**Benefits and Culture:** 
 People are at the core of everything we do. We recognise it is the contributions of our staff who make UNSW one of the best universities in Australia and the world. Our benefits include:
   

  

* Career development opportunities
* 17% Superannuation contributions and additional leave loading payments
* Additional 3 days of leave over Christmas period
* Discounts and entitlements (retail, education, fitness)


**How to Apply:** 
 Submit your CV and a separate document outlining your suitability for the role in relation to each of the selection criteria (listed under skills & experience above), via the application portal
 **before 8 March at 11:30pm** 
 .
   

  

 A copy of the Position Description can be found on JOBS@UNSW.
   

  

**UNSW is unable to offer sponsorship for this position. Applicants must have full Australian working rights for the duration of the contract.**
 Get in Touch: For queries regarding the recruitment process, contact Lucy Gerondis, Talent Acquisition Consultant, UNSW: l.gerondis@unsw.edu.au
   

  

 (Applications sent via email will not be accepted, please apply via the application portal).
   

  

 UNSW is committed to evolving a culture that embraces equity and supports a diverse and inclusive community where everyone can participate fairly, in a safe and respectful environment. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and encourage applications from people of diverse gender, sexual orientation, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people with disability and those with caring and family responsibilities. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.
   

  

 The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

title: Digital strateg till Stockholmsmässan
description:
**Vill du vara med och driva Stockholmsmässans digitaliseringsresa och skapa framtidens mötesplats** 
 ?
 
 Vi söker dig som vill leda digitala förändringsprojekt och omsätta strategiska initiativ till konkreta lösningar som skapar affärsnytta, höjer kundupplevelsen och effektiviserar verksamheten.
   




**Om rollen** 

 Som Digital strateg är du en nyckelperson för att skapa och realisera Stockholmsmässans digitaliseringsstrategi. Du initierar, driver och genomför digitala utvecklingsprojekt med fokus på tjänstedesign, kundreseoptimering och interna processer. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med IT, externa leverantörer och affärsverksamheten för att kravställa och implementera digitala lösningar. Du bidrar aktivt till utveckling, standardisering och minskad komplexitet i våra digitala miljöer.
   




**Dina främsta arbetsuppgifter är att:** 

 ·      Vara en drivande kraft i att utforma, initiera och utveckla Stockholmsmässans digitala strategi och handlingsplan för att stärka organisationens marknadsledande position
 



 ·      Initiera och leda digitala utvecklingsprojekt, ofta med fokus på tjänstedesign och kundreseoptimering.
 



 ·      Kravställa digitala lösningar i samverkan med IT och externa leverantörer.
 



 ·      Driva förändringsledning och kompetenshöjning i digitala arbetssätt.
 



 ·      Kartlägga och analysera processer för att identifiera digitala förbättringsmöjligheter.
 



 ·      Följa upp och analysera effekter av digitala satsningar och föreslå förbättringar.
 



 ·      Fungera som rådgivare i digitala frågor för affärsverksamheten.
   




**Vi söker dig som har:** 

 ·      Relevant akademisk examen inom IT eller motsvarande.
 



 ·      Flerårig erfarenhet av arbete inom IT- eller digitaliseringsverksamheter.
 



 ·      Erfarenhet av att arbeta strategiskt inom digitalisering och IT och arbete med förändringsledning.
 



 ·      God förståelse för moderna teknologier och metoder såsom AI, cloud och digital transformation.
 



 ·      Önskvärt men inget krav: Erfarenhet från digitalisering inom upplevelseindustrin, evenemang eller mässor.
   




**Vad vi erbjuder** 

 Nu står vi inför en spännande förändringsresa med en tydlig agenda och i denna roll får du chansen att göra verklig skillnad för både våra kunder och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med engagerade kollegor och vi erbjuder utvecklingsmöjligheter och chansen att vara med och skapa framtidens mötesplats i Stockholm.
   




**Om Stockholmsmässan** 

 Stockholmsmässan är Nordens största mötesplats med ett brett utbud av lokaler och tjänster för alla typer av event. I över 80 år har vi varit en arena där människor möts för att dela kunskap, inspireras och skapa affärer.
 



 Vi erbjuder förmåner som kollektivavtal med pension, försäkringar och föräldralön, samt friskvårdsbidrag. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med 6 månaders provanställning. Arbetet sker i huvudsak från kontoret med viss möjlighet till distansarbete där verksamheten tillåter.
   




**Ansök nu!** 

 Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens mötesplats? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 

 Sista ansökningsdag är den
 
*22 mars* 

 , men urval sker löpande – så vänta inte.
 

 Vill du veta mer? Läs mer om oss på www.stockholmsmassan.se. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta: Johan Lotsander Director of Commercial Development, johan.lotsander@stockholmsmassan.se 08-749 41 88.

title: Fintech Co-Founder / CEO (100 % remote) (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking to hire ambitious entrepreneurs to start and scale their own startups.
 


  


 We are serial entrepreneurs, for example Paul Müller (founder Adjust, €1.2B exit) and Petter Made (founder SumUp, €8B) who are eager to support outlier personalities and serial entrepreneurs to build €1B+ companies.
 


  


 Our offer:
 


  

  
* A salary while you build your startup as you will directly be employed by us. Alternatively, you can opt for up to
 **€500k** 
 in funding.
  
* **1:1 sparring with unicorn founders** 
 on a weekly basis
  
* **Community** 
 : Access to the top 0.1% of founders, peers and investors
  
* **Team building** 
 : Hiring top notch talent supported through our network (over 50,000 professionals)
  
* **Distribution** 
 : Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine
  
* **Funding support** 
 for securing a multi-million euro funding round within 12 months (on average, EWOR Fellows raise > €2M after our Grand Pitch)
  


  


 One of our fellows set a record for Europe’s largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a €12M pre-seed investment.
 


  

 Tasks
   

  
* You will own, build, and run your startup in fields such as Fintech
  
* You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management
  
* You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs
  
* You will receive intensive coaching to make your startup ready to raise millions in funding
  
* You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing engine respectively
  


  

 Requirements
   

  
* You are based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate
  
* You are willing to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to €100M+ in revenues
  
* You have excellent communication skills in the English language
  


  


 Join us and build a €1B+ company with us!

title: Product Lead, Courier Delivery Experience
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join our Courier and Delivery Experience team. This role will focus on ensuring world-class courier and consumer delivery experiences while optimizing the delivery process for operational excellence. The team’s focus is on enhancing key touchpoints in the courier journey, ensuring seamless delivery experiences, and developing product innovations that improve Courier and Consumer experiences and reliability.
   

  

 You will play a crucial role in shaping the courier experience, ensuring that our couriers feel valued and supported while enhancing the efficiency of deliveries. By blending operational expertise with a deep understanding of courier needs, you will improve the user journey from onboarding couriers to completing deliveries. From designing new features that boost courier satisfaction to refining delivery processes, your work will contribute to key metrics across courier engagement, performance, and satisfaction.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have an exceptional track record in product management, with proven success in working with cross-functional teams across engineering, design, product, and operations. You will define the vision and roadmap for courier and delivery experiences across multiple projects. Working in partnership with business stakeholders, you will also collaborate on cross-team initiatives, contributing to the broader business strategy while ensuring a deep understanding of the courier experience.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from various backgrounds, but ideally, you bring:
   

  

* Several years of experience in product management, specializing in consumer-facing products, courier services, delivery systems, or logistics.
* Demonstrated expertise in supporting cross-functional teams and fostering operational excellence in fast-paced, high-demand industries.
* Proven track record in building products influencing cross-functional teams, including engineering, data, design, and operations.
* Expertise in developing user-centric products, with the ability to address complex user experience-related challenges.
* High ownership and collaborative capabilities, making thoughtful decisions, and focusing on product details to ensure execution aligns with the vision.
* Strong ability to define, execute, and measure meaningful OKRs, ensuring alignment with company-wide goals and fostering bottom-up alignment from your team.
* Ability to focus on the bigger picture, creating solutions that benefit couriers, operations, and customer experiences across the organization.
* Excellent stakeholder management skills, able to work effectively with diverse internal teams and external partners, while confidently engaging with leadership in a high-visibility role.


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Fullstack utvecklare Telenor
description:
Är du en nyfiken fullstack-utvecklare som vill jobba i en teknikdriven miljö och göra skillnad för hundratusentals aktiva användare? Vimla är mobiloperatören, som genom att vara en fristående del av Telenor, kombinerar kraften från en stor organisation med friheten och flexibiliteten i ett litet team. Vi står för att ta kundfokus, enkelhet och schyssthet till en ny nivå på mobilmarknaden och i vårt team. Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt och roligt att vara kund så väl som medarbetare hos oss!
   

  

 Nu har du chansen att joina teamet i rollen som Senior fullstack utvecklare, ta chansen och sök!
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**
 I rollen som Senior Fullstack utvecklare på Vimla kommer du in i en scale-up miljö där du tillsammans med ditt team arbetar i syfte att utveckla och underhålla Vimlas tekniska miljö. Ni står i centrum för att bygga de tekniska förutsättningarna för en helt digital mobiloperatör. Du arbetar tillsammans med ett tight team av utvecklare med passion för teknik och bra stämning. Teamet består av såväl juniora som mer seniora kollegor, vilket medför en kultur av lärande och kunskapsdelning.
   

  

 Inom ramen för rollen kommer du
   

  

* Bygga och optimera våra API:er
* Förbättra vår CI/CD-pipeline
* Utveckla nya tjänster i vår digitala plattform
* Jobba med skalbarhet i vår molnbaserade miljö


 Hos oss får du möjlighet att utmanas, utveckla din kompetens och arbeta med fantastiska och kompetenta kollegor. Om du gillar att ha en möjlighet att påverka vad du jobbar med, en bredd i dina arbetsuppgifter och jobba i ett tight DevOps-team - det här är platsen för dig!
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
 Vi ser att du har minst tre års tidigare erfarenheter av utveckling inom Typescript, node backends samt react för frontend. Du har fokus på leverans och säkerställer alltid god kvalitet i slutresultatet och tror att du tidigare har erfarenhet från att designa, bygga och underhålla distribuerade system i en molnbaserad miljö (tex AWS). Vi förutsätter att du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska.
   

  

 Tech-stack du jobbar med:
   

  

* Frontend: React, TypeScript, Redux, Jest, Playwright & React Native
* Backend: Node.js, API-utveckling
* Databas: PostgreSQL
* Arbetssätt: Agilt, DevOps, testdriven utveckling (TDD)


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Svelte
* Nginx, shell-scripting (Bash, Nushell)
* QA-arbete
* DevOps & Infrastruktur: Docker, Kubernetes/Docker Swarm, AWS, CI/CD med GitHub Actions


 På Vimla så värdesätter vi individer som är angelägna om att lära sig och utveckla sin egen kompetens. Vi förväntar oss inte att du känner till alla teknologier i vår stack, så vi letar främst efter någon med ett tillväxttänk och en vilja att lära sig!
   

  

**Varför du vill jobba på Vimla**
 Vimla är på en spännande tillväxtresa och möjligheterna att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss är enorma. Vi är ett roligt, tight team på runt 40 personer i en egen organisation som har stor frihet. Samtidigt är Vimla en del av Telenor Sverige och använder tryggheten som finns i ett stort bolag.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Vimla/Telenor med Experis IT, som har lång erfarenhet av att rekrytera IT-specialister och chefer.
   

  

 Om du har frågor eller vill ha mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsulterna Anki Snis på
 **anki.snis@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 70-377 59 69, och Carina Eyoma på
 **carina.eyoma@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 73-086 22 75.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan!
   

  

 I enlighet med Telenors policy genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidater i alla rekryteringar.
   

  

 Plats: Stockholm Råsunda

title: Producer: Brand & Product Marketing
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a hands-on Producer to join our Brand & Product Marketing team — the operational core that keeps creative strategy, production, and delivery running smoothly.
   

  

 This role ensures that projects move seamlessly from ideation to launch - on time, on budget, and in sync with cross-functional stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, Product, and beyond.
   

  

 You’ll manage resource planning, production budgets, and project workflows, while helping to design and optimize the processes that make our creative operations scalable and efficient.
   

  

 With a strong understanding of creative production — from strategy and concept development to delivery — you’ll enable the team to deliver world-class creative that supports our product-led growth mission.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Resource Planning & Budget Management
+ Lead the planning and allocation of internal and external resources across campaigns and creative projects.
+ Manage and track the production budget (open + HC), ensuring efficient use of time and funds while balancing long-term scalability.

* Project Design & Delivery
+ Structure creative projects from initial brief to final delivery, aligning timelines, milestones, and dependencies.
+ Ensure clarity on responsibilities, expectations, and deliverables across all stakeholders.

* Stakeholder Alignment
+ Act as the connective tissue between Brand & Product Marketing, Growth, Enterprise, Lifecycle and Sales Enablement.
+ Facilitate effective collaboration, communication, and visibility across teams — ensuring everyone who needs to be up to speed, is up to speed.

* Process & Systems Development
+ Design, implement, and iterate on workflows that increase team efficiency and quality over time.
+ Champion smart tools, templates, and scalable systems (including AI-driven creative workflows) to elevate output and reduce friction.

* Creative AI Integration
+ Stay current on creative AI tools and practices, identifying opportunities to use them for production efficiency and innovation.
+ Guide the team in adopting AI as a co-creator while maintaining high creative and ethical standards.


**Who You Are**
* Proven experience as a Producer, Creative Operations Manager, or equivalent role in a marketing or creative team (preferably within SaaS or digital-first environments).
* Deep understanding of the creative process and the stages of production across strategy, ideation, execution, and delivery.
* Skilled in project management tools and methods — able to keep multiple workstreams on track without losing sight of the big picture.
* Strong communicator and relationship-builder, able to navigate diverse perspectives and bring people along.
* Comfortable working “boots on the ground,” solving challenges in real time while maintaining a proactive, positive energy.
* Curious, organized, detail-oriented, and motivated by building processes that scale.


**How You Work — Our Values In Action**
* Include Everyone: You ensure transparency and clarity in every project, making space for diverse voices and creating shared understanding across teams.
* Curiosity First: You explore new tools and ways of working (especially AI) to enhance creative output and shape future processes.
* Work Smart: You design systems that make the team more effective, applying smart shortcuts and prioritizing what drives the most impact.
* Drive It Like You Own It: You take initiative, manage momentum, and keep stakeholders aligned through clear communication and accountability.
* Have Fun: You bring energy and purpose to projects, celebrating progress and encouraging collaboration that makes work enjoyable and meaningful.


**In Short**
 This is a strategic-operational role for someone who thrives at the intersection of creativity, organization, and leadership — enabling a high-performing marketing team to deliver great work efficiently and joyfully.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**AI and Hiring at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we believe AI helps us work smarter - but it never replaces the human assessment, curiosity, and personal connection that define our culture and our hiring. We use AI as a sparring partner: to bounce ideas, bring new perspectives, support structure, and make our work more efficient. But the meaning, decisions, and interactions always come from people.
   

  

* AI does not screen or decide on candidates.
* There is no automated filtering, ranking, or decision-making in our recruitment process. Every application is reviewed by a person.
* Hiring teams may use AI to support their work - for example, to structure notes, prepare interview questions, or organize their thinking.


 AI strengthens our work, but it does not define it. At Mentimeter, we’re not building an AI-driven hiring process - we’re building a people-first culture, where technology helps us listen, learn, and grow together.
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker en Cloud Architect som vill ta molnlösningar till nästa nivå med Amazon Web Services (AWS) eller Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Hos oss får du arbeta med det senaste inom säkerhet, infrastruktur, DevSecOps, generativ AI och agentisk AI – och vara med och skapa lösningar som påverkar miljoner människor världen över. I rollen blir du en nyckelperson som förvandlar idéer till verklighet. Du kommer att leda strategiska initiativ på nordisk nivå, inspirera kunder och agera som deras trusted advisor, delta i molnkonferenser, bidra i pre-sales och nätverka med våra partners Amazon, Microsoft och Google.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder karriärmöjligheter i världsklass, projekt inom exempelvis självkörande bilar, livräddande robotar, autonoma system och framtidens AI-lösningar. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som värdesätter innovation och samarbete – med månatliga aktiviteter och en kultur där vi har kul tillsammans. Vi letar efter fler kollegor som vill hänga med på vår AWS-resa till vårt kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med tekniker som AWS Bedrock, Amazon Q, AWS Quick Suite, AWS Lambda, AWS Control Tower och programmeringsspråk som Java, Python, Node, React, Angular, TypeScript, Kafka, Golang, Kotlin, Terraform och Ansible.
   

  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Driva strategi och initiativ inom cloud på nordisk nivå.
* Hjälpa våra kunder med molnarkitektur och cloud native lösningar.
* Använda dig utav generativ och agentisk AI.


**Din profil**
* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av molntjänster som AWS eller GCP.
* Kunskap i ett eller flera programmeringsspråk, t.ex. Python, Java, Kotlin, Golang eller Node.
* Erfarenhet som molnarkitekt eller av att leda molntransformationer.
* Intresse för DevSecOps, generativ AI, agentisk AI och cloud-native lösningar.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i AWS services.
* Flytande svenska och engelska kunskaper, i både tal och skrift.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och påverka på nordisk nivå. Du samarbetar med andra specialister, kompetensväxlar och bidrar till att bygga AWS-kapabilitet i Norden – samtidigt som du påverkar några av världens största bolag.
* Utvecklas genom utbildningar, certifieringar och interna initiativ- Du får tillgång till utbildningar och certifieringar inom AI och AWS samt möjlighet att engagera dig i Capgeminis fokusområden som Diversity & Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness Club och Art Club.
* Njut av en engagerande arbetsplats med starkt stöd och förmåner. Vi erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, bonusprogram, företagshälsovård och sjukvårdsförsäkring – samt en inkluderande kontorskultur med sociala aktiviteter och teambuilding.


**Ansökan**
 Redo att ta din karriär till nästa nivå? Ansök nu och bli en del av Capgemini Sveriges innovativa AWS-team! Ansök redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Under processen får du chansen att kika in på vårt kontor, prata med vår rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan!
   

  

*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
 Till denna roll söker vi medarbetare för säkerhetsklassat uppdrag placerad hos kund.
   

  

 Hos våra kunder arbetar vi i leveranser som kan ha bland annat #AWS, #GCP, #Google, Azure, AliCloud, Java, Go/Golang, Python, Kotlin, Node, HTML, TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, Java, CloudFormation, Terraform, Docker, Kafka, React, Angular, Vue, Bash, Spring, GenAI, GraphQL, Backstage, Kubernetes, LLM, RAG, Copilot, GitHub Actions, SonarQube, BlackDuck, Apache Beam, Kong, Jenkins, Apigee, OpenShift, Ansible, DevSecOps, cloud architecture, cloud assessments, integration, Snowflake, Elastic Search, Grafana, Kibana, Splunk, Databricks, HelmChart, CloudFoundry.'
   

  

 #Innovation #creativity #future #careers #AWS
   

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en AI-driven global partner för affärs- och tekniktransformation som levererar konkret verksamhetsnytta. Vi formar framtiden för organisationer och förverkligar den med hjälp av AI, teknik och människor. Med vår starka historia på nästan 60 år är vi en ansvarsfull och mångsidig koncern med 420 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Genom vår expertis inom strategi, teknik, design, ingenjörstjänster och affärsverksamhet levererar vi heltäckande tjänster och lösningar, baserade på vår djupa branschkunskap och vårt omfattande partnernätverk. Koncernen rapporterade globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro för 2024.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
 www.capgemini.com

title: Director of Executive Community
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 Are you passionate about building meaningful relationships with senior executives?
   

  

 Do you thrive on creating high-impact experiences, curating thought leadership, and connecting top decision-makers? Are you someone who rolls up your sleeves, builds from scratch, and turns vision into execution? If this sounds like you—read on.
   

  

 At Mentimeter, we are on a mission to transform meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into active contributors. With over 30 million users worldwide and a rapidly growing enterprise footprint, we’re shaping the future of engagement—one Menti at a time.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Director of Executive Community** 
 —a strategic and hands-on leader to design and scale a new high-impact community for senior executives across our largest enterprise customers (+10,000 employees). This role will sit within Marketing but operate cross-functionally, in
 **very close collaboration with Sales, People & Culture, and Enterprise Marketing** 
 to build a world-class executive engagement program that fosters trust, learning, and long-term value and strengthens our brand.
   

  

**What We Bring To You**
 ✅ A chance to launch a brand-new strategic initiative with C-level visibility.
   

  

 ✅ A profitable, fast-growing international scaleup with a strong brand and culture.
   

  

 ✅ A product loved by both users and executives, with exciting stories to tell.
   

  

 ✅ A role that blends leadership, creativity, and execution in equal measure.
   

  

**The Role in a Nutshell**
 As
 **Director of Executive Community** 
 , you will create and lead a focused executive engagement program for Mentimeter’s most strategic enterprise accounts. This role will operate like a mini-startup within the Marketing team, with a clear strategic mission and the autonomy to build it.
   

  

***Your mission:***
 Strengthen executive engagement to support our move up-market by deepening relationships with C-level leaders at top accounts through curated content, thought leadership, strategic events, and peer networking.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with
 **Enterprise Sales, People & Culture, and Marketing** 
 to identify the right stakeholders, shape valuable experiences, and act as a connector between Mentimeter and the executive ecosystem. You’ll be both strategist and doer—running intimate roundtables, ghostwriting content, and building 1:1 relationships with senior leaders.
   

  

**Your mission: Build and lead a community for executive Impact**
* Design and own the executive community strategy, aligned to our business goals.
* Curate and lead high-touch executive events (virtual and in-person) that drive trust, thought leadership, and commercial impact.
* Create thought leadership content tailored to C-level audiences—either authored or co-created with external voices.
* Develop strong relationships with CHROs, CEOs, and transformation leaders across HiPo enterprise accounts.
* Collaborate with Sales, People & Culture, and Marketing to align efforts, ensure value, and deliver strategic outcomes.
* Act as a connector between Mentimeter’s leadership and external senior executives.
* Track and measure engagement, feedback, and results to iterate and grow the program.


**Who You Are**
 You are a senior-level builder with a proven track record of engaging executive audiences and creating high-impact, relationship-driven programs. You bring both strategic vision and operational grit—comfortable designing a long-term engagement model while also rolling up your sleeves to host roundtables or ghostwrite a CxO briefing.
   

  

**You’ll Thrive In This Role If You Are**
* A strategic community leader with deep experience working with senior decision-makers (CHROs, CXOs, transformation leaders) in complex B2B environments.
* A sharp communicator and trusted advisor—equally effective in a boardroom, a 1:1 conversation, or facilitating a group of executives.
* Insight-driven and outcome-oriented—you blend editorial instinct and relationship-building with measurable commercial impact.
* A hands-on doer who doesn’t wait for perfect conditions; you take ownership and move fast, even with limited resources.
* Naturally collaborative—comfortable navigating cross-functional work across Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, People & Culture, and Product Education.
* Ambitious yet humble—motivated to build something new that delivers long-term value for customers and Mentimeter alike.


**Your impact**
**As Director Of Executive Community, You Will**
* Build trusted relationships with CHROs, CXOs, and senior leaders in our most strategic accounts
* Position Mentimeter as a thought leader and long-term strategic partner
* Design and scale executive programs—roundtables, an Advisory Board, and a flagship conference
* Collaborate with Sales, CS, and Marketing to embed executive engagement into key account strategies
* Build an executive community that scales with heart, value, and authenticity at its core


**By 2028, This Role Will**
* Engage 500+ executives across strategic accounts
* Enable a premium service adoption in 20% of strategic customers
* Support reaching 125% Net Revenue Retention (NRR) in the strategic segment
* Establish a lasting foundation of brand equity and executive trust


 Wow, that was a lot—but before you go, just one last thing:
 **We want YOU to help shape this role.** 
 If you don’t tick every single box,
 **apply anyway!**
 Let’s build something great together. 🚀
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**AI and Hiring at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we believe AI helps us work smarter - but it never replaces the human assessment, curiosity, and personal connection that define our culture and our hiring. We use AI as a sparring partner: to bounce ideas, bring new perspectives, support structure, and make our work more efficient. But the meaning, decisions, and interactions always come from people.
   

  

* AI does not screen or decide on candidates.
* There is no automated filtering, ranking, or decision-making in our recruitment process. Every application is reviewed by a person.
* Hiring teams may use AI to support their work - for example, to structure notes, prepare interview questions, or organize their thinking.


 AI strengthens our work, but it does not define it. At Mentimeter, we’re not building an AI-driven hiring process - we’re building a people-first culture, where technology helps us listen, learn, and grow together.
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Sr. Art Director // Brand Design Lead
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

**Brand & Product Marketing**
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Art Director / Brand Design Lead to own, evolve, and scale Mentimeter’s visual brand combining exceptional creative craft with systematic thinking and modern, AI-enabled ways of working.
   

  

 This is a hands-on creative leadership role with line management responsibility, where you’ll set the creative direction for our brand while designing the systems, principles, and tools that allow high-quality design to scale across a fast-growing SaaS organization.
   

  

 You’ll lead a team of designers, partner closely with Brand Creative, Product Marketing, Growth, and Product, and champion the thoughtful use of AI in the creative process enabling faster exploration, smarter production, and consistently high creative standards across every touchpoint.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Brand Direction, Systems & Scalability**
* Own and evolve Mentimeter’s visual identity, ensuring it is distinctive, cohesive, and scalable across brand, product marketing, campaigns, and launches.
* Define and maintain strong brand systems including design principles, guidelines, templates, and modular assets that enable teams to move fast without losing quality.
* Balance long-term brand consistency with flexibility for experimentation, growth, and new use cases.


**Creative Leadership & Craft Excellence**
* Set the creative bar and direction for key initiatives, from content concepts and launches to brand storytelling and product narratives.
* Lead concept development and design execution for high-impact projects, remaining hands-on where it matters most.
* Act as a quality gate for all brand and marketing design, ensuring clarity, craft, and strategic alignment.


**People Leadership & Team Development**
* Line-manage and develop a team of brand and marketing designers, supporting both craft growth and systems-oriented thinking.
* Foster a culture of ownership, collaboration, and continuous improvement where designers understand not just what they design, but why.
* Provide clear feedback, coaching, and direction to help the team grow in both creative excellence and operational maturity.


**AI-Driven Creative Practice**
* Lead the adoption of creative AI tools across brand and marketing design, integrating them thoughtfully into ideation, production, and iteration workflows.
* Identify opportunities where AI can improve speed, scale, and experimentation without compromising brand integrity or creative quality.
* Establish best practices and guardrails for using AI as a creative co-creator, maintaining high ethical and quality standards.
* Stay up to date on emerging AI capabilities and assess their relevance for Mentimeter’s creative ecosystem.


**Cross-Functional Collaboration**
* Partner closely with Brand & Product Marketing, Growth, Product, and Sales Enablement to translate strategy into clear, compelling visual communication.
* Advocate for brand consistency, systematic thinking, and scalable design solutions across teams.
* Collaborate with Producers and Creative Ops to ensure workflows, tools, and timelines support both quality and velocity.


**Who You Are**
* Extensive experience as a Senior Art Director, Brand Design Lead, or similar role in a digital-first environment.
