 We are looking for a Growth Account Manager to join our Scandinavia region, with the role open to candidates based in Sweden or Denmark.
   

  

 As a Growth Segment Account Manager, you will manage and expand relationships with customers across the Growth and Strategic segments, while engaging selected prospects and converting them into Eficode customers. You will own and drive all Eficode business within your assigned accounts, acting as a trusted partner who builds long-term relationships, expands collaboration, and contributes to sustainable customer and business growth.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
 Reporting to the Head of Account Management Scandinavia, your duties and responsibilities will focus on the Scandinavian market, including:
   

  

* Nurture, grow, and expand relationships with customers in the Growth segment, driving long-term value and partnership
* Turn qualified leads into opportunities by engaging prospects from marketing, demand generation, and partner channels
* Identify and develop expansion opportunities across Eficode’s portfolio to deepen customer partnerships
* Create and execute account plans that strengthen stakeholder relationships and support customer goals
* Bring the right Eficode expertise to customers by collaborating with specialists across our business areas
* Use your understanding of the market and Eficode’s offerings to help customers solve challenges with holistic solutions
* Work closely with licensing, services, RevOps, and other business areas to ensure satisfaction, retention, and growth
* Partner with delivery consultants, and service managers ensure smooth execution and strong customer outcomes


**Role Requirements**
 You will make a great match for this role if you have:
   

  

* 5+ years of B2B sales experience in a similar role, ideally within software, IT services, or consulting
* Comfortable working with CRM tools, including Salesforce
* Strong skills in value-based, customer-centric selling and building solution-oriented conversations
* Fluent in Swedish or Danish to support collaboration with local customers and colleagues, and confident in English as our corporate language
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to understand customer needs and translate them into relevant IT solutions
* Confident using digital collaboration tools such as email, chat, and video conferencing to engage customers and stakeholders


**Nice To Have’s**
*It would be an added bonus if you have:*
* Post-secondary education in sales, IT sales, business, or a related field
* Interest in technical domains such as ITSM, AI, and DevOps, with a solid understanding of how these areas create customer value
* Experience selling consulting services, managed services, or subscription-based software solutions
* Familiarity with the Atlassian ecosystem or similar collaboration and development toolchains


**Location & Setup**
* You’ll work in a hybrid setup, with remote working flexibility while also having access to our Scandinavian offices for collaboration and team connection.
* Occasional travel across Scandinavia to Eficode offices and customer sites is part of the role
* This is a full-time position with typical office hours and flexibility where needed
* The role reports to the Head of Account Management Scandinavia
* Possible locations: Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö, Copenhagen, or Aarhus
* Compensation includes a market-based salary with a commission plan (OTE model)


**What’s in it for you?**
 Eficode offer a range of perks and benefits for employees, including:
   

  

* Generous paid holiday
* Health insurance & pension scheme
* Learning & development - We have knowledge sharing sessions, team activities, technical and soft skills trainings to all Eficodeans in our Academy.
* Regular social events, lunches and code camps
* A work laptop, phone and necessary work equipment


 To find out more about life at Eficode, and hear what our people think about us, click here.
   

  

**Application process**
 If this role sounds like a good fit, we encourage you to apply today. Selected candidates will be invited to an initial screening call with our Talent Acquisition team. The process then includes two interviews, followed by a final informal team coffee - giving you the chance to get to know your future colleagues and experience the team culture firsthand.
   

  

**DEI Statement**
 At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants. We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognise that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds, and cultures, we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.
   

  

 To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information or an image of yourself in your job application.
   

  

**Salary Development**
 At Eficode, we believe your compensation should reflect the impact you make and how you grow along the way. Your salary develops through regular check-ins with your team lead, where we look at things like your skills, experience, client work, feedback, and overall contribution — both to your projects and to our culture. As a consultancy, it’s natural that factors like time spent on billable client work are part of the picture — but so are your development, collaboration, and everyday efforts that drive value. We also carry out a company-wide salary review once a year.
   

  

 On top of your salary, we offer a broad mix of benefits, both financial and non-financial, to support your well-being, work-life balance, and professional growth.
   

  

 Find out more about our benefits [here].
   

  

**Beware of recruitment scams**
 Eficode never asks for payment, bank details, or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. We only communicate through official Eficode email accounts and approved recruitment platforms. If you receive an unsolicited message, job offer, or request for personal or financial information claiming to be from Eficode, it may be fraudulent.

title: System Engineer för Skador
description:
Vill du vara med och skapa smarta IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder? Hos oss på Folksam arbetar vi med moderna teknologier och komplexa system i en miljö där samarbete, kundvärde och innovation står i centrum och du har möjlighet att utvecklas och göra skillnad!



Vi söker nu en System Engineer till vårt kontor vid Skanstull i Stockholm. Rollen är spännande och varierad – du kommer att verka i applikationsteam som utvecklar och förvaltar våra system för skadereglering där vi har fullt fokus på digitalisering och automation. Här skapas förutsättningar för resan mot en mer digital skadereglering!


**Det här gör du som System Engineer på Folksam**
-------------------------------------------------



Som System Engineer är du bland annat en brygga mellan verksamheten och utvecklingsteamen. Du arbetar nära arkitekter, utvecklare och testare för att designa lösningar mot definierad målarkitektur. Du har en koordinerande roll och är en speaking partner i tekniska frågor.



Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att:


* Lösa tekniska problem tillsammans med arkitekter, utvecklare och andra System Engineers.
* Stärka utvecklingsteamens tekniska och arkitekturella förmåga för att skapa mer kundvärde på kortare tid.
* Säkerställa att plattformar och tekniska lösningar uppfyller icke-funktionella krav som tillgänglighet, kostnadseffektivitet, kontinuitet och säkerhet.
* Ta fram arkitekturella underlag för beslut och bidra till Folksams tekniska standarder och styrande dokument.
* Koordinera och analysera lösningar samt kravställa informationsflöden mellan system och integrationer.
* Verka för god dokumentation som möjligör återanvändbarhet och god förvaltningsförmåga.
* Samarbeta proaktivt med arkitekter, utvecklare och andra System Engineers för att lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar.


Nyfiken på att läsa mer vad medarbetarna på IT jobbar med på Folksam? Gå in och läs här!


**Är du den vi söker?**
-----------------------



Vi söker dig som:


* Har flerårig erfarenhet av systemarbete, plattformar och IT-arkitektur.
* Har en gedigen utvecklarbakgrund.
* Har god förståelse för integrationsmönster (REST, SOAP, Kafka), containerarkitektur (OpenShift, Kubernetes) och filformat (JSON, XML, YAML).
* Har kunskaper i Java, SQL och gärna erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg (GitLab, ArgoCD).
* Är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och har förmåga att driva frågor självständigt samtidigt som du involverar andra och delar med dig av din kunskap.
* Talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat.


Meriterande:


* Erfarenhet av skadeområdet och samarbete med leverantörer.
* Erfarenhet av PEGA som plattform och Java som programmeringsspråk.
* Kunskap om molntjänster (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), IT-säkerhet och eventbaserad arkitektur.


Vi söker dig som tycker om att ta eget ansvar och söka lösningar. Du har en god kommunikativ och analytisk förmåga. Vi värdesätter engagemang, initiativförmåga och en vilja att utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Du är kreativ, resultatinriktad och övertygad om att det alltid finns lösningar på komplexa problem.



**Här kan du göra skillnad**
----------------------------



Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.  

  

Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.



Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.


**Så söker du jobbet**
----------------------



Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan senast 11 mars 2026. För att söka tjänsten ber vi dig bifoga ditt CV och besvara ett antal frågor.



Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta Johannes Odgren 072-468 70 28 johannes.odgren@folksam.se eller Anders Rossbrink 070- 831 58 27 anders.rossbrink@folksam.se .



Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67, Forena Per Karlsson 072-230 20 91 och Handels Mikael Carlsson 070-831 51 32.



*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sedan 1908 försäkringar och sparande som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi gör det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: System Engineer
description:
Vill du arbeta i gränslandet mellan Ops och Dev och bidra till att bygga framtidens IT-plattformar? På Folksam satsar vi stort på digitalisering och moderna teknologier – nu söker vi dig System Engineer som är nyfiken, tekniskt driven och redo att ta sig an spännande utmaningar. Det är en roll med stora skor att fylla, där du blir en viktig del av vårt arbete med plattformar och gemensamma tjänster.



Här kan du läsa mer om vår IT-avdelning och den resa vi är på!


**Det här gör du som System Engineer på Folksam**
-------------------------------------------------



Du kommer att arbeta i Team C3 på avdelningen Plattform & DX, sektionen Digital Kundupplevelse – ett team som ansvarar för gemensamma plattformar, ramverk och tjänster som skapar enhetliga lösningar för hela Folksam.



Som System Engineer i C3-teamet kommer du bland annat att:


* Utveckla, testa, driftsätta och underhålla lösningar i Java, med t.ex. Spring Boot.
* Bygga och testa Java-klienter som kommunicerar med Kafka.
* Arbeta med NGINX och proxy-lösningar.
* Jobba med Red Hat-ekosystemet, som OpenShift och relaterade komponenter.
* Konfigurera operators i OpenShift.
* Automatisera infrastruktur med Crossplane.
* Utforska och lära nya teknologier – vi värdesätter nyfikenhet och vilja att utvecklas.

**Är du den vi söker?**
-----------------------



Vi söker dig som har en stark teknisk grund och gillar att kombinera utveckling med drift. Du är strukturerad, initiativrik och trivs med att samarbeta i agila team. Din förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya tekniker gör dig till en viktig del av vårt arbete.



Vi ser att du har minst tre års relevant erfarenhet inom systemutveckling eller plattformshantering. Du har också erfarenhet av:


* Java och relevanta webbramverk som Spring Boot
* Kafka och eventdriven arkitektur
* NGINX
* OpenShift och operator-konfiguration


Det är meriterande om du har:


* Erfarenhet av Red Hat-ekosystemet och dess komponenter
* Publika molntjänster (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
* Authentication, Authorization och RBAC
* GitLab CI/CD
* Agila arbetssätt (Scrum, Kanban)
* Crossplane


Som person är du självgående och driver ditt arbete framåt och uppnår resultat. Du har en god förmåga att samarbeta och utveckla lösningar tillsammans med andra. Vidare bidrar du till en öppen och prestigelös kultur där vi frågar, delar med oss, firar framsteg – och lär av våra misstag. Du tror på teamets kraft, men tar också ansvar för din egen utveckling och leverans.



Hos oss får du mer än ett jobb – du får en möjlighet att växa. Blir du nyfiken på hur det är att jobba som System Engineer hos oss, läs mer här.


**Här kan du göra skillnad**
----------------------------



Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.  

  

Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.



Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.


**Så söker du jobbet**
----------------------



Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag, men senast 15 mars 2026. Vi kommer att genomföra löpande urval till intervju under ansökningstiden.



För mer information eller frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta avdelningschef Harald Lönnbro, 073-332 61 46.



Fackliga representanter: Forena Morgan Svensson 073-423 59 12, Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67 och Handels Mikael A Carlsson 070-831 51 32.


*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sedan 1908 försäkringar och sparande som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi gör det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: Solution Sales Expert, Sweden
description:
**We help the world run better**  

At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed.### **PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES:**


The software market in the Nordics & Baltics is characterized by a very dynamic and highly innovative landscape. The growth of enterprise applications in the region is strong, with digital transformation continuing to drive changes in existing business models. Digitalization, Sustainability, and Artificial Intelligence are fueling rapid adoption of end‑to‑end integrated Procurement and Finance solutions—especially those supporting a digital thread across Financial Close, Tax Management, GRC, Sourcing, Category Management, Direct Procurement, and Quote‑to‑Cash.


Given this acceleration, the Finance & Spend (F&S) business area is crucial for our customers, SAP, and society at large. Our team specializes in selling cloud‑based solutions that optimize Finance & Spend operations in the Nordic and Baltic region. With a strong customer focus and a mission to help companies run at their best, we continue to grow. We are now seeking a new **F&S Solution Sales Executive** to join our team in Sweden.

### **EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS:**

* S**trong business acumen for complex enterprise organizations to identify strategic value drivers and elevate solution positioning. 8+ years of experience**
* **Engage and consult with senior stakeholders—including CXO level—on digital transformation strategies across Finance and Procurement**
* **Leverage deep understanding and proven track record within strategic Finance & Procurement processes to shape customer roadmaps and influence long‑term decision‑making**

* Achievement of agreed (incremental) revenue & pipeline targets
* Forecasting and regular pipeline status reporting
* Full opportunity and bid management for F&S deals
* Account planning, deal acceleration and structured closing plans
* Proactive collaboration with local Industry Sales teams
* Negotiation of complex commercial and contractual structures
* Engagement with key business areas within customer organizations (development, planning, manufacturing, sales & distribution, aftersales/services)
* Promote a value‑based solution approach in collaboration with industry and product specialists
* Develop and execute local go‑to‑market strategies
* Drive demand‑generation with regional and local marketing/business development
* Build, manage and enable a strong partner ecosystem
* Share best practices across the region and market units

**EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:****Required skills:**  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Management, Information Systems, Procurement, or a related field
* Strong sales attitude—from pipeline creation to closing
* Solid understanding of core supply chain and logistics processes
* Excellent communication and presentation skills at executive level
* Strong networking capabilities across customer buying centers
* Excellent organizational, strategy planning and program management skills
* Fluency in English and Swedish
* **Demonstrated business acumen for large, complex and multinational enterprise environments**
* **Experience translating customer strategy into digital transformation initiatives within Finance and Procurement**
* **Confidence and presence in strategic dialogues with senior leadership, including C‑level executives**
### **WORK EXPERIENCE:**

* Strong background and track record in Professionel consulting, Account Management, Industry Sales, Solution Sales, and/or Project Sales
* 10+ years of experience in a similar sales/professional consulting role
* Experience developing and executing business plans and strategic programs
* Cross‑industry process understanding is highly beneficial
* **Proven experience working with complex Finance & Procurement processes (e.g., Source‑to‑Pay, Order‑to‑Cash, Record‑to‑Report, Tax, GRC, Direct Procurement)**
* **Experience advising or consulting executives (CFO, CPO, COO) on digital transformation strategies or operating model changes**
* **Experience navigating complex enterprise structures, governance models, and multi‑stakeholder decision environments**

 **Bring out your best**  

SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
  

  

**We win with inclusion**  

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.  

  

SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.  

  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.  

  

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.  

  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. **AI Usage in the Recruitment Process**
For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.
Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.  

  

Requisition ID: 447301 | Work Area: Sales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid
company_description: SAP's purpose is to help the world run better and improve people's lives with sustainability at the core.

title: Shift Leader Front Office Scandic Victoria Tower
description:
\*\*Scandic Victoria Tower\*\* är ett hotell som är svårt att missa. I hjärtat av Kista Science City reser sig denna spektakulära glasbyggnad 34 våningar upp i luften, granne med Kistamässan och en kort promenad till pendeltåget. Hos oss erbjuder vi goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och en härlig stämning mellan både gäster och medarbetare. Har du nära till skratt och tycker att samarbete är den bästa vägen till goda resultat? Då är du den vi söker!


**Nu söker vi en Shift Leader till Scandic Victoria Tower.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Som Shift Leader agerar du värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Under din tid hos oss kan dessa områden variera i takt med att du och affären utvecklas. Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad innebär rollen som Shift Leader Front Office?**



Du som arbetar inom Front Office är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning. Arbetet i Front Office innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet.



I rollen som Shift Leader har du, förutom att vara en del av driften, den övergripande överblicken över gästflödet och ser tillsammans med teamet till att prioritera arbetsuppgifter så att verksamheten flyter så att gästerna blir nöjda. Du leder och fördelar arbetet och hanterar bemanningen under ditt arbetspass. Vid behov får du utbilda nya medarbetare på hotellet och du avlastar också Front Office Manager med vissa administrativa arbetsuppgifter.



Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och varanan helg).


**Din kompetens**



För den här rollen krävs att du har både förmåga och vilja att arbeta med ett driftsnära ledarskap. Du är trygg i ditt ledarskap och har både integritet och säljdriv. För att passa i rollen tror vi också att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster. Du är en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.



Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


**Information om tjänsten:**



Tjänsten är en anställning med vikariat på heltid. Startdatum kan diskuteras. Vikariatet sträcker sig till juni 2027 med eventuell förlängning.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!


Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video


...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.

company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: CRM & BI Data Architect
description:
Aurobay develops and produces world-class hybrid engines and transmissions. With factories on two continents - Sweden and China - we're a pioneering global supplier of propulsion technology, development services and contract manufacturing. The Aurobay brand brings together over 9,000 dedicated and determined people that design, develop, and manufacture next-generation powertrain solutions for a global market.’


Aurobay is part of HORSE Powertrain Limited, a global leader in powertrain solutions. The Group has 19,000 employees, 17 plants and 5 R&D centers across three continents. We partner with OEM customers around the world and offer innovative solutions that can cater to up to 80% of the growing hybrid and combustion powertrain market, enabling a faster transition toward cleaner mobility.


At Aurobay, we are committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and believe that different perspectives and experiences make for a stronger, more innovative company.

**Job Purpose:**


We are looking for a CRM Technical Specialist with deep expertise in CRM data architecture, BI engineering, and cloud-based data integration.


In this role, you will own the technical design, integration, governance, and optimization of our CRM-driven reporting landscape. You will act as the bridge between Sales, IT, and Data Engineering, ensuring that CRM and ERP data flows seamlessly into our modern BI architecture.


This is not a pure dashboarding role — it is a technically hands-on position with architectural influence across our CRM and Azure data ecosystem. You will also play a key role in integrating data from CRM and ERP systems—including Lime, Salesforce, and HubSpot—into our reporting environment, enabling seamless access to customer and sales data across the organization.

**Key Responsibilities and Scope**


CRM Data Architecture & Integration

**Lead the technical integration of CRM platforms including:**

* Salesforce
* HubSpot
* Lime CRM

* Integrate ERP data from SAP S/4HANA to enable full sales lifecycle reporting (lead opportunity order revenue).
* Design and maintain scalable CRM-to-data-lake ingestion patterns (batch and incremental loads).
* Define canonical data models to harmonize CRM and ERP schemas into unified reporting structures.
* Ensure API-based integrations are robust, monitored, and optimized for performance and reliability.
* Manage authentication (AAD), RBAC models, and secure access control across environments.
* Monitor and troubleshoot pipeline performance, data latency, and refresh failures.
* Implement CI/CD principles in BI and data pipeline deployments.
* Own semantic models and reporting architecture in Microsoft Power BI.
* Establish and maintain data dictionaries, metadata standards, and documentation practices.
* Define CRM data quality controls and validation frameworks.
* Drive improvements in data reliability, scalability, and performance.
* Ensure compliance with internal security and data privacy policies.

**Knowledge:**

* Deep understanding of CRM data structures (accounts, contacts, opportunities, activities, pipeline stages).
* API integration knowledge (REST, authentication flows, incremental sync logic).
* Experience with scripting/automation (PowerShell, Python, or similar).
* Strong understanding of data governance, RBAC, AAD, and secure BI deployment.
* Performance tuning across BI datasets and data pipelines.

* **Experience:**


	+ Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
	+ 5+ years of experience in CRM technical roles, BI engineering, or data engineering.
	+ Proven experience architecting CRM integrations and enterprise reporting environments.**Hands-on experience with:**


	+ Power BI (Service, DAX, semantic modeling, RLS, deployment pipelines)
	+ Azure Data Lake (ADLS Gen2)
	+ ETL/ELT pipeline design (Azure Data Factory, Databricks or equivalent)
	+ SQL-based data transformation
	+ Demonstrated experience integrating multi-source CRM and ERP data into a governed analytics platform.
	+ Experience working in complex global environments with multiple stakeholders.
	+ Exposure to automation and scripting using PowerShell, Python, or equivalent scripting languages is a plus.**Skills:**


	+ Strategic thinker with strong architectural mindset.
	+ Hands-on and comfortable working across the full data stack.
	+ Strong communicator able to translate complex technical concepts into business impact.
	+ Proactive, structured, and quality-focused.
	+ Comfortable operating in a dynamic, evolving CRM and sales environment.

title: Sales Operations & Automation Manager
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated **Sales Operations & Automation Manager** to join our Revenue Operations team and drive forward our global sales processes. In this role, you will be responsible for improving sales productivity by equipping global sales teams with the resources, tools, and insights they need to proactively sell Virta services and solutions.


You will accomplish this by developing and maintaining our sales tools and participating in the design, development, and rollout of new processes and technology. You will work closely with Sales, Marketing, Product, Customer Operations, and Finance to ensure strategic alignment across functions—especially where CRM, CPQ, and ERP processes connect.


This is a fantastic chance to join an innovative company in the rapidly expanding EV charging sector and help transform the energy industry towards a cleaner future. This role can be based in on of our offices in Helsinki, Stockholm, Berlin or Paris.

**What you’ll do**

* Contribute to the development and improvement of the sales process and CRM based on data-driven insights.
* Streamline and continuously improve the usability of Virta’s CRM tool (**HubSpot** and its integrated add-ons).
* Own and support the operational management and development of our **CPQ** processes and tooling (configuration, pricing, and quoting).
* Analyze sales data and metrics to provide insights and recommendations for improvement.
* Implement and optimize sales processes and systems across the end-to-end funnel (lead opportunity quote order).
* Provide day-to-day support to sales teams throughout the sales process (incl. pipeline hygiene, process adherence, and tooling guidance).
* Ensure sales reports and internal intelligence are available for the sales organization; develop new reporting tools as needed.
* Improve constantly the data flow between CPQ, CRM, ERP and data cloud (Snowflake).

**CPQ-CRM-ERP data flow**

* Support and continuously improve **ERP-related sales operations processes**, ensuring a smooth handover from sales to order processing, invoicing, and revenue recognition in collaboration with Finance.
* Act as a key business owner for **CRM–CPQ–ERP data flow**, ensuring accurate and timely transfer of customer, product, pricing, contract, and order information.
* Manage requirements, testing, and rollouts for **integrations** and **automations** between HubSpot, CPQ, ERP, and other adjacent systems (e.g., billing, contract management, product catalog), working with internal stakeholders and technical teams/vendors.
* Define and maintain data standards and governance for key objects (accounts, contacts, products, pricing, contracts, orders), including validation rules and quality checks.
* Identify integration gaps and automation opportunities; propose solutions that reduce manual work and improve data quality and compliance.

**What you’ll bring**

* Degree in Engineering, Business, or a related field
* Relevant experience in Sales Operations or in a similar role
* Excellent communication and relationship-building skills
* Solid project management skills
* Relevant experience in delivering business outcomes (increased velocity, increased win rates, decreased rep ramp-up time, improving sales force performance)
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, and drive initiatives forward.
* Fluency in English
* Residency in EU (no relocation offered for this role)

**We consider it a plus if you have:**

* Experience in selling B2B solutions in a SaaS environment
* Experience from the EV Driving industry
* Experience of Hubspot, CPQ tools, NetSuite and/or any type of data integrations
* Experience of successful implementation of AI in prospect-to-cash processes
* Professional level language skills in French, Finnish, German or Swedish

**What we offer**


* Opportunity to join a growth story in the field of e-mobility and build something new
* Ability to work in a hybrid/remote mode and collaborate with a diverse team of international talents.
* Competitive compensation package.
* Company benefits aligned with local market

**Interested? Apply Now!**


If you’re excited about this opportunity, we’d love to hear from you! Please apply by sending your CV and cover letter.

**Join us and be part of the EV revolution!**

title: Backend & Platform Engineer
description:
### **About the role**


Photowall is in an expansive phase, and we are now looking for a developer who is equally comfortable working with infrastructure and building backend features. You’ll write code in our PHP/Postgres stack while also shaping how our platform performs, scales, and stays reliable.

### **Your focus will be on:**

* Ensuring our platform performs reliably under high and varying traffic
* Driving performance improvements across database, cache, and application layers
* Managing and optimizing our AWS cloud environment
* Strengthening observability and monitoring across our systems
* Operating and tuning our web stack (Nginx, PHP-FPM)
* Developing new features in our PHP 8-based backend
* Taking part in designing and evolving our architecture, such as building new APIs
* Creating scalable and future-proof solutions to handle growing traffic and user demands
* Enhancing our CI/CD pipeline to streamline development workflows
* Collaborating closely with other developers, product owners, and designers

### **What you need to know**


We believe you have at least 7 years of experience as a developer and enjoy a role where backend and platform development is the main focus. You’re comfortable tackling complex technical challenges and naturally consider scalability and performance in your work.

* At least 7 years of experience in backend or full-stack development
* Experience designing and operating scalable, high-availability systems
* Solid experience working with PHP or another backend language
* Strong knowledge of relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred)
* Experience working with caching solutions, such as Redis
* Understanding of and experience with CI/CD pipelines
* Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work in cross-functional teams

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience managing and optimizing cloud infrastructure, preferably on AWS
* Experience optimizing performance in scalable applications
* Experience with monitoring and observability tools
* Experience with large-scale traffic environments
* Experience with e-commerce
* TypeScript and React are a growing part of our stack, so experience with modern React frameworks such as Next.js is a plus
* Experience with image processing

### **Why Photowall?**


Photowall is a global leader in custom wallpaper and wall decor. We serve over 20 markets, and have ambitious plans for continued growth through geographic expansion and new product launches. At Photowall, you’ll find a dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional development.


At Photowall, you’ll be joining a small, supportive team that values a no-stress environment and simple, robust, high-quality solutions. You will have the opportunity to influence and develop our technical platform at a company that values innovation, collaboration, empathy, and personal development – and we look forward to welcoming you on our continued growth journey.


Apply today and become a key player in Photowall’s success!

title: SDK Engineer
description:
Sleep is something we all share. It's so fundamental that when we don’t get enough good-quality sleep, we struggle to function in all other aspects of life. That's why we at Sleep Cycle have made sleep improvement our mission, and that’s how you can help improve global health by joining our effort!


We’re now looking for an SDK Engineer to join our Platform team and help shape the future of our SDKs. This is your chance to bring our AI-powered sound technology to life, making it work reliably on millions of phones across the globe.


Interested in building robust SDKs that power our own products and are trusted by tech companies around the world? Do you enjoy designing stable APIs and tools? Excited to join a team where quality, reliability, and developer experience come first?

 **Your mission:**


As an SDK Engineer, you’ll help transform advanced and sometimes highly complex technology, often close to the research frontier, into robust, well-designed, and easy-to-integrate products. You’ll play an important role in shaping how our technology reaches developers and users around the world.


You’ll take on a central role in a small, highly skilled technical team where your decisions truly matter. We work closely together, keep decision paths short, and share a genuine commitment to creating an exceptional SDK experience - both for ourselves and for the teams building on top of our platform.


This is an opportunity to work at the intersection of research and product, where you’ll get to turn advanced technology into something reliable, scalable, and used in the real world.  

  

**Your key responsibilities:**

* Develop and improve our SDKs for iOS and Android
* Design stable, well-defined APIs that make our technology easy to integrate
* Ensure high quality through testing, CI/CD, and thoughtful release processes
* Collaborate closely with app teams and technical partners on integration and support
* Contribute to architectural decisions and long-term technical direction

 **What we are looking for:**

* A Master of Science (M.Sc.) in Computer Science or a related field
* Solid experience developing in either iOS (Swift) *or* Android (Kotlin)
* Comfortable working independently and driving initiatives end-to-end - from idea and system design through implementation, testing, and validation.
* Solid backend development experience (databases, Google Cloud, etc.)
* A strong focus on writing stable, well-tested, and maintainable code
* A solid understanding of signal processing and mathematical reasoning
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Fluency in English

**Nice to have:**

* Experience with Linux (C/C++) or Python
* Experience with machine learning and/or audio processing
* Previous work developing libraries, SDKs, or platform components
* Experience with on-device machine learning
* Fluency in Swedish

 **Not sure if you meet every requirement?**


We encourage you to apply anyway - we value diverse perspectives and experiences and are committed to finding the right person, not just the perfect resume.

 **What’s in it for you?**  

Sleep Cycle is all about creating a supportive and stimulating work environment, surrounded by kind, talented teammates who genuinely enjoy working together. We believe in a healthy balance of focus and fun, where sharing a laugh together is just as important as delivering great work.

  

You’ll tackle interesting challenges and contribute to meaningful outcomes, all while collaborating in our beautiful office space on the 20th floor of the Kineum skyscraper in Gothenburg.

  

We look forward to your application!

 **Please note that we only accept applicants with a valid work permit for Sweden****.**

title: Enterprise Account Executive, Sweden
description:
**Are you ready to power the World's connections?**


If you don’t think you meet all of the criteria below but are still interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box - we’re looking for candidates that are particularly strong in a few areas, and have some interest and capabilities in others.

**About The Role:**  

  

We are seeking a committed Enterprise Account Executive with a successful background in sales and account management, ideally within open source or similar enterprise software environments. In this role, you will be a key driver of our growth strategy, directly impacting the stability and expansion of our recurring revenue. This position is ideal for a sales professional who has experience in landing new clients, retaining existing customers, and driving account expansion for early-stage enterprise products in a dynamic, entrepreneurial setting.  

  

**What You’ll Be Doing:**


Develop and execute sales strategies to target enterprise customers, focusing on building and maintaining a robust pipeline that drives long-term growth.

* Own the entire sales cycle, from prospecting and initial outreach to contract negotiations and closing deals, while consistently meeting or exceeding revenue targets.
* Collaborate with internal teams, including product, marketing, and customer success, to ensure a seamless sales experience and alignment on customer needs.
* Identify customer pain points and align our solutions to address these, delivering customized product demos and presentations tailored to their specific business needs.
* Build and nurture relationships with C-level executives and key decision-makers within target accounts, establishing yourself as a trusted advisor and ensuring customer satisfaction and retention.
* Lead account planning efforts by researching potential customers, understanding industry trends, and developing strategies to win new business and grow existing accounts.
* Monitor and manage sales activities and results, accurately forecasting opportunities and keeping detailed records of interactions and progress in CRM systems.
* Stay updated on industry trends, competitor offerings, and market changes to position our product effectively and maintain a competitive edge.
* Contribute to business growth initiatives, providing feedback to product and marketing teams to influence product development and go-to-market strategies.
* Represent Kong with professionalism, acting as a brand ambassador at industry events, conferences, and customer meetings.

**What You’ll Bring:**

* 7+ years of experience in enterprise sales (>1k employees), with a proven track record of closing complex deals in a SaaS, cloud, or enterprise software environment.
* Demonstrated success in selling to large enterprises, particularly to senior-level executives and across multiple departments.
* Strong consultative selling skills, with the ability to understand customer needs and present compelling solutions that drive business outcomes.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills, capable of managing high-stakes conversations and building lasting relationships with stakeholders.
* A results-driven mindset, with a passion for meeting and exceeding sales goals and revenue targets.
* Experience working with CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce) and leveraging data to forecast accurately and track sales metrics.
* Knowledge of open-source software, APIs, or infrastructure software is highly advantageous.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, taking ownership of your sales territory and adapting to changing market dynamics.
* Analytical and strategic thinking, with a knack for identifying business growth opportunities and devising plans to capitalize on them.


#LI-JM3

**About Kong:**


Kong Inc., a leading developer of API and AI connectivity technologies, is building the infrastructure that powers the agentic era. trusted by the Fortune 500 and startups alike, Kong's unified API and AI platform, Kong Konnect, enables organizations to secure, manage, accelerate, govern, and monetize the flow of intelligence across APIs and AI models. For more information, visit www.konghq.com.

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
SVP Worldwide - home to the iconic brands SINGER®, HUSQVARNA VIKING®, PFAFF®, and CREATIVATE - is the world’s largest consumer sewing machine company. For over 170 years, we’ve inspired makers everywhere, from seasoned sewists to first-time creators.
  
Headquartered in Nashville, TN, with offices in Milan, Mexico City, and Singapore and sales offices, R&D labs, manufacturing hubs, and distribution centers around the world — our reach is truly global.
  
**At SVP Worldwide, we live our values:** Think Like Our Customer, Be Curious and Creative, Include Others and Be Transparent. We’re building a connected, inclusive, and customer-first culture where passionate people can thrive.
  
With an ever-growing portfolio that includes sewing, embroidery & crafting machines, accessories, notions, garment care, and creative software, there’s never been a more exciting time to join our team. Ready to help shape the future of sewing and crafting? Explore your next career move with us today.
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

The Software Engineering Manager leads our embedded systems team and owns the delivery of software for our connected sewing machines. This role combines people management with hands-on delivery leadership, responsible for hiring, developing, and retaining engineering talent while also owning sprint execution, backlog management, and software delivery.
  
The team is an embedded systems group of seven, including offsite resources, building the software that powers best-in-class sewing machines. The work focuses on real-time systems and user interfaces with C++ as the primary development language. This position requires close collaboration with our hardware, cloud and mobile application teams to deliver world-class IoT-connected devices integrated with AWS.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Manage headcount planning, recruiting, hiring, and onboarding for the embedded team.
* Conduct regular one-on-ones, provide coaching, and support the career development of team members.
* Run performance reviews and address performance issues as needed.
* Build a team culture that promotes collaboration and continuous improvement.
* Ensure offsite team members remain engaged, informed, and integrated with the rest of the team.
* Communicate team progress, risks, and resource needs to the Director of Software.


Delivery and Process Ownership
  
* Own sprint planning, daily standups, and retrospectives for the team.
* Manage the product backlog in JIRA, ensuring tickets are well-defined and prioritized.
* Track velocity, identify blockers, and drive accountability for commitments.
* Partner with product and stakeholders to align delivery with business goals.


Cross-functional Collaboration
  
* Work with cloud and mobile application teams to ensure seamless integration across platforms.
* Collaborate with hardware teams to align software development with mechanical and electrical requirements.
* Coordinate with other engineering leads to deliver world-class IoT-connected devices.
* Participate in technical roadmap planning alongside other engineering leads.


**You Bring (requirements, preferred skills):**  

Required Qualifications
  
* Seven or more years of experience in software engineering and engineering management.
* Willingness to travel to company offices in Nashville, USA and Kochi, India as needed.
* Experience managing software engineers including hiring, performance management, and career development.
* Proven track record running Agile or Scrum processes.
* Proficiency with JIRA or similar project management tools.
* Strong communication skills and ability to work across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience managing distributed or hybrid teams.
* Five or more years experience in in C/C++, Linux, FreeRTOS, or QT.
* Strong understanding of unit testing practices and the ability to champion test-driven development across the team.
* Ability to evaluate technical decisions and provide meaningful guidance to the team.


Preferred Qualifications
  
* Experience with Android development or willingness to grow the team's capabilities in this area as future product needs evolve.
* Familiarity with IoT architectures and AWS cloud services.
* Experience with embedded AI or machine learning, including on-device inference, edge AI frameworks, or neural network optimization for resource-constrained environments.


The Employer retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.
  
  

**Work Environment/Location/Flex Arrangement:**  

SVP Worldwide offers a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. As part of our Flexible Workplace Policy, this position will be hybrid based.
  
  

**Why You Will Love Being a Part of the SVP Worldwide Team:**  

At SVP Worldwide, we celebrate diversity, equity, and inclusion and strive to employ a unique workforce that is reflective of our consumers across the globe. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.
  
SVP Worldwide is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions based on merit and qualifications. SVP Worldwide prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual identity, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, nationality, citizenship, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other unlawful consideration.
  
  

**In The News:**  

In 2021, SVP Worldwide was acquired by Platinum Equity (www.platinumequity.com), a global investment firm with more than $25 billion of assets under management and a portfolio of approximately 50 operating companies that serve customers around the world. Platinum Equity has committed to fully support SVP Worldwide’s continued growth and to bring additional financial and operational resources to help accelerate the company’s efforts.
  
Like what you see? Then come “sew” and grow your career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn and get updates from SVP Worldwide!

title: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**  

**You?** A hands-on and ownership-taker data scientist turning complex data into actionable insights and scalable AI solutions that drive real business impact.  

**Role?** Senior Data Scientist to lead and refine machine learning models, like our widely used vehicle valuation model, while exploring new AI opportunities across the Mobility ecosystem.  

**Company?** Vend, home of Blocket, FINN, DBA, Bilbasen, Oikotie & Tori, where millions of people across the Nordics connect to find what they need, whether it’s a way to move, a job, a home, a way to move, or a fresh start.  

**Location?** Join us in our Stockholm office, with the flexibility to work 50% remotely, your choice, your balance.  

**Why us?** This is your chance to shape the future of smart mobility in the Nordics, working with datasets powering ~90 million monthly visits and nearly 100% of car dealers in our markets. Enjoy autonomy to experiment with AI and ML in production environments, collaborate in a strong, knowledge-sharing data community and drive real-world, measurable business impact at scale.


*Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!*



**WHO ARE YOU?**


* **Experienced in Machine Learning & AI**: You have strong fundamental knowledge of machine learning algorithms and AI, with practical experience in building models and creating scalable solutions.
* **Hands-on with Big Data & tooling**: You have experience working with machine learning frameworks and data processing tools like Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Spark, Pandas, and **SQL**.
* **MLOps & production mindset**: You have experience with MLOps, CI/CD, and pipeline orchestration, and understand what it takes to move models from experimentation to production.



Nice to have


* Experience with cloud infrastructure, we use GCP products like Vertex AI and BigQuery.
* Experience with LLMs and NLP.
* Experience with modern GenAI systems like agentic workflows and RAG.
* Experience building RESTful APIs.
* Knowledge of Kafka, Kubernetes.
* Curiosity in how to use software engineering skills to deploy code.



As a person


* You have experience **introducing and educating people** without domain expertise about machine learning, translating complexity into clarity.
* **Y**ou thrive in **cross-functional environments**, are **results-oriented**, and enjoy **sharing knowledge while learning** from others.
* **You take responsibility from idea to production** and always consider what’s best for the company when making technology decisions.

  

**WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?**  

As our new Senior Data Scientist in the InsightX area within Mobility, your mission is to leverage AI and machine learning to empower smarter mobility choices across the Nordics. You will collaborate closely with product managers, developers, analysts, commercial stakeholders, and fellow data scientists across the Mobility vertical.



You will:


* Leverage AI and machine learning techniques to extract meaningful insights from our extensive dataset.
* Research, develop, and deploy machine-learning models in close collaboration with our product teams.
* Monitor model performance, generate insights, and continuously improve existing models—including our widely used vehicle valuation model.
* Contribute to projects that improve our model development processes, tooling, and infrastructure.
* Continuously identify and propose new ways to leverage both internal and third-party data to enhance our machine learning models and solve key business challenges.



What does success look like?  

After 6 months:


* You have taken ownership of one or more core models and contributed meaningful improvements.
* You actively collaborate with product teams and are confident in navigating our data ecosystem.
* You’ve identified at least one new AI opportunity with tangible business value.



After 1 year:


* You have significantly improved model performance and reliability in production.
* You are a trusted AI sparring partner for product and business stakeholders.
* You have contributed to strengthening our ML infrastructure and development practices.


**A few words from the Engineering Director, Özcan Soysüren**  

*“Hi, I’m Özcan. I’m an easy-to-reach leader: if you’re stuck, curious, or just want to sanity-check an idea, I’m here and I want it to feel safe to ask. I aim to lead with empathy and context. At the same time, I believe in ownership and accountability. I won’t micromanage you; I’ll give you trust, the space to make decisions, and clear expectations on outcomes.*


*In this role, you won’t be boxed into one product team. You’ll be part of our Data Science “satellite” setup in Mobility: working closely with different product teams across periods, partnering with peers and senior engineering support (like staff/principal-level engineering colleagues) to bring AI-powered solutions into production.*  

*If you want autonomy, real impact, and a place where your work moves from idea to production (and you’ll be supported while doing it) this role is for you.”*



Want to get a feel for our culture and what drives us? Take a peek behind the scenes at our Career Page!

  

**GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!**  

Turn yourself in by **Sunday, 8nd March**.
* You can choose whether to send your cover letter or go through some questions we prepared to get to know you better :)


We will start with the first rounds of interviews after the application period, to give everyone a fair shot.

**QUESTIONS?**  

Engineering Director, Özcan Soysüren, is happy to answer questions about daily work, expectations and team setup at ozcan.soysuren(at)vend.com.



For any additional questions about the process, I, Alessia Porazzi, Talent Acquisition Partner, am here for you on LinkedIn or email (alessia.porazzi(at)vend.com).



**RECRUITMENT PROCESS?**


* First step with Talent Acquisition Partner, Alessia ( your background, skills & growth goals, Vend as an employer)
* Second meeting with Engineering Director, Özcan (diving deeper into your background & skills, role goals & expectations)
* Final meeting with the team (case scenario, diving deeper into your team vision and way of thinking)
* Reference check and offer!

  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

We embrace diversity


Learn smarter, with our AI powered Learning Lab


Work with products that matter in people's lives


1700 fantastic colleagues in 4 Nordic countries


Smart choices made easy on our marketplaces


Innovation, it’s at our core

title: Fullstack Engineer - Cloud
description:
**About Neo4j:**

Neo4j is the graph intelligence platform that transforms data into knowledge to power the next generation of intelligent applications and AI systems. It includes enterprise-ready knowledge graphs for accurate, explainable, and governed AI; the most comprehensive, trusted, and easy-to-deploy graph capabilities across any environment and data source; and an unmatched ecosystem trusted by 84 of the Fortune 100 and supported by the world’s largest graph community. Intelligence that works. Results that matter.



Built to work everywhere and integrate with everything across every cloud for dynamic, personalized, and autonomous AI systems. We deliver quicker results, contextual knowledge, and solutions that impact customers and employees across the business.



**Our Vision:**

At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.



As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.


**The Role:**



Neo4j is the leader in graph databases, and our Aura Cloud platform is at the heart of powering data-driven innovation for thousands of users worldwide. We are on the lookout for versatile **Full-Stack Engineers** to help us design and build exceptional observability features that make managing databases seamless and delightful.


**What you'll be doing**



As a Software Engineer, you’ll play a key role in delivering impactful features that enhance how users interact with Neo4j Aura. You’ll work on everything from user-friendly interfaces to robust back-end systems, ensuring our solutions are scalable, reliable, and adaptable to diverse user needs.


**Our mission:**


* Build observability tools that provide real-time insights into database performance and logs.
* Develop and enhance user experiences for database maintenance, upgrades, and migrations.
* Collaborate across teams to create end-to-end solutions with broad impact.
* Take ownership of your work, with opportunities to lead feature development and solve unique challenges.

  

  

**Our stack:**  

  

You'll have the chance to work with and learn:


* **Frontend:** JavaScript/TypeScript, React
* **Backend**: Go (preferred) or Java, Docker, Kubernetes, and GCP/AWS/Azure, Postgres, Neo4j and BigQuery

  

  

**What we value**



We’re looking for engineers with experience in both frontend and backend development. You should have experience designing APIs, implementing data persistence, and integrating with third-party services. Familiarity with automated testing approaches, from unit testing to full-stack integration tests, is important. A willingness to learn, grow, and tackle new challenges as part of a distributed and collaborative team is essential.

**Why Join Neo4j?**

Neo4j is, without question, the most popular graph intelligence platform in the world. We have customers in every industry globally, and our products are a proven product/market fit. Joining our team is an opportunity to shape the future of data and analytics. Below are just a few exciting facts about Neo4j.


* Neo4j is one of the fastest-scaling technology companies in this industry. It recently surpassed $200M in annual recurring revenue (ARR), doubling its ARR over the past three years.
* Raised the biggest funding round in database history ($325M Series F). Backed by world-class investors like Eurazeo, GV (formerly Google Ventures), and Inovia Capital, Neo4j has raised over $600M in funding and is currently valued at over $2Bn. This puts Neo4j among the most well-funded database companies in history.
* 84% of the Fortune 100 and 58% of the Fortune 500 use Neo4j. Examples include Boston Scientific, BT Group, Caterpillar, Cisco, Comcast, Department for Education UK, eBay, NBC News, Novo Nordisk, Worldline, and others.
* Co-founder and CEO Emil Eifrem has built an amazing culture that prides itself on relationships, inclusiveness, innovation, and customer success.
* Countless industry awards. Massive enterprises and individual developers/data scientists love Neo4j. A strong sense of community and ecosystem is built around the platform.
* A recent Forrester Total Economic Impact™ Study cited Neo4j as delivering 417% ROI to customers.


Research shows that members of underrepresented communities are less likely to apply for jobs when they don’t meet all the qualifications. **If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we’d encourage you to reconsider and give us the opportunity to review your application.** At Neo4j, we are committed to building awareness and helping to improve these issues.



One of our central objectives is to provide an inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplace for everyone to develop their potential and have a positive, career-defining experience. We look forward to receiving your application.



**Neo4j Values:**

Neo4j is a Silicon Valley company with a Swedish soul. We foster collaboration and each of us is empowered to contribute and put our innovative stamp on projects. We hire candidates who reflect the following Neo4j core values:



(we)-[:VALUE]->(relationships)  

(we)-[:FOCUS\_ON]->(userSuccess)  

(we)-[:THRIVE\_IN]->(:Culture {type: [‘Open’, ‘Inclusive’]})  

(we)-[:ASSUME]->(:Intent {direction:’Positive’})  

(we)-[:WELCOME]->(:Discussions {nature: ‘IntellectuallyHonest’})  

(we)-[:DELIVER\_ON]->(ourCommitments)



Neo4j is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Please read the privacy notice regarding Neo4j's recruitment process to understand how we will handle the personal data that you provide.


More information at www.neo4j.com.

title: Senior Solution Sales Executive, Sweden
description:
**We help the world run better**  

At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed. **PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES:**  

The software market in the Nordics & Baltics is characterized by a very dynamic market and a highly innovative and competitive landscape. The growth of enterprise applications in the region is very strong, and digital transformation continues to be the main driver for change of current business models. Digitalization, Sustainability, and Artificial Intelligence are fueling fast growth of leading-edge and end-to-end integrated Procurement solutions, especially when it comes to defining a digital tread across the business areas like Financial Close, Tax Management, GRC, Sourcing, Category Management, Direct Procurement and Quote-to-Cash.  

  

This is why the Finance & Spend business area is important for our customers, SAP, and the whole society. Our team specializes in selling cloud-based software solutions to optimize Finance & Spend for our customers in the Nordic & Baltic countries. Our focus on customers and to help them run at their best has given us the opportunity to grow! We are currently looking for a F&S Solution Sales Executive to join our team in Sweden.


**EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS:**  

* Achievement of agreed (incremental) revenue & pipeline targets
* Forecast and regular status updates on pipeline
* Management of all opportunities and bids in F&S
* Account planning, deal acceleration, closing plan
* Pro-active collaboration w/ local Industry Sales teams
* Negotiating of complex contract constellations
* Pro-active contacts, interaction and collaboration with different business areas from our customers (development, planning, manufacturing, sales & distribution and aftersales / services)
* Foster value-based solution approach in cooperation with respective industry- and product specialists
* Develop and drive local go-to-market plans
* Work on demand management activities with regional and local marketing & business development
* Build, enable and manage the local partner landscape
* Best practice sharing on a regional as well as market unit level

 **EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:**  

Required skills:  

* Bachelor or Master´s degree or higher in business, management, information systems, or Procurement or similar
* Strong sales attitude (from building pipe to close the deal)
* Good understanding (at least) of the fundamental processes in supply chain and logistics
* Very confident manner in dealing with people on all company levels – especially with decision makers
* Strong networking skills with customers and their buying centres
* Excellent communication and presentation skills on executive level
* Excellent organizational, business strategy planning and program management skills
* Fluency in English and Swedish

 **WORK EXPERIENCE:**  

* Strong Background and track record in either Account Management, Industry sales, Solution sales and/or Project Sales.
* Minimum 3 - 5 years’ experience in similar sales roles
* Developing and executing business plans and programs
* Cross-industry experience in Industry processes is very favourable

 **Bring out your best**  

SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
  

  

**We win with inclusion**  

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.  

  

SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.  

  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.  

  

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.  

  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. **AI Usage in the Recruitment Process**
For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.
Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.
