* Handle and resolve Service Desk tickets, incidents, and requests with a strong focus on quality and user experience.
* Work hands-on with Microsoft 365, including Intune, Entra ID (Azure AD), device management, permissions, group management, and license administration.
* Provide VIP and executive-level support with a strong sense of professionalism and service excellence.
* Drive process improvements within the Service Desk and lead or contribute to projects across different areas to improve how we work and deliver service.
* Explore and help develop automation and AI-driven solutions, such as self-service, chatbots, and Copilot-related initiatives, with the possibility to further engage in and support the company’s broader AI strategy.


**About You**
 To thrive as a Senior IT Service Technician at Cambio, you are someone who builds strong relationships, enjoys collaborating with colleagues, and takes pride in delivering world-class service. You bring experience from IT support and have a strong service-oriented mindset, remaining calm and focused even in high-priority or unexpected situations.
   

  

 You are comfortable taking an operationally leading role within the Service Desk, supporting and guiding colleagues, taking ownership of day-to-day operations, and leading by example. A structured way of working comes naturally, along with an understanding of the importance of proper documentation and sustainable processes.
   

  

 You have a genuine interest in IT and technology and enjoy staying up to date with new developments. When supporting less technically experienced users, you communicate clearly and adapt your language to make complex matters easy to understand.
   

  

**Requirements**
* At least 5 years of experience in IT support and IT operations
* Experience from an operational team lead role or/and as a project manager
* Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft’s modern workplace tools, including Entra ID (Azure AD) and Microsoft Intune
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English, both verbally and in writing


**It's a bonus if you**
* ITIL Certification, or equivalent experience
* Relevant MS Certifications


**Additional Information**
**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full-time, five days per week in-office
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

 The recruitment process will include a personality test and a problem-solving test.
   

  

 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life
 **.** 
 Read more about us
 **here!**
**A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible -** 
 explore our employee benefits
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Chief Solution Architect
description:
Do you thrive on shaping the future of digital ecosystems? At our Business Area Machining, we’re now looking for a Chief Solution Architect who will bridge business needs and technical innovation – driving architectural excellence that powers the next generation of manufacturing solutions.
   

  

**Your mission**
 In this position, you play a critical role in defining and owning the enterprise solution architecture vision for our IT transformation. You report to the Head of Digital Product Platform and are part of a global matrix organization.
   

  

 Every day brings new opportunities to:
   

  

* Lead the design of scalable, secure, and reusable solution architectures across a diverse digital product portfolio.
* Set architectural standards and frameworks that guide IT development and integration, ensuring consistency across teams and partners.
* Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies to keep us at the forefront of innovation.
* Partner with business and technical teams to translate needs into robust, future-ready solutions.
* Guide and mentor solution architects, technical leads, and engineers, fostering a culture of excellence and accelerating solution delivery.


 This role is based in Sweden, preferably in Sandviken or Stockholm and we offer a hybrid work model. Some international travel is expected.
   

  

**Your character**
 You have a strong technical background in areas such as cloud infrastructure, data platforms, AI/ML, and software lifecycle management. You’re used to collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders in product, engineering, and business development. Experience or knowledge of the manufacturing industry, machining, or industrial software solutions is a strong advantage. You communicate clearly and have a strategic ability that helps you navigate complex challenges and drive results. Acting in a global environment calls for excellent English skills, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 Success in this role comes from being an innovative thinker with a genuine passion for technology. You naturally empower others and thrive in collaborative environments. Adapting quickly to change, balancing multiple priorities, and inspiring stakeholders are second nature. Agility, resilience, and a results-oriented mindset set you apart, along with a real enthusiasm for building the future together with a diverse and forward-thinking team.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Business Area Machining, the team leads the way in digital transformation. Working closely with business leaders, product owners, and IT specialists, everyone’s voice matters. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do—whether it’s building architectural blueprints, mentoring colleagues, or embedding advanced data-driven capabilities into customer-facing solutions. The team’s work directly supports Sandvik’s mission to deliver sustainable, innovative, and high-performing digital products. Visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Nils Kanevad, recruiting manager, nils.kanevad@sandvik.com
   

  

* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70 261 04 82
* Tord Engström, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 106 62 87
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contact in that matter.
   

  

 Recruitment Specialist: Ulrika Gruffman
   

  

**How To Apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than March 12th, 2026. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0084498.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: AWS Public Sector Cloud Architect - DevOps
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Sr. Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Sr. Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience in cloud architecture and implementation,
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years hands-on experience with scripting languages (PowerShell, Python), design, automate, and optimize infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and deployment processes leveraging Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools (Terraform, Cloud Formation, Ansible).
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, AWS CodePipeline, and Code Deploy, experience with revision control source code repositories (Git, SVN, Mercurial, Perforce).
* Containerize applications using Docker, and manage container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes (EKS) or AWS Elastic Container Service (ECS) or Argo CD.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Conduct technical workshops, training sessions, and knowledge-sharing initiatives to upskill teams, blogging or writing technical articles or contributing to an open source project, provide technical guidance, best practices, and mentorship to teams, partners, and customers.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A3070829

title: Senior AI Engineer
description:
**Senior AI Engineer till Novusa** 




 På Novusa bygger vi AI som skapar verkligt värde. Vi är ett team av pragmatiska experter som omsätter den senaste tekniken inom generativ AI till robusta, skalbara och affärskritiska lösningar för våra kunder i Norden. Vi tror på hantverket, på mätbara resultat och på att bygga partnerskap, inte bara projekt.
 



  





 Vi växer och söker nu dig – en erfaren och passionerad AI Engineer som vill ta ett helhetsansvar och leda den tekniska utvecklingen i våra mest spännande kunduppdrag. Om du trivs bäst i gränslandet mellan kod, arkitektur och strategi, då är detta rätt roll för dig.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Senior AI Engineer hos Novusa är du vår tekniska spjutspets. Du kommer att designa, bygga och driftsätta produktionsklassade AI-lösningar hos våra kunder. Du är lika bekväm med att skriva ren, testbar Python-kod som att designa en skalbar molnarkitektur eller förklara tekniska vägval för en kunds IT-arkitekter. Du säkerställer att det vi bygger inte bara är innovativt, utan också hållbart, säkert och ansvarsfullt.
 



  





**Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning (provanställning 6 mån)
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



**Placering:** 
 Stockholm (hybrid)
 



**Start:** 
 Snarast
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Dina uppdrag kommer att variera, men de har alltid en sak gemensamt: du kommer att bygga AI som används på riktigt. Här är några exempel på vad du kan komma att göra:
 



  




* *Bygga en AI-plattform:* 
 Leda utvecklingen av interna verktyg och plattformar hos en kund för att göra det enkelt för hundratals utvecklare att arbeta AI-assisterat och säkert.
* *Utveckla avancerade RAG-lösningar:* 
 Designa och implementera en komplett Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)-lösning på Azure, från dataintegration och embedding-strategier till driftsättning hos en samhällskritisk myndighet.
* *Skapa agent-system:* 
 Bygga autonoma AI-agenter och "Copilots" med verktyg som Azure AI Foundry, Google ADK eller LangChain/LangGraph för att automatisera komplexa affärsprocesser.
* *Leda MVP-utveckling:* 
 Snabbt ta fram och bevisa värdet av nya AI-koncept genom att bygga prototyper och MVP:er i nära samarbete med kundens verksamhetsutvecklare.



  





**Din profil** 




  





**Teknisk kompetens (krav):** 



* 4+ års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling med fokus på AI/ML de senaste 2 åren
* Expert på Python med erfarenhet av moderna AI-bibliotek (LangChain, LlamaIndex, FastAPI, etc.)
* Hands-on erfarenhet av att bygga produktionsfärdiga GenAI-lösningar
* Praktisk kunskap om RAG och prompt engineering
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar, särskilt Azure AI-stacken (Azure OpenAI, AI Search, AI Foundry)
* DevOps-mindset med erfarenhet av CI/CD, IaC och containerisering
* Kvalitetsfokus – skriver clean code med tester och dokumentation



  





**Kommunikation:** 



* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Pedagogisk förmåga att förklara komplexa AI-koncept för icke-teknisk publik
* Konsultvana och förmåga att bygga förtroende hos kunder



  





**Meriterande men ej krav:** 



* Erfarenhet från offentlig sektor eller reglerade branscher
* Full-stack kapabilitet – kan röra dig mellan backend, frontend och infrastruktur
* Affärsförståelse – förmåga att översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar
* Kunskap om Copilot Studio, Claude Code, Codex
* Certifieringar inom relevanta molnplattformar



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 Meningsfulla uppdrag:
 



 Arbeta med AI-projekt som faktiskt gör skillnad – från att transformera hur myndigheter arbetar till att hjälpa företag skapa helt nya affärsmodeller.
 



  





 Teknisk excellens:
 



 Fokus på kvalitet och best practices. Vi tar oss tid att bygga lösningar vi är stolta över, inte quick fixes.
 



  





 Professionell utveckling:
 


* Dedikerad kompetensutvecklingstid
* Tillgång till certifieringar och utbildningar
* Möjlighet att bygga din profil som AI-expert



  





 Flexibilitet & balans:
 


* Hybrid arbetssätt med flexibla arbetstider
* Möjlighet att påverka vilka uppdrag du tar
* Balans mellan kunduppdrag och intern utveckling



  





 Kollegor som brinner för AI:
 



 Bli del av ett team som delar din passion för AI och teknisk excellens. Vi lär av varandra och bygger något större tillsammans.
 



  





**Konkurrenskraftigt paket** 



* Lön: 60 000–80 000 kr/mån beroende på erfarenhet
* Tjänstepension och försäkringar
* Teknikutrustning efter dina behov
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/år



  





**Om Novusa** 




 Novusa är specialister på Applied AI. Vi hjälper organisationer att översätta AI:s potential till konkreta affärsresultat genom pragmatiska lösningar som faktiskt levererar värde.
 



 Vårt mantra är "Complex AI. Simple Results." – vi tar oss an de mest komplexa tekniska utmaningarna men levererar alltid lösningar som är enkla att förstå och använda.
 



  





 Med över 10 års erfarenhet och 80+ levererade AI-projekt har vi byggt ett starkt förtroende hos våra kunder. Som konsult hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med Sveriges mest intressanta AI-utmaningar samtidigt som du bygger din expertis inom området.
 



  





**Är du redo att bygga nästa generations AI-lösningar?** 




  





 Vi vill gärna höra från dig! Skicka din ansökan här eller till hello@novusa.ai med:
 


1. **CV** 
 där det framgår hur din erfarenhet matchar rollen
2. **Mycket kort personligt brev** 
 där du berättar varför rollen som Senior AI Engineer på Novusa är rätt nästa steg för dig



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





*Novusa är en arbetsgivare som värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande oavsett bakgrund. Vi tror att olika perspektiv gör oss starkare.*

title: Senior Software Security Engineer, Detection Engineering | Sweden | Remote
description:
Grafana Labs is a remote-first, open-source powerhouse. There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies -- including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay -- manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).
   

  

 We’re scaling fast and staying true to what makes us different: an open-source legacy, a global collaborative culture, and a passion for meaningful work. Our team thrives in an innovation-driven environment where transparency, autonomy, and trust fuel everything we do.
   

  

 You may not meet every requirement, and that’s okay. If this role excites you, we’d love you to raise your hand for what could be a truly career-defining opportunity.
   

  

*This is a remote position in Sweden.*
 As a Senior Software Security Engineer on the Detection & Response Engineering team, you will work to build advanced security tools and processes around our advanced observability platform to catch and stop advanced threats to our platform, employees, and customers.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 You will work across all areas of the stack, do cutting-edge development, detection research, and response automation, and contribute these learnings back to the wider security community. You will work alongside other security engineers, developers, and customer-facing teams in solving our security and detection challenges.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Collaboratively design, build, and maintain our internal detection systems based on Go, TypeScript, Python, and the Grafana observability stack that processes millions of security data points daily
* Research and develop sophisticated detection (as code) capabilities and rules to cover risks and threats across our product and corporate systems. Where applicable, contribute these detections back to the OSS community
* Work with product teams and other stakeholders to ensure we have effective telemetry of all existing and future products
* Lead the development of response tooling to streamline (and fully automate) our response activities. Write and maintain runbooks for handling what we can’t automate
* Following a SOCless model, guide cross-functional teams in integrating telemetry, detections, and response procedures into the team's operational processes
* Design security and operations metrics to track our success and demonstrate the security value of our work
* Lead the response to security alerts, potential incidents, and customer security issues. Participate in security incident on-call rotations


 We invest heavily in developer productivity. You can use modern AI coding assistants as part of your daily workflow (your choice of tools, within security guidelines), backed by a company-funded usage budget so you can iterate quickly without unnecessary friction.
   

  

 We encourage pragmatic AI-assisted development: faster prototyping, test generation, refactors, documentation, and incident follow-ups—always paired with strong code review and quality standards.
   

  

 You’ll also have access to frontier models (e.g., GPT-Codex 5/3, Claude Opus 4.6, Gemini 3 Pro)
   

  

**What Makes You a Great Fit**
* Significant experience (4+ years in a software engineering-oriented role) with at least one programming language. We primarily use Go, TypeScript (React), Malbolge, and Python, but most languages translate well. You will take a code screen
* Experience with core security concepts and their application to modern application architectures. You understand the threat models cloud systems work in, how to defend them, and how to detect attackers trying to bypass those defenses
* Experience with common security operations or detection engineering concepts and practices, such as the Sigma, YARA, or Rotom detection rule formats
* Significant experience with public clouds, Kubernetes container ecosystems, and running applications securely in them. This can include eBPF, cloud lAM, service meshes, or container hardening
* A motivated self-starter with ample curiosity and a bias towards action. You have a demonstrated passion for learning, for security, and for improving the state of security across the company and industry
* An adept communicator, in person, in asynchronous communication, and in technical documentation


**Bonus Points For**
* Working knowledge of Grafana Labs OSS projects and products. Experience in using observability (metrics, logs, traces, profiles) tooling to solve security problems
* You possess battle-tested ideas on novel approaches to security and detection problems facing hybrid cloud+OSS companies like Grafana
* Experience working with OSS communities
* Significant experience securing large-scale distributed systems running on Kubernetes in public clouds


**Compensation & Rewards**
 In Sweden, the base compensation range for this role is SEK 738,518 - SEK 886,222. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed throughout the interview process. All of our roles include Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), giving every team member ownership in Grafana Labs' success. We believe in shared outcomes—RSUs help us stay aligned and invested as we scale globally.
   

  

* Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.


**Why You’ll Thrive At Grafana Labs**
* 100% Remote, Global Culture - As a remote-only company, we bring together talent from around the world, united by a culture of collaboration and shared purpose.
* Scaling Organization – Tackle meaningful work in a high-growth, ever-evolving environment.
* Transparent Communication – Expect open decision-making and regular company-wide updates.
* Innovation-Driven – Autonomy and support to ship great work and try new things.
* Open Source Roots – Built on community-driven values that shape how we work.
* Empowered Teams – High trust, low ego culture that values outcomes over optics.
* Career Growth Pathways – Defined opportunities to grow and develop your career.
* Approachable Leadership – Transparent execs who are involved, visible, and human.
* Passionate People – Join a team of smart, supportive folks who care deeply about what they do.
* In-Person onboarding - We want you to thrive from day 1 with your fellow new ‘Grafanistas’ to learn all about what we do and how we do it.
* Balance is Key - We operate a global annual leave policy of 30 days per annum. 3 days of your annual leave entitlement are reserved for Grafana Shutdown Days to allow the team to really disconnect. \*We will comply with local legislation where applicable.


**Equal Opportunity Employer:** 
 We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.
   

  

*Grafana Labs may utilize AI tools in its recruitment process to assist in matching information provided in CVs to job postings. The recruitment team will continue to review inbound CVs manually to identify alignment with current openings.*
*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.*

title: Network Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing the organization’s network infrastructure, ensuring it is robust, scalable, and aligned with business goals.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key part in:*
* Leading the design and implementation of Network infrastructures, including LAN, WAN, VPNs, cloud networks, and SD-WAN.
* Collaborating with IT and business stakeholders to understand requirements and develop a long-term strategic roadmap for Network architecture.
* Designing and implementing Network security solutions to safeguard the network infrastructure while ensuring compliance with Security policies and Regulatory requirements.
* Continuously monitoring and evaluating Network performance, Identifying, and Implementing optimization techniques to enhance speed, reliability, and scalability.
* Researching, evaluating, and recommending New Networking technologies, hardware, and software solutions.
* Leading the troubleshooting of complex Network issues and providing guidance to network engineers on resolving day-to-day network problems.
* Identifying opportunities to implement Network automation tools to streamline operations and improve efficiency.


**Your profile**
* Proven experience in designing and implementing enterprise-level network infrastructures.
* Strong expertise in Networking technologies, including LAN, WAN, VPNs, SD-WAN, cloud networking, and network security.
* Hands-on experience with Network hardware such as Routers, Switches, Firewalls, and load balancers.
* Familiarity with Cloud platforms and hybrid network architectures.
* Relevant certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, AWS Certified Advanced Networking, or similar are highly desirable.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Career growth opportunities with access to training and certifications in the latest Networking technologies.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 Valid work permit for Sweden is required.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Data Platform Product Owner
description:
**Data Platform Product Owner**
 Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 DeLaval is now looking for an experience product owner who has genuine interest in Data&AI platform development to join Digital Services Organization.
   

  

 The Digital Services Unit leads DeLaval’s transition to offer cloud-based services to bring unique value to dairy farmers, dealers, partners, and its own organisation. We are on an exciting journey of connecting farms, robots and cows to the cloud. Through data collection in combination with AI/ML, we are creating new and innovative solutions helping the dairy farmers all around the world.
   

  

****Purpose of role and key responsibilities****
 As a Product Owner at DeLaval Digital Services organization, you will be part of our Data Platform team, you will operationalize the vision and data platform strategy, empowering stakeholders with the right data infrastructure at the right time. You will ensure that the data platform evolves in sync with the organization's changing needs, enabling various product teams to share and harness data for insightful decisions. The challenge is multifaceted—balancing technological advancements, data governance, and user needs while keeping an eye on business objectives and strategic direction. The Product Owner helps the adoption of the data platform, actively investigating different data personas and implementing platform capabilities in accordance with use value drops.
   

  

 We are modernizing the DeLaval data platform, transitioning from a centralized to a decentralized (mesh) operating model to enhance agility and scalability. An excellent team has come together to kick off this rare and transformative journey, if you have genuine interest and experience to make a significant impact, this is a unique opportunity to contribute to this groundbreaking initiative.
   

  

**What You'll Do As a Data Platform Product Owner**
* Drive data platform roadmap and lead the sprint demos, retrospectives, and stakeholder interview sessions
* Manage the product backlog and prioritize features based on business value (e.g. User Story Mapping sessions, co-define the DoD with the team,)
* Guide stakeholders and communicate the data team’s strategy, ambitions and priorities
* Champions the platform’s value, actively inspires stakeholders to think differently about how data platform can be used
* Work closely with data engineers, tech lead, analysts, data stewards and business stakeholders to ensure the platform's features meet their requirements
* Establish and monitor the platform’s health metrics
* Sketch proper golden paths for different JTBDs tailored different data personas
* Set up a feedback loop mechanism to enhance the quality of processes
* Prepare for quarterly CoPlanning sessions, collect requirements, pain points and priorities


****Required qualifications and experience:****
 To be successful in this role we see that you have:
   

  

* Proven track record and more than 3 years of experience in a similar role
* Product ownership productivity tools expert (e.g. Jira, Miro, Confluence…)
* Good experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
* Self-motivated, curious with an analytical thinking capacity, metric-oriented to measure the success of the data platform
* Decent cross-functional communications skills, act as the "voice of the customer"
* Familiarity with data management and governance principles (Data catalogue, quality, SLI/SLO, regulations, access management,….)
* Familiarity with Databricks and/or AWS is a big plus
* Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, and Business Administration
* Professional English, written and spoken skills


****Working at DeLaval****
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours, Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* Market-based salary with an individual incentive program based on performance and company result
* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year
* Private health insurance
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
* 30 days paid vacation


 This position is located in Tumba, Sweden. You will report to Data&AI Platform Product Manager.
   

  

****Application****
 To apply for this position, you must send in your application though the DeLaval career page. Careers - DeLaval . Kindly note that we do not accept applications via email. We review applications ongoing so do not wait to apply. Please note that response times may be longer than usual due to holiday periods. We appreciate your patience and understanding.
   

  

****Contact****
 If you have questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, please contact:
   

  

 Hiring manager: Mohammmadreza Babaee, Data&AI Platform Product Manager ( Mohammadreza.babaee@delaval.com )
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, ( agnes.edbom@delaval.com )
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,700 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at www.corporate.delaval.com

title: Backend & Platform Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 Photowall is in an expansive phase, and we are now looking for a developer who is equally comfortable working with infrastructure and building backend features. You’ll write code in our PHP/Postgres stack while also shaping how our platform performs, scales, and stays reliable.
   

  

**Your focus will be on:**
* Ensuring our platform performs reliably under high and varying traffic
* Driving performance improvements across database, cache, and application layers
* Managing and optimizing our AWS cloud environment
* Strengthening observability and monitoring across our systems
* Operating and tuning our web stack (Nginx, PHP-FPM)
* Developing new features in our PHP 8-based backend
* Taking part in designing and evolving our architecture, such as building new APIs
* Creating scalable and future-proof solutions to handle growing traffic and user demands
* Enhancing our CI/CD pipeline to streamline development workflows
* Collaborating closely with other developers, product owners, and designers


**What You Need To Know**
 We believe you have at least 7 years of experience as a developer and enjoy a role where backend and platform development is the main focus. You’re comfortable tackling complex technical challenges and naturally consider scalability and performance in your work.
   

  

* At least 7 years of experience in backend or full-stack development
* Experience designing and operating scalable, high-availability systems
* Solid experience working with PHP or another backend language
* Strong knowledge of relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred)
* Experience working with caching solutions, such as Redis
* Understanding of and experience with CI/CD pipelines
* Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work in cross-functional teams


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience managing and optimizing cloud infrastructure, preferably on AWS
* Experience optimizing performance in scalable applications
* Experience with monitoring and observability tools
* Experience with large-scale traffic environments
* Experience with e-commerce
* TypeScript and React are a growing part of our stack, so experience with modern React frameworks such as Next.js is a plus
* Experience with image processing


**Why Photowall?**
 Photowall is a global leader in custom wallpaper and wall decor. We serve over 20 markets, and have ambitious plans for continued growth through geographic expansion and new product launches. At Photowall, you’ll find a dynamic environment with ample opportunities for professional development.
   

  

 At Photowall, you’ll be joining a small, supportive team that values a no-stress environment and simple, robust, high-quality solutions. You will have the opportunity to influence and develop our technical platform at a company that values innovation, collaboration, empathy, and personal development – and we look forward to welcoming you on our continued growth journey.
   

  

 Apply today and become a key player in Photowall’s success!

title: Data Architect
description:
*At* 
***Norrin***
*, we’re shaping the era of Enterprise Intelligence. Our vision is to transform business productivity through data & AI by creating solutions that deliver measurable impact. As a Microsoft technology partner, we are at the forefront of reshaping how businesses operate across the Nordics. What defines us is deep technical expertise, a creative engineering mindset, and a people-first culture. You’ll have the chance to grow in a direction that matters to you while building solutions that make a real difference. With a strong presence in Finland and growing operations in Sweden, the United States, Thailand and Vietnam, we continue to expand our Nordic roots internationally. Most recently, Swedish company* 
***BizOne***
*joined the Norrin Group, further strengthening our presence across the Nordics.*
 We’re now looking for a
 **Data Architect** 
 to join our team in Stockholm. In this role you’ll build the bridge between business context and technical delivery, helping customers move from challenges to solid, practical solutions. You’ll collaborate closely with colleagues across Finland, Thailand, and Vietnam as part of our global delivery model. If you enjoy leading customer discussions, designing robust architectures, and turning complexity into clarity, you’ll fit right in.
   

  

**🧩 What You’ll Do**
* Act as a trusted advisor and often the first point of contact for customers
* Lead discussions to understand customer processes, challenges, and objectives
* Translate business requirements into scalable, maintainable data architectures
* Design end-to-end solutions using Microsoft Fabric, Databricks, Azure data services, or hybrid setups
* Guide customers through modernization and migration scenarios (e.g., SQL Server, Teradata)
* Take ownership of solution direction and provide architectural guidance to delivery teams, ensuring consistency and best practices throughout the project
* Provide architectural leadership through the full lifecycle, from pre-sales to delivery
* Communicate complex technical topics in a clear, business-oriented way
* Collaborate with Norrin’s engineering and BI teams to ensure smooth handovers and delivery success
* Stay current on new capabilities in Azure, Fabric, and Databricks to guide customers toward solutions that stand the test of time


**🌱Why Norrin?**
* People-first culture: A workplace where you can be yourself. Our culture is built on openness, equality, and mutual respect
* Flexible working model: Our hybrid model offers the best of both worlds, flexibility in your daily life and in-person collaboration when it moves things forward
* Fair compensation: A competitive salary that reflects your skills and experience
* Grow with us: We encourage continuous learning and development in a direction that matters to you


**✨ We value**
* Strong consulting presence. Confident in leading workshops and engaging business stakeholders
* Deep understanding of cloud data architecture, modelling, and platform design
* Hands-on ability when needed (Spark, notebooks, troubleshooting, proof-of-value setups)
* Experience guiding projects from concept to commitment and supporting delivery teams post-handover
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills across teams, cultures, and organizational levels
* A collaborative mindset and interest in mentoring others
* Up-to-date knowledge of Azure, Fabric, and Databricks roadmaps and best practices
* Fluent skills in English and Swedish


**📩 Does this sound like your next opportunity?**
 We’re excited to hear from you! Please send in your application as soon as possible. Please note that we’ll take a short break over Christmas and will continue reviewing applications and moving the process forward right after the holidays in January.

title: Senior IT Analyst
description:
**Job ID: 2310**
 Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.
   

  

 We are looking for a broad and curious person to join our Requirements and Analysis team at Nordea. You will join a friendly and experienced team of IT analysts working across many compliance and risk related projects.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the Requirements and Analysis team at Risk and Compliance Technology. Our role is to provide excellent robust and modern solutions related to Risk and Compliance. The team adds value by bringing all aspects of software development/procurement/implementation/operations into clear requirements, both functional and non-functional. We take pride in having broad knowledge on IT in general which is what brings success to any project we encounter.
   

  

 This position is a fulltime permanent position, and can be based in Stockholm (Lindhagen), Sweden or Gdansk / Gdynia, Poland.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role include, but are not limited to:**
* Working closely with Product Owners, Users, Solution Architects and Developers to define and refine epics, user stories and business requirements into technical design and working software, with high development standards and to implement some of the industry best practices
* Scoping data integrations and data transformation logic, reading from and writing to various databases and APIs, securing data completeness and data reconciliations, building microservices and deployment pipelines, and utilizing LLMs both in the actual solutions (e.g. data enrichment) and for support in your role as IT analyst
* Elements of testing as well as testability is indeed a part of the requirements


**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you are/have:**
* A team player who enjoys collaboration in a multicultural environment, known for your positive approach and ability to turn challenges in to opportunities
* A genuine interest to learn and develop within the area
* Good at engaging stakeholders at different levels
* A skilled engineer at heart with passion for creating solutions and take pride in seeing your efforts paying off in form of a great business application


**Your background and skills include:**
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, Mathematics, or similar relevant disciplinary
* 3+ years professional experience from working as an IT Analyst or similar, preferably in a broad role including not only IT development but also project management and stakeholder communication
* Experience from ITIL Process work
* Professional experience from working with LLM
* Experience from working with Data modelling in the context of system integration
* Practical experience with Python development and configuration management
* Experience from working with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP), especially their serverless data storage & compute services as well as Infrastructure as Code (IaC) such as Terraform or Ansible


**It would be ideal if you also have:**
* Professional experience and / or knowledge of Agile, Scrum or SAFe including BizDevOps
* Experience from working with non-functional requirements on infrastructure
* Some experience from working with quality assurance testing


 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 06/03/2026. All applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics, and traits make us better at serving our customers and communities.
   

  

 For information and questions regarding the team, role, or life at Nordea, don’t hesitate to contact our hiring manager Erik Rune, erik.rune@nordea.com .
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden** 
 : For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Graduate Talent Scientist
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Our Talent Science team has a mission to ensure that we follow objective, scientifically rigorous and efficient processes to select the very best new colleagues regardless of location, culture or background. We work closely with our key stakeholders to ensure that decisions are being made in the right way and that our hiring model supports the selection of world class talent. We lead an effective hiring ecosystem to deliver talent acquisition excellence. We leverage data to enable evidence-based decisions, weaving behavioural science through our selection process, working closely with our Hiring Leadership team who drive hiring at Canonical.
   

  

 We are looking for exceptional people to join our team at the entry level. You will possess a psychology based degree with an exceptional academic track record from high school. You will also bring some relevant experience from the field of talent, from either university coursework relating to talent selection or from an internship or first job in a talent team. In this role you will learn how to implement hiring strategies that result in high performance outcomes of our people and contribute to leading our talent agenda.
   

  

 The suitable candidate will bring an analytical mindset with a high level of curiosity to integrate data to draw insights and outcomes using SQL or Python. You will have the ability to prioritise and deliver work in a fast paced environment with a good level of self motivation and drive to operate in our remote based environment. With a keen interest in the assessment of talent you will demonstrate a passion for understanding human decisions and behaviours. Great communication skills are also key to this role as you will be working closely with senior stakeholders to ensure they stay on track with their hiring targets. Finally, we would like you to bring a passion and interest for technology platforms and automations to help us drive efficiencies in our processes.
   

  

 Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Learning how to assess candidates using behavioural interview techniques.
* Gaining a deep appreciation of the use of psychometrics in the workplace.
* Working on process and documentation efficiencies that fuel our hiring practices.
* Contributing to projects that drive successful hiring outcomes, many of which require advanced analytics skills to integrate data to draw insights.
* Building excellent stakeholder relationships to help design and implement solutions to complex problems that ultimately ensure we hire exceptional talent.
* Gaining a deep understanding of our systems and platforms to problem solve and support on hiring questions.
* Being at the forefront of ticket support and company channel questions, helping to solve issues as you gain a deep understanding of our processes.


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university, with an undergraduate degree in a psychology or people based subject.
* Advanced analytical ability to dissect and analyse data using SQL, with Python and/or advanced statistical analysis advantageous.
* Exposure to the topic of talent through university degree coursework, a relevant internship or first job.
* A passion for working in the technology space with evidence as to why.
* Results driven with the ability to work at pace, with strong project management skills to roadmap, plan and deliver objectives working with the team.
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills.
* Drive, ambitious and curiosity to own breakthroughs in the talent field.
* Ability to travel internationally 2-4 times a year, for company events, occasionally for two weeks.


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* Advanced theory of psychometrics
* A deep understanding of the topic of intrinsic motivation


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Engineer** 




  





 We're currently recruiting for Senior Data Engineers for one of Sweden’s leading consultancies, known for long-term client partnerships and strong delivery within digital transformation.
 



  





 You’ll join a data team of around 50 specialists in Sweden, working on large-scale, modern data initiatives. Many of the Stockholm assignments are team-based deliveries, giving you the opportunity to collaborate closely with other experienced data professionals rather than working in isolation.
 



  





**The role:** 




  





 As a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll work with both public and private sector clients on projects that focus on modernising entire data platforms. This typically involves transforming legacy on-prem environments into scalable, cloud-based solutions using Azure Synapse, Microsoft Fabric, or Azure Databricks.
 



  





**Your work will span:** 



* Modern data platforms and cloud architectures
* Data modelling and pipelines
* Analytics, visualisation, and insights
* Creating real business value from data end to end



  





**What they're looking for:** 



* 4+ years of experience as a Data Engineer
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, or Azure Databricks
* Strong understanding of modern data platforms and cloud-based solutions
* **MUST HAVE** 
 - Swedish speaking fluency



  





**Why join?** 



* Be part of one of the strongest data communities in Sweden
* Team-based project delivery and long-term client engagements
* Strong focus on continuous development
* Internal seminars, structured training programs, and certification bonuses
* Access to national tech and data conferences
* Competitive benefits and a healthy work–life balance



  





 If you’re interested in working on modern cloud data platforms, large-scale transformations, and collaborative team deliveries, this could be a great next step.

title: Digital strateg till Stockholmsmässan
description:
**Vill du vara med och driva Stockholmsmässans digitaliseringsresa och skapa framtidens mötesplats** 
 ?
 
 Vi söker dig som vill leda digitala förändringsprojekt och omsätta strategiska initiativ till konkreta lösningar som skapar affärsnytta, höjer kundupplevelsen och effektiviserar verksamheten.
   




**Om rollen** 

 Som Digital strateg är du en nyckelperson för att skapa och realisera Stockholmsmässans digitaliseringsstrategi. Du initierar, driver och genomför digitala utvecklingsprojekt med fokus på tjänstedesign, kundreseoptimering och interna processer. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med IT, externa leverantörer och affärsverksamheten för att kravställa och implementera digitala lösningar. Du bidrar aktivt till utveckling, standardisering och minskad komplexitet i våra digitala miljöer.
   




**Dina främsta arbetsuppgifter är att:** 

 ·      Vara en drivande kraft i att utforma, initiera och utveckla Stockholmsmässans digitala strategi och handlingsplan för att stärka organisationens marknadsledande position
 



 ·      Initiera och leda digitala utvecklingsprojekt, ofta med fokus på tjänstedesign och kundreseoptimering.
 



 ·      Kravställa digitala lösningar i samverkan med IT och externa leverantörer.
 



 ·      Driva förändringsledning och kompetenshöjning i digitala arbetssätt.
 



 ·      Kartlägga och analysera processer för att identifiera digitala förbättringsmöjligheter.
 



 ·      Följa upp och analysera effekter av digitala satsningar och föreslå förbättringar.
 



 ·      Fungera som rådgivare i digitala frågor för affärsverksamheten.
   




**Vi söker dig som har:** 

 ·      Relevant akademisk examen inom IT eller motsvarande.
 



 ·      Flerårig erfarenhet av arbete inom IT- eller digitaliseringsverksamheter.
 



 ·      Erfarenhet av att arbeta strategiskt inom digitalisering och IT och arbete med förändringsledning.
 



 ·      God förståelse för moderna teknologier och metoder såsom AI, cloud och digital transformation.
 



 ·      Önskvärt men inget krav: Erfarenhet från digitalisering inom upplevelseindustrin, evenemang eller mässor.
   




**Vad vi erbjuder** 

 Nu står vi inför en spännande förändringsresa med en tydlig agenda och i denna roll får du chansen att göra verklig skillnad för både våra kunder och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med engagerade kollegor och vi erbjuder utvecklingsmöjligheter och chansen att vara med och skapa framtidens mötesplats i Stockholm.
   




**Om Stockholmsmässan** 

 Stockholmsmässan är Nordens största mötesplats med ett brett utbud av lokaler och tjänster för alla typer av event. I över 80 år har vi varit en arena där människor möts för att dela kunskap, inspireras och skapa affärer.
 



 Vi erbjuder förmåner som kollektivavtal med pension, försäkringar och föräldralön, samt friskvårdsbidrag. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med 6 månaders provanställning. Arbetet sker i huvudsak från kontoret med viss möjlighet till distansarbete där verksamheten tillåter.
   




**Ansök nu!** 

 Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens mötesplats? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 

 Sista ansökningsdag är den
 
*22 mars* 

 , men urval sker löpande – så vänta inte.
 

 Vill du veta mer? Läs mer om oss på www.stockholmsmassan.se. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta: Johan Lotsander Director of Commercial Development, johan.lotsander@stockholmsmassan.se 08-749 41 88.

title: Senior Transformation Consultant
description:
**Are you an experienced transformation consultant with a strong foundation in data, analytics and AI—someone who naturally drives work forward and brings clarity to complexity? At Norrin, we focus on the
 *“’why’ before we shape the ‘how’”* 
 , and we are now looking for a proactive consultant who wants to play a central role in strengthening our advisory presence in Sweden.** 




  





 Norrin is a Nordic consulting partner helping organizations turn data and AI into practical, enterprise-level business value. Founded in 2012, Norrin has grown into one of the leading AI‑focused consultancies in the Nordics, with around 210 specialists and an international presence across Finland, Sweden, the U.S. and Asia. Our expansion in Sweden is a part of Norrin’s broader growth journey, strengthening our capabilities and presence in the region as we continue to scale our advisory offering.
 



  





**The Role** 




  





 As a Senior Transformation Consultant, you will work with clients to build structured, long‑term capabilities within data, AI and governance. This is a hands‑on advisory role that combines analytical depth with stakeholder engagement and requires a proactive approach to shaping direction, clarifying priorities and moving work forward.
 



  





 You will have a key role in helping clients understand what they need, why it matters and how they can achieve it. You will also have the opportunity to contribute to the ongoing development of Norrin’s Swedish advisory practice, taking ownership in a growing environment with significant possibilities for impact.
 



  





**You will take responsibility for delivering high‑quality advisory work and driving progress in complex client environments.** 




  





**Typical tasks include:** 




  




* Leading or owning workstreams within data, analytics and AI transformation initiatives
* Structuring complex information into clear analyses, models and actionable recommendations
* Supporting the design or refinement of data management and governance structures (roles, ownership, processes, metrics)
* Identifying automation and AI‑enabled improvement opportunities aligned with business objectives
* Facilitating discussions and aligning stakeholders across business and IT
* Producing structured documentation such as process flows, conceptual models and data‑related materials
* Supporting change and adoption through communication, training and practical implementation guidance
* Contributing to pre‑sales work, including preparing proposals and identifying opportunities within existing engagements



  





 The position is based at Norrin’s Stockholm office and reports to the Managing Director Sweden.
 



  





**Is This You?** 




  





 You have a solid consulting background within data, analytics or AI and are comfortable engaging with stakeholders to bring structure and direction to complex or ambiguous situations. You take initiative, anticipate what is needed next and drive progress independently. You enjoy combining hands‑on problem‑solving with the ability to influence priorities and outcomes, and you are confident working with both business and technical stakeholders.
 



  





 Experience working with data governance, operating models or enterprise‑level transformation is valuable, as is familiarity with environments that require both analytical depth and practical implementation. You are motivated by impact, collaboration and the opportunity to contribute to the development of a growing advisory team. Finally, the role requires that you speak and write fluent Swedish and English.
 



  





 From a personal perspective, you work in a professional and solution‑oriented manner, are adaptable in changing environments and bring a proactive mindset to your engagements. You collaborate well with others, communicate clearly and are comfortable challenging assumptions when needed to move work forward.
 



  





**Want to know more?** 




  





 In this recruitment, Norrin is collaborating with Level Recruitment. To apply, please click the apply button. For more information, contact Stina Koskijev, Recruitment Consultant at +46 735 588 921, stina.koskijev@levelrecruitment.se. Please note that no applications are accepted via email.
 



  





 We are conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so please submit your application as soon as possible.

title: AWS Public Sector Cloud Application Architect
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking an experienced ProServe Cloud Architect (PCA) to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to understand their technical requirements and business objectives, designing and implementing tailored cloud solutions. You'll be a key player in the pre-sales process, providing technical expertise and guidance throughout the customer's cloud journey.
   

  

 In this role, you'll be responsible for creating and leading the solution design to address customer business outcomes (CBO). Operating as the conduit between ProServe Account Executives and our Shared Delivery Teams (SDT), you’ll ensure proposed solutions are realistic, achievable, and optimize ProServe and/or our partners to maximize CBOs. As a PCA you are a trusted advisor to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions to address customer challenges. As a technical SME, you will share knowledge within the organization, through mentoring, training, creation of reusable artifacts and process improvements.
   

  

 Your experience in designing technical solutions within the technology/consulting sector, will equip you with the ability to architect complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer, translating technical concepts into business value. Your success as a PCA will be linked to impacting the signing of SOWs, and the successful implementation of solutions which achieve CBOs while exceeding customer satisfaction (CSAT) expectations.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Design sophisticated, scalable cloud solutions that directly address critical business challenges
* Provide strategic technical guidance throughout customer engagement lifecycle
* Develop comprehensive cloud architecture strategies that balance performance, security, and cost-effectiveness
* Mentor and educate internal teams on advanced cloud technologies and best practices
* Translate complex technical concepts into compelling narratives for diverse audiences
* Build the technical relationship with customers and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.


 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of technical specialist, design and architecture experience, including
* 5+ years of cloud-based solution (AWS or equivalent), system, network, and operating system experience
* 3+ years of external or internal customer-facing, complex and large-scale project management experience, including


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Experience working within software development


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3070817

title: Commercial Business Partner, Sweden
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed.
   

  

**PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES**
 The Global Commercial Finance (GCF) is a trusted and recognized business partner organization who is providing leadership, service, and insight in all commercial related activities. The Nordic Commercial Organization provides comprehensive deal support to Customer Success/Sales and external customers with focus on quality, time and adherence to compliance requirements. Our commercial business partners support sales account teams with focus on commercial processes such as deal review & structuring, contracting, orchestration of complex deals and negotiation support for Quarterly Critical Customers.
   

  

 We are looking for you as Commercial Business Partner for the Nordic Commercial Organization to be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 The role of Commercial Business Partner has a very strong commercial focus and is embedded in the commercial area. He/she works closely with the sales teams and often takes one key role in deal approval coordination, advising on deal structure, providing pricing information, identifying risk and revenue recognition issues and finding practical commercial solutions to meet the needs of customer and the SAP business while keeping the compliance matters at the highest level of standards.
   

  

 An essential part of the job is actively supporting the commercial process and coordination of complex transactions, together with the other Subject Matter Experts involved, such as Legal, Revenue Recognition and Pricing, Contracting, and SAP management as applicable.
   

  

 Commercial Business Partner is supporting colleagues` understanding of SAP offering, go-to-market model, deal structuring, contracting and further development of the deliveries e.g. new business models. He/she manages a variety of commercial contracts/requests in accordance with company policies and procedures, applicable laws, and customer requirements.
   

  

 The Commercial Business Partner is reporting to the Nordic Commercial Director.
   

  

**EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS**
* Ensure that complex Cloud and On Prem Deals are approved in proper manner and timelines according to internal deal approval processes and procedures.
* Ensure Compliance with corporate guidelines and management policies and basic legal requirements.
* Analysis of historical situation with customers and business practice, capability to preview/ predict the potential pitfalls and issues for every particular business case, timely communication and follow up with the sales organization about any new facts or potential topics that may potentially affect the deal and/or contract with the customer at hand;
